António Magaiza M. was born in the district of Manhiça in the province of Maputo. He is 44, married, and the father of 2 children who are 17 and 12. Both of them go to school. He only studied through the 1st grade and didn't continue because he lost his parents very early. He lives in his own home and supports one nephew who lost his mother. He left Manhiça for the district of Boane in 1969 because he changed jobs. He previously decided to build his home and to start a family in Boasne. He has had his own business for 19 years. He sells basic goods from 7 a.m. to 7 p.m. with the help of his wife. He manages to make around 1,000 meticais a day and saves some every month in his bank account. He has never had a loan with another financial institution. He became familiar with Hluvuku through his neighbor who also is a client of the institution. This is his third loan and it is for 25,000 meticais. He will use it to buy basic goods for his business (sugar, margarine, rice, etc.). His previous credits were for 10,000 and 15,000 meticais, which were both used for the same purpose. In the future, he hopes to request more credits to be able to expand the growing area of his small farm and to reinforce his products for his business to respond to his customers' demand.

Translated from Portuguese by Tanya Harper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy and sell products (rice, sugar, etc.)

loans.name: Vincentia

texts.en: Vincentia is forty six years old. She is married and has five children who are all currently in school. Vincentia is a resourceful mother and works hard with the motivation of supporting her children’s education, and to provide them with better life opportunities in future. She sells corn dough, cassava dough and maize. Corn dough is a milled maize grain mixed with water and is used to prepare local meals like banku and porridge. She also supplies maize to her loyal customers on credit. She wants to use the loan to buy more bags of maize and cassava to increase her production of corn and cassava dough. She hopes to double her profits so she can add the sale of beans and soya beans to increase her income.

loans.use: To purchase maize and cassava in bulk.

loans.name: Mujeres Luchadoras La Esperanza Group

texts.en:
This committee was formed through the initiative of Mrs. Graciela C. and Ms. Margarita O. in the city of Coronel Oviedo, by joining the Program Committee of Women Entrepreneurs. 18 women joined the group with a shared goal to working to grow and progress. They are independent in their work as street vendors selling clothes, food, working as seamstresses, running pantries, selling meat, ice cream, and working as manicurists and pedicurists. 
The average loan is 300,000 Gs., which the women invest in purchasing milk, sugar, flour, eggs, noodles, meat, fruit, vegetables, cassava, soft drinks, candy, jeans, skirts, shirts, fabric, thread, buttons, and nail polish. 
For example, Ms. Martina S., who has been a tailor and seamstress for over 10 years, has opened a small shop to provide her clientele with more services and thus earn more profit through specialized activity. She needs a loan to buy thread, scissors, buttons, higher quality fabrics, zippers, embroidery items, as capital investment to get her business off the ground. 
Each woman in the committee devotes herself to her independent activities, while working with the other members to cooperate and lead their group in the correct direction to achieve their shared goals.

loans.use: Merchandise

loans.name: Janet

texts.en: Janet is sixty years old. She is married and has seven children. All of her children have completed school and are currently working. She loves selling goods, the business that is the source of her livelihood. She has been selling fried yams and potatoes for about twenty years. She has her stock of yams delivered from farmers who supply her directly. This enables her to avoid middlemen, who would buy from the farmers and re-sell to her at higher prices. With this loan, she wants to buy yams and potatoes in bulk to serve her customers. She hopes to use part of her profit to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase yams and potatoes in bulk

loans.name: Caetano Joaquim

texts.pt:
Caetano Joaquim J. nasceu no Distrito de Chiringoma, na Província de Sofala, centro de Moçambique, tem 45 anos de idade, casado e pai de 1 filho de 14 anos de idade, a estudar na escola Primaria completa dos antigos combatentes. Fez somente 7ª classe, parou quando foi incorporado ao serviço militar obrigatório. Vive na casa própria com a sua família e não sustenta mais ninguém.

Saiu de Sofala para Província de Tete como militar em 1980, mais tarde sai de Tete para Maputo por uma transferência do Ministério da Defesa. Depois de desmobilizado, decidiu continuar como quadro deste Ministério, trabalha como administrativo no estado-maior general a mais de 15 anos e faz 8 horas por dia. Tem um salário mensal de 11.346.80 por mes e poupa algum no banco comercial Millennium Bim.

Nunca solicitou empréstimos em outros bancos, conheceu a Hluvuku através do oficial de crédito afecto na sucursal da Catembe (Zélia Massinga). Este é o seu 4º empréstimo no valor de 20.000.00mt com o qual pretende comprar material de construção (cimento, ferro, fechaduras, tintas etc.) para a conclusão da sua obra. Os empréstimos anteriores foram de 8.000.00mt, 10.000.00mt e 20.000.00mt todos para a mesma actividade.

Futuramente gostaria de solicitar mais empréstimos para iniciar uma outra obra fora do Distrito de Boane, como garantia de seu futuro.
texts.en:
Caetano Joaquim J. was born in the district of Chiringoma in the province of Sofala in the center of Mozambique. He is 45, is married, and has one son who is 14. After he finished primary school, he completed two military terms. He only studied through the 7th grade and stopped when he was drafted for obligatory military service. He lives in his own home with his family and doesn't support anyone else besides them. He left Sofala for the province of Tete when he was in the military in 1980. He later left Tete for Maputo because of a transfer to the Ministry of Defense. After he left the military, he decided to continue working for the Ministry of Defense. He has worked as an administrator for the state major general for more than 15 years and works 8 hours a day. He has a monthly salary of 11,346.80 meticais and saves some in a commercial bank called Millennium Bim. He has never requested a loan from another bank. He became familiar with Hluvuku through a credit official from the Catembe branch (Zélia Massinga). This is his 4th loan and it is for 20,000 meticais. He will use it to purchase construction materials (cement, iron, locks, paint, etc.) to finish building his home. His previous loans were for 8,000, 10,000, and 20,000 meticais and were all used for the same activity. In the future, he would like to request more loans to start building another home outside the district of Boane to guarantee his future.

Translated from Portuguese by Tanya Harper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of construction materials (locks, cement, etc.)

loans.name: Reyna

texts.es:
La socia REYNA pertenece al banco comunal “MERCAMUEBLE” y vive en la ciudad Imperial del Cusco. 

La socia tiene 20 años de edad, es conviviente, tiene dos hijos dos varones. El mayor estudia en el jardín y el menor es aun un bebe. Ella tiene un taller de fabricación y venta de muebles.  

Ella alterna sus actividades del hogar con la fabricación de muebles como escritorios, roperos, sillas, mesas, camas, etc. Ella ayuda a su esposo que es carpintero, con la fabricación de muebles. Ella tiene un stand de venta de muebles en el mercado “MERCAMUEBLES” ubicado en el primer paradero del distrito de San Sebastián de la provincia del Cusco. Ya son varios años con esta actividad y le ido muy bien gracias a todo el empeño que pone en su trabajo.
       
La socia requiere el préstamo para aumentar el capital del negocio de fabricación y venta de muebles, ella quiere comprar más materia prima (madera) y materiales para el acabado del muebles como tiner, laca, lijar, cola de carpintero, etc. 

La socia se encuentra agradecido por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.


La socia se encuentra agradecido por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Reyna belongs to the Mercamueble Communal Bank. She lives in the Imperial city of Cusco. She is 20, in a common law marriage, and has two sons. The oldest is in preschool, and the youngest is still a baby. She has a shop where she makes and sells furniture. She alternates her activities between the home and making furniture like desks, wardrobes, chairs, tables, and beds, etc. She helps her husband, a carpenter, make the furniture. She has a furniture selling stand in the Mercamuebles Market, which is located at the first bus stop in the San Sebastián province of Cusco. She has been doing this for many years. It has gone very well for her thanks to all of the effort she puts into her work. She needs a loan to increase the capital in her business of making and selling furniture. She wants to buy raw material (wood) and materials like thinner, shellac, sandpaper, and glue, etc. for finishings the furniture. She is grateful for the opportunity of the loan, and she promises to pay it back on time.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase capital in her business of making and selling furniture

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary is a sixty-two-year-old woman. She is a widow and has six children. All six have completed school and are currently working. She prepares and sells pastries to the working community and at bus stops in her community. She wants to use the loan to buy more flour, margarine, vegetable oil, etc. to increase her stock to avoid price hikes. This, she believes, will decrease her cost very significantly to enable her to raise good income to support her grandchildren.

loans.use: To purchase flour, margarine, and oil in bulk

loans.name: Attah

texts.en: Attah is 40 years old. He is married and has three kids who are currently at school. He trades in maize. He travels to the northern part of the country to buy his stock of maize and sells to his customers. He requests a loan to buy an increased stock of maize to grow his business and scale up sales. He hopes to increase his savings to support the children’s education and give them better future career opportunities.

loans.use: To purchase maize in bulk.

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
Beatrice N. is 21 years old and married to Daniel Muturi. She owns a video showroom in Mshomoroni and has been able to entertain residents, mainly the youth and children in her area for one year now. Beatrice joined KADET recently and is now accessing her first loan to improve her business. She plans to purchase and install a DSTV decoder and to refurbish her wall's showroom with the money. Beatrice also has a grocery store in Mshomoroni that has helped her supplement her income. She hopes to grow her businesses and to become a leading business lady in Mombasa.


About KADET:
The Kenya Agency for the Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) is dedicated to economically empower her clients by providing financial services to improve living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Kenya. KADET is the microfinance subsidiary of World Vision Kenya. Obtain more information on KADET from the website: www.kadet.co.ke

loans.use: To purchase and install a DSTV decoder and to refurbish her wall's showroom.

loans.name: Joao  Baptista

texts.pt:
João Batista M. nasceu na cidade de Maputo, capital de Moçambique, tem 55 anos de vida, casado e pai 4 filhos de 32, 28, 20 e 19 anos de idade, destes 3 já tem suas próprias casas. Fez 4ª classe do antigo sistema de educação, não continuou porque seus pais não tinham condições financeiras para levarem alem os seus estudos. Vive na casa própria, sustenta a sua mãe e netos que vivem com ele.

Saiu do Bairro Central na cidade de Maputo para Boane com a sua família em 1974 para iniciar uma nova vida. É comerciante e dono de seu negocio há mais de 20 anos. Trabalha com a sua esposa das 8h as 18horas todos os dias. Vende mais cerveja e refrescos onde consegue um rendimento de cerca de 5.000.00mt a 6.000.00mt por mês e poupa algum na sua conta bancária.

Nunca solicitou empréstimos em outros bancos, conheceu a Hluvuku através de seus amigos. Este é o seu 4º crédito no valor de 20.000.00mt com o qual pretende comprar produtos (refrescos, vinhos, cerveja e outros) para o seu estabelecimento. Os empréstimos anteriores foram de 8.000.00mt, 10.000.00mt e 13.000.00mt, todos para a mesma actividade.

Deseja com este empréstimo responder a necessidades de seus clientes, futuramente deseja solicitar a mais créditos para ampliar o seu estabelecimento comercial.
texts.en:
João Batista M. was born in the city of Maputo, the capital of Mozambique. He is 55; married; and the father of 4 children who are 32, 28, 20, and 19. Three of them have their own homes. He studied through the 4th grade of the old education system and didn't continue because his parents didn't have the financial resources to keep paying for his school. He lives in his own home and supports his mother and his grandchildren that live with him. He left the central neighborhood in the city of Maputo for Boane with his family in 1974 to start a new life. He is a merchant and has owned his own business for more than 20 years. He works with his wife from 8 a.m. to 6 p.m. every day. He sells beer and soft drinks and earns a monthly income of around 5,000 to 6,000 meticais. He saves some of it in his bank account. He has never requested a loan from another bank. He became familiar with Hluvuku through some friends. This is his 4th loan, and it is for 20,000 meticais. He will use it to purchase products (soft drinks, wine, beer, etc.) for his business. His previous loans were for 8,000, 10,000, and 13,000 meticais, and they were all used for the same purpose. He would like to use this loan to meet the needs of his customers. In the future he hopes to request more credits to expand his business location.

Translated from Portuguese by Tanya Harper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy and sell soft drinks and alcoholic beverages

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en: Joyce is 58 years old. She is married and has five children. She is really industrious and she works with the motivation of supporting her children’s education to provide them with a better opportunity in life in the future. At the moment, only her last child is in school.  The rest have completed school and are working. She is a trader and trades in pepper, cooking oil and rice. She wants to use the loan to buy more bags of rice, cooking oil, and pepper to increase her stock of goods.

loans.use: To purchase foodstuffs in bulk.

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en: Victoria is 50 years old. She is divorced and has four children who are all currently working. She is a petty trader who trades in yams, dried fish and firewood. Through this business, she has managed to put her children through school. She is, however, convinced that her business can grow better with increased capital and therefore wants a loan to buy more tubers of yams, baskets of tomatoes, onions, bags of maize, and beans to increase her stock and make a bigger income so she can put up a decent shelter.

loans.use: To purchase foodstuffs in bulk.

loans.name: Georgina

texts.en: Georgina is 52 years old. She is married and has seven children. Currently only two of her children are in school. The rest have completed school and are working. She is a petty trader who trades in foodstuffs such as tomatoes, egg plants, yam, pepper, plantain, dry fish, etc. Through this business, she has been able to provide for her family. She is, however, convinced that her business can grow better with increased capital and therefore wants a loan to buy more tubers of yams, baskets of tomatoes, onions, bags of maize and beans to increase her stock and make a bigger income to send her last two children to the university level.

loans.use: To purchase foodstuffs in bulk.

loans.name: Laurinda Joao

texts.pt:
Laurinda João M. nasceu no Distrito de Boane, Província de Maputo, tem 39 anos de idade, viúva e mãe de 4 filhos de 20, 17, 13 e 1 anos de idade, os mais velhos vão a escola. Fez somente 6ª classe, não continuou devido ao casamento pré maturo. Vive na casa própria com a sua família e sustenta 2 netos que vivem com ela.

Saiu de Moçambique para Suazilândia seguindo o seu marido que trabalhava naquele pais no ano de 1988. Após a morte do marido, regressou aos pais e iniciou uma actividade comercial. É comerciante e dona de seu próprio negocio, trabalha das 06h as 23h com ajuda dos seus filhos. Vende mais refrigerantes, vinhos e outros produtos de restaurante, consegue render cerca de 1.000.00 a 1.200.00mt por dia e poupa através de Xitique (sistema tradicional de poupança rotativa).

Já teve um empréstimo de 15.000.00mt na Associação Guê-Gue-Gue para o comércio, mais tarde conheceu a Hluvuku através de seus vizinhos e decidiu aproximar. Este é o seu 5º empréstimo nesta instituição no valor de 15.000.00mt com o qual pretende comprar produtos (refrigerantes, vinhos, Whisky, e outros) para reforçar a mercadoria do seu estabelecimento. Os empréstimos anteriores foram de 6.500.00mt, 10.000.00mt, 15.000.00 e 15.000.00mt para comércio e Habitação.

No futuro pretende solicitar novos empréstimos para desenvolver ainda mais o seu negócio e terminar a construção da sua residência.
texts.en:
Laurinda João M. was born in the distric of Boane, Maputo province. She is 39 years old, widow, and a mother of four children, who are 20, 17, 13 and 1 years old. The older go to school. She did only up to the 6th grade at school. She did not continue due to her marriage at young age. She lives in her own house with her family, and supports two grandchildren who live with her.

She left Mozambique to Suazilândia accompanying her husband, who used to work in that country in 1988. After her husband's death, she came back to her parents' house and started a trading activity. She is a trader and the owner of her business. She works from 6 a.m. to 11 p.m. with the help of her sons. She sells sodas, wine and other restaurant products. She is able to earn an income of MZN 1,000 to 1,200 a day, and she saves money through the traditional savings system called Xitique.

She had a loan of MZN 15,000 with the Associação Guê-Gue-Gue for her business. Later on, she learned about Hluvuki through her neighbors and decided to get in contact. This is her 5th loan with this institution, of MZN 15,000. With the loan, she intends to buy merchandise (sodas, wines, whisky and others) in order to improve her stock. The previous loans were of MZN 6,500; MZN 10,000; MZN 15,000; and MZN 15,000, for her business and for housing.

In the future, she intends to request new loans to develop even more her business, as well as to finish her house construction.


Translated from Portuguese by Giovanna Fernandes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy and selling of sodas, beverages and others

loans.name: Fumilayo

texts.en:
Fumilayo is 35 years old and married with three children. Her husband is a carpenter and he also supports the home.

Fumilayo sells groceries at retail prices and has been in this business for a long time. She is a hardworking woman and she is determined to lift her business and family above poverty.

This is the festive season and Fumilayo hopes to make more profits. She hopes for a loan of 50,000 NGN to purchase more groceries to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more groceries to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Increase the capital in her business of making and selling furniture

loans.name: Jennifer

texts.en:
Jennifer is thirty-one years old. She is married and has two children who are currently in school.

Jennifer is a trader who trades in sponges for all purposes. She sells at the big markets in Accra. She is, however, convinced that her business can grow better with increased capital and therefore wants the loan to buy more sponges to increase her stock. She believes your support would help her grow her business.

loans.use: To purchase assorted sponges in bulk

loans.name: Wilson Nyabwari

texts.en:
Wilson Nyabwari O., 30 years old, is married and has two children. He has sold utensils, cookery and household items for the last four years. His customers are walk-ins and the local customers near market stalls. He has no employees but does face strong competition from similar businesses.

Wilson is using the proceeds of the KES 20,000 loan to buy sufurias (pots), mugs and padlocks.

Apart from this business, Wilson also does subsistence farming. In the future, he wants to own a hardware store. He describes himself as hardworking and focused.

loans.use: To buy twelve sets of sufurias, ten dozen mugs and one box of padlocks

loans.name: Mujeres Victoriosas Group

texts.en: This committee was formed by Agustina R. and Lilian Agustina A., who gathered 20 working women who wanted to grow their businesses and improve their livelihoods. They are independent in their work as street vendors selling clothes and food, as seamstresses, owners of pantries, and traders in the market. They get an average credit of Gs.300.000 each, which they invest in their pursuits, including the purchase of chemicals for making cleaning products; natural products (such as vitamins and slimming and natural remedies); sugar, flour, eggs, noodles, and baking soda; meat, fruit and vegetables; clothes such as jeans, shirts, skirts, shirts and lingerie; cutlery; and accessories for embroidery, such as thread and other crafts.

loans.use: Merchandise

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en: Rebecca is 42 years old. She is divorced and has three children who are currently in school. She is a trader who trades in sponges for all purposes, She hawks to sell at the big markets in Accra. She is convinced that her business can grow better with increased capital and therefore wants the loan to buy more sponges to increase her stock. She want grow her business and make more money to rent a store to ease the stress of hawking all day. She believes your support would enable her realize her goal.

loans.use: To purchase assorted sponges in bulk

loans.name: Marian

texts.en:
Marian is 35 years old. She is married with three children who are currently in school. She works very hard to support her husband in taking care of their children in school. She trades in clothing. She sells various kinds of textile cloth, both traditional and industrial designs, as well as linen materials. 

She wants to use the loan to buy more supplies of men's and women's textile clothes and linen materials to increase her stock to make more income for her business and family. She is a member of the group called Golden Trust Group. In this group, members guarantee for one another as social collateral to access loans and peer pressure to repay the loans.

loans.use: To purchase assorted clothes

loans.name: Nafisat

texts.en:
Nafisat is 40 years old and is married with four children. Her husband is a petty trader.

Nafisat is a hardworking woman. She sells groceries and drinks and has been in this business for a long time. She is happy because her business is highly competitive and she hopes to stock her stall to enable her to attract more customers.

This is the festive season and the demands for her groceries will increase. Nafisat is requesting a loan of 50,000 NGN to purchase more groceries to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more groceries to sell

loans.name: Gervacio

texts.en: Gervacio Gutierrez Montiel is married and owns his own home. A blacksmith for 20 years who has built up a loyal clientele, he owns a workshop where he sells chalk, paint, and tin and provides repair and building services.  His two grown children help him in his workshop, and he has all the tools to do his work well. Gervacio will use his loan to purchase iron, paint, and finish and will invest in offering a delivery service for his customers.

loans.use: Materials for his business.

loans.name: Juan

texts.en:
Juan Ramon P. is 52 years old, and he lives in Encarnacion. Juan is a carpenter, and he has owned a “carpinteria” for 10 years in the center of Encarnacion. He notes that he has a good customer base and that he services many customers in Posadas, Argentina – the city across the river from Encarnacion. Indeed, Juan's services are in very high demand; as a result, his workshop is busy with orders. He explains that he always puts his customers first and pays back loans he has taken out to ensure the continued growth of his business.

Juan is applying for a loan of in the amount of 1,500,000 PYG ($325) to repair one of his most important machines.

loans.use: To improve his business by repairing an important machine

loans.name: Rabi

texts.en:
Rabi is a 55-year-old married woman with seven children. Currently, only three of her children are in school.

To earn a living, she is a food vendor. Specifically, she sells "kenkey" and fried fish. Kenkey is prepared from milled maize grains, and it is taken with hot pepper or soup. Because kenkey is enjoyed by so many Ghanaian people for breakfast, lunch, and supper, she has many loyal customers. She is requesting a loan in the amount of $350 to buy more raw materials and ingredients, such as bags of maize, meat, fish, vegetables, and firewood. With the loan proceeds, she hopes to generate an increase in her income so that she can better support her children’s education. She believes your support would enable her to grow her business.

loans.use: To expand and improve her business by purchasing additional ingredients (e.g., maize, meat, fish, and vegetables) and firewood

loans.name: Jason Onyari

texts.en:
Jason Onyari is 22 years old. Jason is single, and he describes himself as creative and hardworking.

To earn a living, he owns and operates the Chap Chap barber shop. Currently, with the help of one employee, he provides hair cutting services for men only, but he wants to expand his business to offer these services to ladies as well. He has been operating this business for two years. He explains that his clients are local residents and walk-ins, and that his shop is located behind the local authority offices in town. He notes that one of the primary challenges he faces with the business is the fact that there are power outages at the barber shop. In addition to his work at the barber shop, he is a pump attendant at a petrol station.

In the future, he wants to own and operate a wholesale cosmetics shop. As such, he is seeking a loan in the amount of 20,000 KES ($275) to purchase not just hair products (braids, hair treatments, etc.), but also cotton, jewelry, and cosmetics for ladies.

loans.use: To improve his barber shop and to expand into cosmetic sales by purchasing braids, hair treatments, cotton, jewelry, and cosmetics

loans.name: Agustin

texts.en: Agustin C. is 55 years old and lives in the town of Encarnacion, where he has been a vendor for his whole life. He runs his small business from a stall in town, where he sells a range of items to a large and busy customer base. He earns enough money to pay for a home and meet his other expenses. He is applying for a loan for 1,500,000 PYGs to buy more merchandise for his stall. Sales are always higher at the end of the year during the holidays, and Agustin hopes to take advantage of this demand to increase his income and profits.

loans.use: To buy more items to sell to his customers

loans.name: Adiza

texts.en: Adiza is 52 years old, divorced and has two children who are in school. She is a food vendor who sells waakye, a popular local dish of cooked rice and beans enjoyed with stew, macaroni and fish. It is sold in the mornings as breakfast, is very tasty and enjoyed by almost all of Ghana's tribes. She wants to use the loan to buy more of the rice, beans  and yams she uses to make waakye. She thanks Kiva lenders for their support, because this is what allows her to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy ingredients in bulk.

loans.name: Mariama

texts.en: Mariama is 35 years old. She is married and has three children. She sells porridge and groundnuts in her neighborhood. Porridge is one of the local foods enjoyed popularly as breakfast. It is prepared from milled maize or millet grains, boiled and taken with sugar, milk and bread. With her large customer base, she wants to use the loan to buy more raw materials like bags of maize, millet, sugar and milk to increase production. She hopes to raise a good income to support her children in school.

loans.use: To purchase food ingredients in bulk.

loans.name: John Okeyo

texts.en: John N. sells electronics goods and other retail products. He has been in this business for the last 16 years. His customers are those within the bus terminus and travelers.  His business is near the bus terminals at Keroka town and he has one employee. His business challenge is fluctuating demand from the customers.  Besides this, he does small scale farming.  He is using the proceeds of his loan of KES20,000 to buy 25 radios.  In the future, he wants to own a big electronics shop.  John is married with two children and describes himself as hardworking, patient and optimistic.

loans.use: To buy 25 radios

loans.name: Maria Elizabeth

texts.es:
La socia MARIA ELIZABETH pertenece al banco comunal “MERCAMUEBLE” y vive en la ciudad Imperial del Cusco. 

La socia tiene 29 años de edad, es conviviente, tiene dos hijos: un varón y una mujer. El hijo estudia en el jardín y la hija es aun un bebe. Ella tiene un pequeño negocio de fabricación y venta de muebles (taller de carpintería). 

Ella alterna sus actividades del hogar con la fabricación de muebles como escritorios, roperos, sillas, mesas, camas, etc. Ella ayuda a su esposo con la fabricación de muebles y con la venta de los mismos. La socia tiene un stand de venta de muebles en el mercado “MERCAMUEBLES” ubicado en el primer paradero del distrito de San Sebastián de la provincia del Cusco. Ya son varios años con esta actividad y le ha ido muy bien gracias a todo el empeño que pone en su trabajo.
       
La socia requiere el préstamo para aumentar el capital del negocio de fabricación y venta de muebles, ella quiere comprar más materia prima (madera) y materiales para el acabado del muebles como tiner, laca, lijar, cola de carpintero, etc. 

La socia se encuentra agradecido por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
María Elizabeth belongs to the Mercamueble Communal Bank. She lives in the Imperial city of Cusco. She is 29; in a common law marriage; and has two children, a son and a daughter. The son is in preschool, and the daughter is still a baby. She has a small business of making and selling furniture (carpentry shop). She alternates her activities between the home and making furniture like desks, wardrobes, chairs, tables, and beds, etc. She helps her husband make and sell the furniture. She has a furniture selling stand in the Mercamuebles Market, which is located at the first bus stop in the San Sebastián province of Cusco. She has been doing this for many years. It has gone very well for her thanks to all of the effort she puts into her work. She needs a loan to increase the capital in her business of making and selling furniture. She wants to buy raw material (wood) and materials like thinner, shellac, sandpaper, and glue, etc. for finishing the furniture. She is grateful for the opportunity of the loan, and she promises to pay it back on time.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase capital in her business of making and selling furniture

loans.name: Vivian

texts.en: Vivian is 34 years old. She is married with five children who are currently in school. She is a trader who sells cooking utensils, plastic bowls, buckets and plates, rice cookers, microwaves etc. She sells to her customers in working institutions on a credit basis. Vivian is an achiever and her focus is to build a container shop from her savings to enable her to station her sales. She wants to use the loan to buy more stock of plastic materials and kitchen sets to serve her customers.

loans.use: To purchase assorted plastics and kitchen sets.

loans.name: Edito

texts.en: Edito has been married for 38 years and has two fully-grown and independent children. Edito is a micro entrepreneur who owns a pantry in his neighborhood. He makes a good income and is helped by his wife. He also works in a restaurant and receives additional income there. Edito will use his loan to purchase merchandise such as flour, oil, sugar, yerba mate, and cider, from the nearby town of Posadas, that he can sell at a higher profit.

loans.use: To buy more merchandise for resale

loans.name: Esmelda

texts.en:
Esmelda A. is 57 years old and single. She lives in her own house in Encarnacion.

Esmelda is a merchant. She sells jewelry such as rings, bracelets, and necklaces. Through this work, she has been able to earn a good profit, cover her household expenses, and save enough for a rainy day. She is applying for a loan of 1,000,000 Gs to buy more stock for the end-of-year season.

loans.use: To buy more jewelry to sell

loans.name: Lourdes

texts.en:
Lourdes M. D. T. is 29 years old and is married to Nolberto T.. Together, they have three children and live in their own home in Encarnacion. 

Lourdes owns a laundromat, which she has operated for three years. It is located in the heart of Encarnacion and is always busy. Her husband, Nolberto, owns a glass shop nearby; together they work hard to raise their children well by giving them a good education and a comfortable home.

Lourdes is applying for a loan so that she can purchase another drying machine. That purchase would enable her to satisfy her customers’ needs and deliver her services faster.

loans.use: purchasing a drying machine

loans.name: Perfect Square Group

texts.en:
John S. is the leader of a group of 5 borrowers known as "Perfect Square." John is a 44-year-old married man wth six children. His children are between the ages of 13 and 29 years old, and their educational levels are between the 1st and 6th grades. John also cares for a grandchild. He holds an associate degree, but he decided to go into business for himself. John lives and works in the Parker corner, Brewerville, north of Liberia's capital, Monrovia.

He is engaged in the business of selling charcoal. Specificaly, he sells charcoal to wholesale and retail customers, and he has been operating this business for a year. John explains that he sells high-quality charcoal to his customers and talks to his customers in a kind manner in order to encourage his customers to continue to buy from him. In the future, he hopes to expand his business such that he can have his own shop. He started his business with limited capital, and he is seeking this loan to purchase more charcoal. He dreams of providing his children a better education and of building them a house of their own.

loans.use: To expand and improve his business by purchasing additional charcoal

loans.name: Maximo

texts.en:
Maximo M. is 40 years old, married and lives in his own home with his wife and three children. His children are all in high school in Encarnacion. 
Maximo owns a fleet of taxis and a taxi stand in Encarnacion. He has been running his business for seven years, and is requesting a loan of 5,000,000 Gs for 12 months so he can purchase another vehicle to expand his fleet and provide better service for his customers.

loans.use: To purchase another vehicle for his fleet

loans.name: Norma Esperanza

texts.es:
En el departamento de León, la señora Norma C. se dedica fielmente a su negocio de elaboración y venta de carne de res y pollo y también a la venta de algunas verduras las que sitúa en una mesa pequeña donde ofrece el producto a su clientela.

A pesar de que ella ha atravesado difíciles circunstancias económicas, hoy en día ha buscado la manera de cómo desarrollarse en su actividad y es por esta razón que solicita un crédito para invertirlo en la compra de la carne de res y el pollo para comercializarlo así como también en la compra de algunas verduras. Con el crédito se beneficia grandemente por lo que mejorará sus condiciones en su establecimiento.
texts.en:
In the León department Norma C. faithfully devotes herself to her business, making and selling beef and chicken. She also sells some vegetables, which she places on a small table to offer to her customers. In spite of having gone through difficult economic circumstances, she now has looked for the way to grow in her business. That is the reason she is asking for a loan to buy beef, chicken and some vegetables to sell. She will greatly benefit from the loan because she will improve the conditions of her establishement.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy beef, chicken, and some vegetables

loans.name: Excel Group

texts.en: Regina is married with a child. She is 48 years old. Her child is currently in school. She lives with her family in a rented apartment in their community. Regina is leader of a trust group called Excel and a food vendor. She sells kenkey. The members of the group are mostly food vendors and traders. They buy their stock from the big markets in Accra and sell at the market square in their community. Some of them trek to other towns to sell on their market days as well. The members have been in business for some time and have amassed a great deal of experience in their businesses. In this group, the members guarantee for one another as collateral to access the loan. They are requesting the loan to procure more goods to be able to expand their business.

loans.use: To purchase food ingredients.

loans.name: Francisco Miguel

texts.es:
El socio FRANCISCO MIGUEL pertenece al banco comunal “MERCAMUEBLE” y vive en la ciudad Imperial del Cusco. 

El socio tiene 24 años de edad, es conviviente, tiene una hija de un año medio. El tiene un pequeño negocio de fabricación(taller de carpintería) y venta de muebles. 

El es carpintero y fabrica muebles como escritorios, roperos, sillas, mesas, camas, etc. El tiene también un stand de venta de muebles en el mercado “MERCAMUEBLES” ubicado en el primer paradero del distrito de San Sebastián de la provincia del Cusco. Ya son varios años con esta actividad y le ha ido muy bien gracias a todo el empeño que pone en su trabajo.
       
El socio requiere el préstamo para aumentar el capital del negocio de fabricación y venta de muebles, el quiere comprar más materia prima (madera) y materiales para el acabado de los muebles como tiner, laca, lijar, cola de carpintero, etc. 

El socio se encuentra agradecido por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
The associate Francisco Miguel belongs to the communal bank "Mercamueble", an affiliate of Kiva, and lives in the Imperial city of Cusco.The associate is 24 years old, partnered, and has a six month old daughter. He has a small production business (a carpentry workshop), and sells furniture. He is a carpenter and makes furniture, like desks, wardrobes, chairs, tables, beds, etc. He also has a furniture stand in the market "Mercamuebles", located in the first part of the district of San Sebastián in the province of Cusco. He has spent many years with this activity and it has gone very well, thanks to all the effort he puts into his work. The associate requires this loan to enlarge the capital of his production business and furniture sales. He wants to buy more materials (wood) and as well as materials for the finishing of his furniture, like shellac, sand paper, varnish, wood glue, etc. The associate is very grateful for the opportunity offered by means of this loan and thus he promises to comply with the repayment time table.

Translated from Spanish by Lois Parshley, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To augment the capital of his production business and furniture sales.

loans.name: Meris

texts.es:
La señora Meris C. tiene su propia pulpería en la que vende los productos de arroz, frijoles, aceite, azúcar, leña, café, entre otros. Ella se ha destacado por ser fiel comerciante y ha logrado salir adelante en su actividad supliendo la necesidad de sus clientes que le visitan.

Ella actualmente solicita un crédito para la compra de los productos como son los granos básicos (arroz, frijoles, azúcar, aceite) y leña para ofrecerlos en su venta y de esta manera continuar brindando a su familia las condiciones de vida necesarias para su propio desarrollo.
texts.en:
Sra. Meris C. has her own store where she sells products such as rice, beans, oil, sugar, firewood, coffee, and other items. She has become a dedicated merchant who managed to succeed in her business by supplying necessities to the customers who visit her.

Meris is currently requesting a loan to buy products such as grains, rice, beans, sugar, oil and firewood to sell. This will allow her to continue providing her family with the living conditions necessary for development.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase merchandise for her store

loans.name: Peter Kimeu

texts.en: Peter Kimeu is 33 years old and is married with one son. He is a tailor and has been in this business for the last 13 years. He owns the Perfect Designers and sells dresses to the co-operative. His business location is in a conducive environment although he faces some challenges of no security at night and inadequate machines for sewing.  He is using the proceeds of his loan of KES20,000 to buy more sewing machines.  In the future, he wants to be the wholesaler and main distributor in Madaraka market.  Peter describes himself as hardworking, determined and honest.

loans.use: To buy sewing machines

loans.name: Ricardo Javier

texts.es:
Ricardo A. desde hace diez años se dedica a su actividad de siembra de ajonjolí en el departamento de León donde se esfuerza grandemente por mejorar las condiciones de su actividad para salir adelante y proporcionarle mejores condiciones de vida a su familia compuesta por su pequeño hijo a su responsabilidad ya que él es un padre soltero.

Solicita un crédito para llevar a cabo la corta y emparve del ajonjolí y para esto requiere pagarle a mozos para sacar prontamente la cosecha y proceder con su respectiva comercialización para generar los ingresos para su desarrollo. Espera ser beneficiado con el crédito para mejorar las condiciones de su actividad.
texts.en:
Ricardo A. has been growing sesame for 10 years in the department of León. He greatly strives to improve his business in order to succeed and provide a better life for his family. Ricardo is a single father who is responsible for a young son.

He is requesting a loan in order to hire labor to cut the sesame stalks and thresh them for the seeds. This needs to be done before he can bring his crop to market and generate revenue for further development. Ricardo expects that this loan will improve the conditions for his business.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Pay for labor to harvest his sesame crop

loans.name: Roque

texts.en:
Roque A. L. B. is 35 years old and is married to Santa Ledezma. They live in their own home in a little town called Trinidad, on the outskirts of Encarnacion. Roque and Santa have been vendors for a long time. They operate their shop from their house, where Santa also runs a hairdressing salon. By running their own businesses, Roque and Santa have been able to save enough money and make a good profit for their family. 
They will use their loan of 1,500,000 Gs to buy merchandise and materials for hairdressing.

loans.use: Merchandise for resale and materials for hairdressing

loans.name: Passion Inn Group

texts.en:
Jamesette P. is a leader of a group of five borrowers called Passion Inn. She is 32 years old and married with two children who are two and six years old They are in nursery school and 1st grade. Jamesette also cares for a niece and a nephew.
She is a bachelor degree holder but chooses business.
Jamesette and her family live and work in the Virginia area, north of the capital, Monrovia, Liberia.
Her business is the sale of used clothes. She buys used clothes from wholesalers and sells at retail to residents of Virginia, northern Monrovia, Liberia.
Jamesette has been running this business for a year and hopes to improve the business to a better level in the future.
Jamesette sells at an affordable price in order to encourage customers to continue buying from her.
She started selling with LD14000.00 that she borrowed, but sometimes faces difficulties with customers who buy on credit from her and don’t pay on time.
Jamesette needs this loan to purchase more goods to improve business. 
She dreams of giving her children a better education and changing their living condition.

loans.use: To purchase more used clothing to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: purchasing more charcoal

loans.name: Nicholas

texts.en:
Nicholas is 36 years old and married with one school-age child. He runs a barber shop in Kitengela, a small town near Nairobi. He describes himself as hardworking. He's been in this business for twenty years and also earns some income as a taxi driver.

Nicholas successfully completed a previous loan from Faulu for Kes 60,000. He requested this loan of Kes 80,000 to buy a haircutting machine.

loans.use: To buy a haircutting machine

loans.name: Idowu

texts.en:
Idowu is married with two children and he is 33 years old. His wife sells clothes at the market.

Idowu is a photographer and he also does video coverage. He has been in this business for eight years and the demand for his services is high. He renders his services from home so he does not have to pay for stall rent.

Idowu is hard worker and he is determined to lift his business above poverty. He is requesting a loan of 50,000 NGN to purchase a video camera. He says a big thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase a video camera

loans.name: Silvina

texts.en:
Silvina C. is 36 years old and is married to Lawrence Abel Gonzalez. They have two young children and live in Encarnación.

Silvina sells various merchandise such as clothes, bed sheets, blankets, thermoses, and has a lot of customers from nearby towns, where she goes to sell her merchandise. She has been running her business for more than five years.

Lawrence is also a vendor, and sells his merchandise on the bridge between Argentina and Paraguay in Encarnación. With their combined income, they have a comfortable life and have good savings. They work so they can give their children a better life. 

Silvina is requesting a loan of 3,000,000 PYG to buy more merchandise so she can increase her stock. She will also start selling from a small room in their house, which they can convert to a store.

loans.use: To buy more merchandise

loans.name: Florentino

texts.es:
El socio FLORENTINO pertenece al banco comunal “MERCAMUEBLE” y vive en la ciudad Imperial del Cusco.

El socio tiene 61 años de edad, es casado, tiene cuatro hijos: tres hijos varones y una mujer. El hijo menor estudia en el colegio y los mayores estudian o tiene estudios superiores. El tiene un pequeño negocio de fabricación (taller de carpintería) de muebles y los vende a sus clientes.

El es carpintero y fabrica muebles como escritorios, roperos, sillas, mesas, camas, etc. El tiene también un stand de venta de muebles en el mercado “MERCAMUEBLES” ubicado en el primer paradero del distrito de San Sebastián de la provincia del Cusco. Ya son varios años con esta actividad y le ha ido muy bien gracias a todo el empeño que pone en su trabajo.

El socio requiere el préstamo para aumentar el capital del negocio de fabricación y venta de muebles, el quiere comprar más materia prima (madera) y materiales para el acabado de los muebles como tiner, laca, lijar, cola de carpintero, etc.

El socio se encuentra agradecido por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Florentino is a member of the Mercamueble Communal Bank and lives in the imperial city of Cusco. He is 61 years old, married, and has 4 children (3 sons and 1 daughter). His youngest child is in high school, while the older ones are either studying or already have their degrees. He has a small carpentry shop where he sells furniture to his customers.

Florentino makes desks, wardrobes, chairs, tables, beds, etc. He also has a furniture vending post at the Mercamuebles Market, located at the main bus stop in San Sebastián District of the Province of Cusco. Florentino has been in business for a number of years and has done very well due to his hard work and determination.

He is requesting a loan to increase his business capital for manufacturing and selling furniture. The materials he needs to buy include wood, paint thinner, lacquer, sandpaper, carpenter’s glue, and other items. Florentino is grateful for this opportunity and commits to making his payments on time.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase materials & supplies

loans.name: Juana Mercedes

texts.es:
La señora Juana Mercedes A. P., tiene la edad de 59 años, 
Habita en el barrio la borgoña,  ella es madre soltera, tiene tres hijas ya todas independientes, a su cargo tiene una nieta de catorce años que le apoya con las actividades del hogar después del colegio, doña Juana desde hace quince años labora como empleada domestica en una casa privada en los altos de santo domingo, la mayor dificultad que se le presenta es que su salario no le ajusta para comprar de una sola vez materiales de construcción, agradece a la institución por la buena 
Aprobación de su primer crédito, el cual lo va a invertir en materiales como: arena, cemento, para repellar las paredes, a si como embaldosar el piso que es de tierra. Si le ajusta comprara también el zinc para poder gozar de un techo digno junto a su familia que a mucho esfuerzo esta logrando. Da las gracias a la institución por permitir a muchas familias de bajos recursos económicos poder lograr sus metas mediante el plazo del préstamo.
texts.en:
Juana Mercedes A. P. is 59 years old and lives in the La Borgoña neighborhood of Managua. She is a single mother of three girls, all now grown and living independently. She also is raising a 14-year-old granddaughter who helps with the housework after school.

For 15 years Juana has worked as a domestic in a private home in the hills of Santo Domingo. The biggest difficulty has been that her income does not allow her to purchase, at one time, the construction materials she needs to improve her house.

With this, her first loan, she will buy sand and cement to plaster the walls and put tiles on the floor, which is now dirt. If there is enough money, she will also buy metal roofing. She would like to enjoy a proper home with her family, and has worked hard to achieve it.

She thanks the lending institution for allowing many low-income families to achieve their goals through loans.

Translated from Spanish by jeffrey hersk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy sand, cement, and metal roofing to complete her house

loans.name: Mercedes  Guadalupe

texts.es: MERCEDES O. TIENE 37 AÑOS DE EDAD, ES SOLTERA, TIENE 4 HIJOS 3 SON CASDOS Y UNO QUE ESTA CON ELLA , ES EL QUE LA APOYA, NACIO EN UN MUNICIPIO DEL PAIS, LOCALIZADO A 40 KILOMETROS DE LA CIUDAD DE GUATEMALA, EMPEZO SU NEGOCIO DE VENTA DE ARTICULOS DE CONSUMO DIARIO HACE 1 AÑO CUANDO SE TRASLADO A VIVIR A UNA COMUNIDAD A LAS ORILLAS DE LA CIUDAD DE GUATEMALA. CUANDO ELLA COMENZO SU NEGOCIO, NO HABIA OTRO NEGOCIO EN SU COMUNIDAD POR LO QUE EL MISMO ERA MUY IMPORTANTE PARA LOS VECINOS DE LA COMUNIDAD ELLA VENDE MUCHAS COSAS NECESARIAS PARA LA PERSONAS DE SU COMUNIDAD COMO FRIJOL, ARROZ, MAIZ, AZUCAR, ETC. MERCEDES NECESITA EL PRESTAMO PARA PODER SURTIR MAS LA TIENDA YA QUE SUS CLIENTES NECESITAN QUE ELLO COLOQUE MAS PRODUCTOS, ELLA CONFIA QUE EL PRESTAMO LE AYUDARA PARA SEGUIR ADELANTE.
texts.en:
Mercy O. is 37 years old, she is a single woman, and has four children, three of whom are married, and one who still lives with her. It is this child who supports her. She was born in a municipality of the country, located forty kilometers from the city of Guatemala. She begin her business selling articles of daily consumption one year ago, when she moved to live in a community on the outskirts of the city of Guatemala. When she began her business, there were no other businesses in her community for the same purpose. It was very important for the neighbors in her community that she sell the necessary commodities for the people of her community, including beans, rice, corn, sugar, etc. Mercedes needs this loan so she can supply her store with more of the things that her clients need. She trusts that this loan will help her keep going.

Translated from Spanish by Lois Parshley, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For supplies for her general store.

loans.name: God Is Love Group

texts.en:
Marie M. is the leader of a group of 5 borrowers called God is Love. 

Marie is 29 years old and married with 3 children who are between 1 and 9 years old. Their educational levels range from nursery school to 2nd grade. Marie and her family live in the Brewerville community north of Monrovia, Liberia and work in the Nezoo community, south of Monrovia. 

Marie runs a general goods store (provision shop). She buys general goods like candles, oil, sugar, milk, etc. from wholesalers and sells them retail to residents of the Nezoo community. Marie has been running this business for a year, and wants to improve her business by establishing branches in Monrovia in the future.

Marie has excellent customer service skills; consequently, customers come to her repeatedly. She started by selling by using a sum of LD 35,000.00 that was given to her by her husband.

Marie needs this loan to purchase more goods to improve business. She dreams of giving her children a better education and changing their living conditions.

loans.use: purchasing general goods like candles, oil, sugar, milk, etc.

loans.name: David

texts.en:
David sells crates of drinks at retail and wholesale prices to his customers. He has no stall but sells his drinks from home. Therefore, he does not have to pay for stall rent. He has been in this business for five years.

David lives in Ogbomoso, Oyo State, Nigeria. He is married with four children and he is 35 years old.

The high season for his business is here and David hopes to make more profits during this season. He is requesting a loan of 50,000 NGN to purchase more crates of drinks to sell. He says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more crates of drinks to sell

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To purchase eighty sacks of charcoal

loans.name: Esperanza En La Fe 1 Y 2 Group

texts.en:
Otilus is the coordinator of her group Esperanza en la Fe 1 & 2 (Hope in faith 1& 2). Her story is generally representative of her group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican clients (many of whom recently emigrated to the DR from Haiti). 

Her group is located in Santiago, the second largest place after the capital, where running water (none of which is potable) and electricity are unreliable. She makes her home here in a simple structure with her husband. They have two children.

Otilus is excited to be taking her first loan with Esperanza. She plans to use this loan to invest in her retail business. She will use the profits to buy more clothes and sell them. She thanks you all for your support.

loans.use: buying pants, creams and shirts to sell them

loans.name: Alma

texts.es: ALMA P. Q. TIENE 24 AÑOS DE EDAD ES CASDA TIENE UN NIÑO DE DOS AÑOS DE EDAD, SU ESPOSO LE AYUDA CON SUS GASTOS DE LA CASA, ELLA VENDE ROPA PARA BEBES PARA NIÑOS SUETERES PARA DAMAS Y CABALLEROS TAMBIEN VENDE ALGUNOS QUIPILES TIPICOS VENDE LOS DIAS DE MERCADO EN LA PLAZA DE TECPAN DESDE HACE 3 AÑOS EL CREDITO QUE SOLICITA ES PARA INVERTIR EN SU NEGOCIO QUIERE VARIAR EL ESTILO DE SUETERES PORQUE ES LA TEMPORADA DONDE ELLA APROVECHA TAMBIEN EN SU ELABORACION DE GUIPILES SU SUEÑO ES AGRANDAR SU NEGOCIO PARA MEJORAR SU VIDA ECONOMICA Y TAMBIEN VER EL FUTURO DE SUS HIJOS.
texts.en:
Alma P. Q. is 24 years old, married, and has a two-year-old son. Her husband helps her with household expenses. She sells clothing for babies and children, sweaters for men and women, and also sells traditional quipiles (blouses). She has been selling her products on market days in the plaza of Texpan for three years. This loan she is soliciting is for investing in her business – she would like a greater variety of sweaters because, during this season, she also works on making her quipiles. Her dream is to develop her business to improve her economic quality of life and to also improve her son's opportunities for the future.

Translated from Spanish by Julia Kastner, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Clothing sales

loans.name: Elysée

texts.fr: A. Elysée est née le 28 Octobre 1979 et est mariée à DOSSOU-GOIN Bienvenu, un menuisier. Le couple a trois enfants, tous scolarisés et vivant avec eux. La famille vit à Dogoudo à Allada, dans le département de l’Atlantique au Bénin, depuis 12 ans.  Elysée supporte avec son mari les charges de la famille. Elysée n’a pas fréquenté l’école. Il y a 3 ans que Elysée vend de l’agouti à Allada. C’est aussi à Allada que  Elysée s’approvisionne. Elysée a bénéficié une fois de crédit à ALIDé et l’a bien remboursé. Elysée souhaite agrandir son commerce afin de satisfaire plus sa clientèle. C’est pourquoi Elysée sollicite un deuxième crédit auprès de ALIDé.
texts.en:
A. Elysée was born on October 28, 1979 and is married to DOSSOU-GOIN Bienvenu, a furniture maker. The couple has three children who are all in school and living with them. The family has been living in Dogoudo in Allada, in Atlantique county, Benin, for twelve years. Along with her husband, Elysée provides for her family. Elysée has not gone to school. For three years, she has been selling agoutis in Allada. She once benefited from an ALIDé loan and has repaid it. She wishes to expand her commerce in order to satisfy her customers further. This is why she’s requesting a second loan from ALIDé.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy agoutis

loans.name: Nancy's Group

texts.en:
Nancy M. is a leader of a group of 5 borrowers called In God We Trust. She is 40 years old and married with 2 children aged 25 and 12 years. Her children are in 9th grade and 7th grade, respectively. She is illiterate due to lack of financial support and decided to start a business for a living. Nancy and her family live and work in the VOA community located north of Monrovia, the capital of Liberia.

Nancy is in the business of selling foodstuffs. She buys foodstuffs from wholesalers and sells to residents of VOA. Nancy has been running this business for 12 years and hopes to grow it into a shop in the future. Nancy sells at an affordable price and talks to customers in a good manner in order to encourage customers to continue buying from her.

She started with 1000.00 LRD that was given to her by her brother. Nancy needs this loan to purchase more palm oil, sugar, flour, etc., to improve her business. She dreams of giving her children a better education.

loans.use: To purchase more palm oil, sugar, flour, etc., to improve her business

loans.name: Olga Maritsa

texts.es:
Olga tiene 49 años de edad, es casada y madre de cinco hijos. Vive junto a su esposo y dos de sus nietos en el sector Real Saucipe, ubicado en el distrito de Paiján, provincia de Ascope, en la región La Libertad, ubicada a 3 horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Desde hace un año empezó a trabajar junto a una hermana en un pequeño negocio de venta de comida y bebida. Ella es la resposable de la venta de bebidas mientras que su hermana se encarga de la preparación de los platos que ofrecen a sus clientes. Ellas atienden todos los dias y este negocio la ayuda a mantenerse activa y a apoyar en el mantenimiento de su familia.

Su esposo trabaja actualmente como guardián en una empresa de la zona y los ingresos que percibe no son suficientes para seguir manteniendo la familia por lo que Olga desea seguir adelante con su negocio de bebidas. Ella se encuentra solicitando por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un préstao de 800 nuevos soles que piensa invertir en la compra de más bebidas para ampliar sus ventas.

Olga sueña con poner una tiendita en su casa con la cual seguir trabajando y manteniendo a los suyos. Ella es una mujer activa, responsable y muy trabajadora. En la fotografía aparece ayudando a su hermana en la preparación de la comida que posteriormente ofrecerán en venta.
texts.en:
Olga is 49 years old, married, and the mother of five children. She lives with her husband and two of their grandchildren in the Real Saucipe sector, located in the Paiján district, Ascope province, in the La Libertad region, located three hours away from Chiclayo City. A year ago, she and her sister started to work on a small business selling food and drink. She is responsbile for the drink sales while her sister prepares the food that they offer their clients. They work every day and this business helps keep her active and helps her help with her family's maintenance. Right now, her husband works as a security guard and a business in the same zone, but his income is not sufficient to cover all the family's expenses, which is why Olga wants to develop her drinks business. She is soliciting her first Edpyme Alternativa loan of 800 soles, which she plans to use to purchase additional drinks to improve her sales. Olga dreams of establishing a small store out of her house, so she can continue working and supporting her loved ones. She is an active, responsible, and hard-working woman. In the picture above, she is helping her sister cook the food that they will later offer for sale.

Translated from Spanish by Julia Kastner, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of drinks to grow her business.

loans.name: Maria Coralia

texts.es: MARIA CORALIA DE 45 AÑOS CASADA, TIENE 3 HIJOS , NESECITA UN CREDITO DE Q.8,000.00 PARA PODER SURTIR SU TIENDA DE VENTA DE CONSUMO DIARIO YA EN ESTOS MESES TIENE MUCHA VENTA, SU SUEÑO ES TENER UN NEGOCIO MAS GRANDE Y QUE SUS HIJOS UN BUEN FUTURO Y QUE TENGAN LOS RECURSOS NECESARIOS.
texts.en:
Maria Coralia is 45 years old and married, and she has three children. She needs a loan of Q.8,000 to be able to supply her general store, because in these months, she has a lot of sales. Her dream is to have a bigger business and for her children to have a good future, with access to everything they need.

Translated from Spanish by Julia Kastner, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: General store supplies

loans.name: Active Group

texts.en:
Morrison K. is a leader of a group of 5 borrowers called Active. He is 59 years old and a widower with 5 children aged 3 - 6 years old. Their educational levels range from nursery to high school graduate. He also cares for a cousin. He holds a bachelors degree and owns a business. Morrison and his family live and work in the VOA community north of the capital, Monrovia, Liberia.

Morrison is in the business of charging mobile phone batteries. He charges different kinds of mobile phones in a little booth in his community. Morrison has been running this business for a year and hopes to grow the business into a shop. He always gives his customers a good price when charging their phones in order to encourage them to continue buying from him. He started with 300.00 LRD that he saved from working in agriculture.

Morrison needs this loan to purchase video discs, mobile phone charge cards, and for currency exchange to improve his business. He dreams of giving his children a better education.

loans.use: To purchase video discs, mobile phone charge cards, and for currency exchange to improve his business

loans.name: Eunice

texts.en:
Eunice is 41 years old and married with six children between the ages of six and twenty. She has a business selling fish in the Kawangware area of Nairobi. She sells fingerlings (young fish) and has been in business for five years. She describes herself as a very hardworking person.

She successfully repaid a previous loan from Faulu for 20,000 KES, and says that since she joined Faulu, she has been able to expand her business. She requested this loan for 40,000 KES from Faulu to buy more fish to sell. In the future, she hopes to expand her business to be a supplier for the entire region and be able to buy more household goods and have her own home.

loans.use: To buy more fish to sell

loans.name: Salvadora Adelina

texts.es: Salvadora Adelina tiene 60 años de edad, es una mujer luchadora y que le gusta trabajar de manera humilde. Su actividad económica es la venta de mercadería en general, hace más de 15 años que inicio con esta actividad con el objetivo de sacar adelante a sus hijos entre los días que vende y días que no vende, ya que lagunas veces no vendía cantidades grandes pero vendía lo necesario para comer. El financiamiento que solicito es para capital de trabajo que será destinado para la compra de bloques sólidos, cemento piedrín y arena. El sueño de Salvadora es que sus hijos sigan adelante con este negocio que es su medio de vida.
texts.en:
Salvadora Adelina is 60 years old, and she is a tough but humble and hard-working woman. Her business is the sale of general merchandise. More than 15 years ago, she started this business in order to provide for her children. Sometimes she has days of good sales and sometimes her goods don't sell as well, but even when she doesn't sell large quantities she sells enough to allow her family to eat. This loan she is seeking is for working capital, which she will use for the purchase of concrete blocks, stone cement, and sand. Salvadora's dream is for her children to continue this business, which is her livelihood.

Translated from Spanish by Julia Kastner, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: United For Progress Group

texts.en:
Dennis S. is a leader of a group of five borrowers called United for Progress. He is 32 years old and married. He and his family live and work in the VOA community, north of Liberia’s capital, Monrovia. Dennis and his wife have four children, ages three to twelve years old, who attend school (nursery school to seventh grade). He also cares for a little brother and a sibling. Dennis is a high school graduate who was formerly working in agriculture.

Dennis’ business now is selling general goods such as underwear, soap, candles, etc., which he buys from wholesalers and sells at retail to residents of his community. Dennis sells at an affordable price and talks to customers in a friendly manner in order to encourage customers to continue buying from him. He has been in business for a year and hopes to improve his sales as time goes on.

Dennis started his business with 9400 LD that he had saved when he was farming. He now needs a loan to purchase more goods like underwear, toothpaste, soap, etc. to expand his business. He dreams of giving his children a better education and improving their living conditions.

loans.use: To purchase more wholesale goods to sell at retail.

loans.name: Frank Robert

texts.es:
Frank es un padre de familia de 29 años de edad que vive junto a su esposa y dos hijos en el sector Camino Real – Campiña Cascajal, en el distrito de Paiján, provincia de Ascope, en la región La Libertad, ubicado a tres horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Trabaja como mototaxista desde que tenía trece años de edad, este negocio le provee los ingresos permanentes que necesita para mantener a su familia, además se dedica a la agricultura desde los quince años de edad. Usualmente siembra caña de azúcar, cebolla, ají y pimientos en un pequeño terreno que heredó de sus padres. Con los ingresos de estas actividades Frank mantiene y saca adelante a su familia.

El continuo uso otorgado a su mototaxi ha hecho que esta empiece a fallar y requiera mantenimiento urgente. Por este motivo Frank se encuentra solicitando por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles para darle a su unidad móvil el mantenimiento y equipamiento que necesita.

Su más grande anhelo es seguir sembrando y ahorrar para comprarse un auto y trabajar como taxista mientras no esté en el campo. También desea ampliar su casa para darle a su familia la comodidad que requiere. Frank es emprendedor, honesto y entregado a su trabajo.
texts.en:
Frank is the head of his household. He is 29 years old and lives with his wife two children in the Camino Real sector – Campiña Cascajal, in the Paiján district, Ascope province, in the La Libertad region, located three hours from Chiclayo City. He has been working as a moto-taxi driver since he was thirteen years old. This business privides him the reliable income that he needs to provide for his family. He also has been working in agriculture since he was fifteen. Normally, he plants sugar cane, onions, chili, and peppers in the small plot of land that he inherited from his parents. With the income from these businesses, Frank provides for his family and helps them prosper. The continual use of his moto-taxi has made it start to break down, and it requires urgent maintenance. This is why Frank is soliciting his first Edpyme Alternativa loan of 1,000 new soles to provide his vehicle with the necessary maintenance and equipment. His greatest wish is to continue farming and to save to buy himself a car to work as a taxi driver when he is not at home farming. He would also like to expand his home to make it more comfortable for his family. Frank is entrepreneurial, honest, and dedicated to his work.

Translated from Spanish by Julia Kastner, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Moto-taxi maintenance and equipment

loans.name: Dorine

texts.en:
Dorine O. is 21 years old and married with a young daughter, Linda. She sells fish, Nile perch and omena (fingerlings), in the Kawangware area of Nairobi. She has been in business for four years and describes herself as a very focused and hardworking young woman.

Dorine successfully paid off a previous loan from Faulu for 20,000 KES. She says since she joined Faulu, she has been able to expand her trade and is now renting larger business premises. Dorine is requesting this loan for 40,000 KES from Faulu to buy more fish to sell. In the future, she hopes to become a supplier for the entire region and so be able to buy more household goods.

loans.use: To buy more fish to sell.

loans.name: Cristina

texts.es:
La socia CRISTINA pertenece al banco comunal “MERCAMUEBLE” y vive en la ciudad Imperial del Cusco. 

La socia tiene 55 años de edad, es casada, tiene cuatro hijos dos varones y dos mujeres. Los mayores estudian en la universidad y los menores estudian en el colegio. Ella tiene un pequeño negocio de fabricación de muebles (taller de carpintería) y los vende a sus clientes.  

Ella alterna sus actividades del hogar con la ayuda que le hce a su esposo con la fabricación de muebles como escritorios, roperos, sillas, mesas, camas, etc. La socia tiene un stand de venta de muebles en el mercado “MERCAMUEBLES” ubicado en el primer paradero del distrito de San Sebastián de la provincia del Cusco. Ya son varios años con esta actividad y le ha ido muy bien gracias a todo el empeño que pone en su trabajo.
       
La socia requiere el préstamo para aumentar el capital del negocio de fabricación y venta de muebles, ella quiere comprar más materia prima (madera) y materiales para el acabado del muebles como tiner, laca, lijar, cola de carpintero, etc. 

La socia se encuentra agradecido por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Cristina is a member that belongs to the community bank “Mercamueble” and lives in the city of Imperial del Cusco. She is 55 years old, married and has four children, two males and two females. The older children are in University and the younger ones are in school. She has a small business that makes furniture (carpentry shop) and sells to her clients. She alternates her house activities with helping her husband in the making of furniture, such as desks, armoires, chairs, tables, beds, etc. She has a stand of furniture sales in the market “Mercamuebles” located in the first stop of the San Sebastian district of the Cusco province. It has been a few years for her doing this activity and it has gone well, thanks to the effort that she puts into her work. She requests a loan to increase working capital for the making and sale of furniture; she wants to buy raw materials (wood) and materials to finish the furniture such as thinner, varnish, glue, etc. She is thankful for the opportunity given and is committed to meet the corresponding scheduled payments.

Translated from Spanish by Sofia Burt, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase working capital for the making and sale of furniture

loans.name: Suffer To Gain Group

texts.en:
Prince K. is a leader of a group of five borrowers called Suffer to Gain. He is 39 years old, married and has two children aged ten and eighteen years old (they are in the fourth and tenth grades). He also cares for his mother and two sisters. Prince and his family live and work within the Baptist mission school community in Brewerville, north of Liberia’s capital, Monrovia. He dropped out of school in the seventh grade due to financial difficulties.

Prince’s business is in metal works. He buys and welds metal items for residents of his community. He started by using a friend’s tools and machinery, became experienced and decided to work on his own. Prince provides his own materials when working for customers in order to encourage them to continue patronizing his business. He has been in business for seven years and would like to continue improving his shop.

Prince needs this loan to purchase rebar, sheet metal and paint to improve his business. He dreams of giving his children a better education and building a house.

loans.use: To purchase rebar, sheet metal and paint for his business.

loans.name: Juan Manuel

texts.es:
Don Manuel B. hombre que desde joven trabajaba para ayudar a sus padres, por que eran de pocos recursos, no logro terminar sus estudio y trabajaba de ayudante de albañil, luego entro a trabajar en una empresa privada de Sovipe Ing. Como tesorero general, se caso y su esposa procreo cuatro hijos tres mayores y uno que lo tiene estudiando en la universidad. Su esposa es docente de primaria y paga los gastos básicos de agua y de luz como comprar lo que haga falta, el apoyo a sus hijos.
El señor Manuel tiene 55 años de edad, y vive en Batahola Norte con la liquidación de su trabajo compro un vehiculo el cual comenzó a trabajarlo como taxi, tiene dieciocho años de ofrecer sus servicios al publico. Con este préstamo comprara llantas nuevas y dar mantenimiento general al vehiculo para brindar un mejor servicio. Lo que mas desea es  poder comprar otra unidad en mejores condiciones ya que es su fuente de ingreso. Todo gracias al financiamiento de Afodenic el cual habré la esperanza hacia el progreso con sus financiamiento.
texts.en:
Manuel B. is a man who has worked since he was young to help his parents. They had few resources, and he was not able to finish his education. He worked as a bricklayer’s helper. Then he started to work as a general treasurer for a private company, Sovipe Ing. He got married, and they had four children. Three of the children are adults, and one is attending the university. His wife is an elementary school teacher. She pays for the basic expenses of water and light, and buys what they need to support their children. Manuel is 55, and he lives in Batahola Norte. With the liquidation of his work, he bought a vehicle and started using it as a taxi. He has been offering his services to the public for 18 years. With this loan he will buy new tires and provide general maintenance for the car. This way he will offer better service. What he wishes for most is to be able to buy another car in better condition as this is his source of income. He is very thankful for the loan from Afodenic, which gives him hope of making progress with his financing.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy new tires for his taxi to give it better maintenance

loans.name: Elfida Paulina

texts.es: ELFIDA PAULINA B. M. TIENE 52 AÑOS DE EDAD INICIO SU NEGOCIO HACE 14 AÑOS VENDIENDO TORTILLAS Y AGUAS GASEOSAS, SU NEGOCIO EMPEZO A CRECER Y COMENZO A VENDER GRANOS DE LA CANASTA BASICA, PORQUE SUS CLIENTES LE PEDIAN, ELLA VENDE MAIZ,AZUCAR, HUEVOS, GASEOSAS Y HELADOS, ELLA SOLICITA UN CREDITO YA QUE QUIERE APROVECHAR QUE EN ESTOS MESES ELLA PUEDE COMPRAR MAIZ EN GRANDES CANTIDADES, YA QUE LA GENTE COMPRA BASTANTE Y TAMBIEN LA VENTA DE GASEOSAS AUMENTA, SEMANALMENTE ELLA VIAJA A LA CAPITAL PARA COMPRAR EL MAIZ, AZUCAR Y HUEVOS, LAS GASEOSAS EL CAMION REPARTIDOR SE  LAS VENDE.  ELLA TIENE EL DESEO DE ARREGLAR UN CUARTO PARA ACOMODAR MEJOR LO QUE VENDE, PERO QUE LO HARA DESPUES YA QUE PREFIERE INVERTIR TODO SU CAPITAL PARA COMPRAR MAS MERCADERIA ELLA TIENE ENTRE SUS PLANES VER TERMINADA SU CASA Y SIGUE LUCHANDO PARA TENER UNA MEJOR CONDICION DE VIDA.
texts.en:
Elfida Paulina B. M. is 52 years old and started her business 14 years ago selling tortillas and sodas. Her business started to grow and she began selling grains from the basic food basket because her customers were asking for them. She sells corn, sugar, eggs sodas and ice cream. She is requesting a loan because she wants to take advantage of the fact that in these past months she has been able to purchase greater quantities since people are buying a lot of corn and sodas. She travels weekly to the capital to buy corn, sugar and eggs; the sodas she can buy from a delivery truck. She wants to fix a room to better arrange what she sells, but she will do this later as she prefers to invest all her capital in the purchase of more goods. She also wishes to see her house completed and keeps striving to have better living conditions.

Translated from Spanish by Esteban Riojas, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase basic grains

loans.name: Rosa María

texts.es:
Rosa tiene 37 años de edad, es madre soltera y vive junto a su hijo de 17 años de edad en el distrito de Paiján, provincia de Ascope, en la región La Libertad, ubicada a tres horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Desde hace veinte años tiene un puesto de venta en el mercado de la zona. Allí ella ofrece productos de primera necesidad, verduras y abarrotes a sus clientes que acuden a su establecimiento debido a la calidad de su atención y buen trato. Este negocio es la única fuente de ingresos con la que cuenta y con la que ha sacado adelante a su hijo desde el momento que nació.

Ella nos comenta feliz y orgullosa que su hijo hace poco ha ingresado a la universidad estatal de la región. Rosa está dispuesta a apoyarlo pero para ello debe ampliar su negocio.
