Por este motivo está solicitanto a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles que piensa invertir en la compra de más mercadería.

Rosa sueña con mejorar la condición de su casa y de su puesto. Ella es una madre luchadora y trabajadora. Ya ha trabajado con nuestra Institución anteriormente y ha demostrado ser una cliente responsable.
texts.en:
Rosa is 37 years old, is a single mom and lives with her 17 year old son in the district of Paijan, province of Ascope, in the region of La Libertad, located three hours from the city of Chiclayo. 20 years ago she established a sale stand in the market of the region. There is where she offers basic need products, vegetables and groceries to the clients that come to her stand due to the quality of her service and good treatment. This business is the only source of income that she can count on and with which she has been able to provide for her son from the moment he was born. She is happy and proud of her son because he recently started going to the state university. Rosa is willing to help him but to do so she has to expand her business. This is why she is requesting a loan to Edpyme Alternative for 1,000 nuevos soles that she plans to invest in the purchase of more merchandise. Rosa dreams with improving the conditions of her home and her stand. She is a fighting and working mother. She has worked with this institution before and has demonstrated to be a responsible client.

Translated from Spanish by Sofia Burt, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy merchandise to expand business

loans.name: Kukatoner Group

texts.en:
Varney M. is the leader of a group of five borrowers called “Kukatoner”. He is a 25-year-old student who’s fending for himself through business. He lives in Arthington but works in the Molton corner, Brewerville community, north of Monrovia, the capital of Liberia.

Varney’s business is growing and selling vegetables. He grows vegetables to be sold at retail to residents of Molton corner. He has been running this business for two years and is hoping to improve his business to establish a large farm in the future. He sells good vegetables at an affordable price in order to encourage customers to continue buying from him.

Varney started by burning charcoal but decided to get into agriculture. The only problem he encounters is the rainy season because when it rains heavily, it spoils his crops.

Varney needs this loan to purchase fertilizer and other chemicals for his garden to improve business. He dreams of giving his children a better education and building a house for them.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer and other chemicals for his garden

loans.name: Kenia Magdalena

texts.es: La joven Kenia V., prepara rica comida desde hace dos años, hace almuerzos para vender en zona franca, comida que vende al contado y al crédito con pago semanales. Cuando inicio las ventas lo hizo con fondos que su esposo dio y apoyo de una amiga logro comenzar a vender ropa, zapatos, y los encargo que el cliente hacia, pero las ventas en los últimos meses fueron pésima y no obtenía ganancia y con ropa que no vendía es por eso surge la necesidad de vender comida el cual cada día vende mas y es por eso recurre al financiamiento por que no cuenta con capital suficiente para hacer mas alimentos, el cual comprara: carnes, arroz, frijoles, lácteos, y frutas para preparar los alimentos y frescos.  Desde horas tempranas se levanta para hacer los diferentes menús con ayuda de su mama pues tiene que abordar una ruta para trasladarse a la zona a entregar la comida el almuerzo en hora exacta. Con este financiamiento quiere comprar más  platos, tazas cuchara entre otros, ya que ha aumentado sus ventas, en comida también comenzara a comprar ropa por que en este mes de navidad sus cliente le hacen encargo de ropa para sus hijos el cual da al crédito con la facilidad de pagar en varios pagos. Da las gracias A fodenic por el apoyo a mejorar su negocio el cual espera pronto ir ahorrando para tener su propia casa que es uno de sus sueños.
texts.en:
Kenia V. has been making delicious food for two years. She makes lunches to sell in the “Zona Franca” (a governmental organization that regulates exportation from Nicaragua). She sells food for cash and for credit with weekly payments. She started her sales with funds that her husband gave her and the support of a friend. She was able to start selling clothes and shoes, and she had customer orders. But, sales in the last few months have been bad. She did not get income, and she had clothes that she did not sell. That is how the need to sell food emerged. Every day she sells more. That is why she turns to a loan. She does not have sufficient capital to make the food. She will buy meat, rice, beans, dairy products, and fruit to prepare the food and drinks. She gets up very early to make the different meals. Her mother helps her. She has to be en route to transport and deliver the lunch at the exact time. With this loan she wants to buy more plates, cups, and spoons among other things. Now that her food sales have increased, she will also start to buy clothes. In the Christmas month her customers order clothes for their children, which she gives them credit to buy with the ease of making several payments. She thanks Afodenic for their help in improving her business. She expects to soon be saving for her own house, which is one of her dreams.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy more cups, plates, and spoons for her food and to buy various seasonal clothing

loans.name: Walter

texts.en:
Walter L. is 29 years old and married to Nancy Castillo. They live together in Encarnacion.

Walter has been a merchant for several years. He sells beverages on a daily basis, but also sells and delivers large orders of cement. He operates from his home. His two businesses allow him to make a good profit, save enough money and provide for his family. His wife Nancy is a teacher and helps contribute to the household income.

Walter is applying for a loan of 3,000,000 Gs to buy more stock because he has a lot of orders.

loans.use: To buy more stock to fill a large number of orders.

loans.name: Paula Lileth

texts.es: Paula Lileth es casada tiene 3 hijos que están estudiando los 2 mayores le ayudan a atender una tienda de productos de consumo diario desde hace 5 años la cual la instalo debido a que la colonia donde ella habita no había ninguna tienda, ella inicio vendiendo frutas y verduras, las cuales con el tiempo le generaron ganancias y fue asi como decidió vender productos como café, arroz, frijol, etc., y otros artículos que la gente consume, ahora Paula tiene necesidad de un préstamo ya que desea seguir invirtiendo en su negocio para poder cumplir el sueño de ver a sus hijos graduados y con un mejor futuro.
texts.en:
Paula Lileth is married and has three children who go to school. The two older ones help her in the store where she sells daily consumption products. Five years ago she set up the store because the community where she lives did not have a store. She started selling fruits and vegetables. In time they generated income. That is how she decided to sell products like coffee, rice, beans, and other items that people consume. Paula now needs a loan because she wants to keep investing in her business. She want to be able to fulfill her dream of seeing her children graduate with a better future.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Sale of daily consumption products

loans.name: Zulma

texts.en:
Zulma R. is 40 years old, has no children and is financially independent. She lives in Encarnacion.

Zulma owns a vendor stand from which she sells natural remedies and herbs. She has been running this business for several years and has built up a reliable customer base. She has been able to make good profit, have good savings and cover household expenses.

Zulma is applying for a loan of 2,000,000 Gs to buy more natural remedies of a higher quality. As summer nears, and the heat rises, her customers have higher demand for medicinal herbs for dehydration and heat stroke.

loans.use: To buy higher quality medicinals

loans.name: Jacinta

texts.en:
Jacinta is 45 years old and married with six school-age children, four sons and two daughters. She has a business selling fish in the Kawangware area of Nairobi. She sells dried tilapia and omena (fingerlings) and has been in business for thirteen years. She describes herself as a very determined lady who never gives up.

She successfully repaid a previous loan of Kes. 20,000 from Faulu. She says that, since she joined Faulu, she has been able to pay her children's school fees and increase her stock. 

She requested this loan of Kes. 40,000 from Faulu to buy more fish to sell. In the future, she would like to continue to expand her business so that she can support her children's education through college and see them become well-established.

loans.use: Add to her inventory of fish

loans.name: Luz De Lourdes

texts.es:
Doña Luz Lourdes H. tiene una pulpería el cual administra desde hace seis años, gracias a prestamos pequeño que hacia en instituciones logro formar su negocio mas solidó  y ayuda que su esposo dio, el se desempeña como contador en una empresa privada. Tiene tres hijos los cuales estudian para lograr un porvenir mejor. Este es su séptimo ciclo en Afodenic el cual comprara granos básicos como: frijoles, arroz azúcar, aceite, avena, lácteos, carnes y otros para mejorar las ventas ya
Que en los últimos meses no ha logrado vender lo suficiente lo cual ha obtenido ganancias bajas, es por eso la inversión para no fracasar en su venta y seguir aumentando de productos variados, en un futuro desea mejorar el local haciendo embaldosado ya que es de tierra y desea dar un mejor servicio de higiene a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Luz Lourdes H. has a mini market which she has run for six years. Thanks to small loans from institutions and help from her husband, she was able to make her business more solid. Her husband is a bookkeeper with a private business. She has three children who go to school to have a better future. This is her seventh cycle with Afodenic. She will buy basic grains like beans, rice, sugar, oil, oats, dairy products, meat, and other things to improve sales. In the last few months she has not sold enough, and her earnings are low. That is why she needs the investment so that she does not fail in her sales. She will keep increasing her various products. In the future, she wishes to improve her store by putting down a tile floor. The one she has is dirt, and she wishes to give a better, more hygienic service to her customers.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy beans, rice, sugar, oil, and dairy products

loans.name: St. Paul Group

texts.en:
Janet is forty-nine years old. She is married and has given birth to six children. In the photo, Janet is on the far right.

Janet owns and manages a grocery store. She is the leader of a trust bank group called "St Paul."  The members of this group are mostly traders and food vendors. They work to support their spouses to provide for their families. They buy their raw materials, wares, and goods from other towns and, sometimes, from nearby communities and sell them in the local market square. The members have been in business for a long time and have acquired much experience in their businesses. 

It is in light of this that they are requesting a loan to buy more goods to expand their businesses. The members of the group guarantee for one another as social collateral to access the loan. They want to give their children the best of education they can afford.

loans.use: To purchase groceries in bulk.

loans.name: Joséphine

texts.fr: T. Joséphine est née le 11 Avril 1963 au Togo, pays voisin du Bénin. Joséphine est mariée à AGBOGBA Joseph, un agent de recette des impôts. Le couple a un enfant qui est scolarisé. Joséphine vit au quartier Gbowèlè à Allada, dans le département de l’Atlantique, il y a de cela un an. C’est le conjoint de Joséphine qui assure les charges de la famille. Joséphine est allé à l’école jusqu’au secondaire. Mais depuis environs 10 ans, Joséphine vend des ustensiles de cuisine (bols en séries, glacières, bassines en séries, casseroles en séries, etc.) au marché Houègbo à Allada. C’est à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin, et au Nigéria, Etat voisin du Bénin, que Joséphine s’approvisionne. Joséphine a déjà bénéficié d’un crédit auprès de ALIDé et a bien remboursé le crédit. En vue d’agrandir son commerce et de satisfaire plus sa clientèle en période de fêtes, Joséphine sollicite un deuxième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Joséphine ambitionne construire une boutique dans sa maison pour vendre ses articles.
texts.en:
T. Joséphine was born on April 11, 1963 in Togo, a country neighboring Benin. She is married to AGBOGBA Joseph, a tax collector. The couple has one child who is in school. She has been living in the Gbowèlè district in Allada, in Atlantique county, for a year. Her husband is the one ensuring that family expenses are met. Joséphine has attended secondary school. But for about ten years, she has been selling kitchen utensils (nested bowls, insulated containers, nested tubs, sets of pots and pans, etc.) at the Houègbo market in Allada. She stocks up in Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin, and in Nigeria, a country neighboring Benin. She has already benefited from an ALIDé loan and has repaid it. With the aim of expanding her commerce and satisfying her customers further during these holidays, she’s requesting a second loan from ALIDé. Her ambition is to build a store in her house to sell her merchandise.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy 12 sets of bowls

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.es:
La socia YOLANDA pertenece al banco comunal “MERCAMUEBLE” y vive en la ciudad Imperial del Cusco. 

La socia tiene 28 años de edad, es soltera. Ella alterna sus actividades del hogar con la venta de muebles como escritorios, roperos, sillas, mesas, camas, etc. Ella tiene un stand de venta de muebles en el mercado “MERCAMUEBLES” ubicado en el primer paradero del distrito de San Sebastián de la provincia del Cusco. Ya son varios años con esta actividad y le ha ido muy bien gracias a todo el empeño que pone en su trabajo.
       
La socia requiere el préstamo para aumentar el capital del negocio de venta de muebles, ella quiere comprar más muebles para vender a sus clientes. 

La socia se encuentra agradecido por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Yolanda is a member of the Communal Bank "Mercamueble" and lives in the Imperial City of Cuzco. She is 28 years old and single. She alternates her activities between home and business selling furniture such as desks, armoires, chairs, tables, beds, etc. She has a furniture stand in the "Mercamuebles" market, located in the first location stop in the San Sebastian district, in the Cuzco province. She's being selling furniture for several years and it has gone very well thanks to all the effort she puts into her work. Yolanda is requesting a loan to increase her business capital to buy furniture. She wants to buy more furniture to sell to her clients. She appreciates the opportunity offered by means of this loan and promises to make the payments corresponding to the timetable.

Translated from Spanish by Jo Longnecker, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase capital to buy wood furniture to sell in market

loans.name: Siempre Amigas Group

texts.es: Luci C. de 29 años todos los días se levanta muy temprano  para vender sus productos, ella ofrece  CDS en diferentes ferias de la ciudad de El Alto,  con la ayuda de su esposo, inicio su negocio hace 3 años aproximadamente  por iniciativa propia, necesita el préstamo para comprar mayor mercadería, Luci es integrante del grupo  Siempre Amigas y desarrollan sus reuniones cada dos semanas en el Centro Focal  German Busch  y necesita el préstamo para comprar mercadería, las demás integrantes tienen variados negocios como la venta de verduras, ropa, CDS,  tenis y costura de ropa. Todas necesitan el préstamo para comprar mercadería e insumos.
texts.en:
Luci C., 29 years-old, rises very early everyday to sell her products. Luci sells CDs in different markets across the city of El Alto. With the help of her husband, she started this business about 3 years ago through her own initiative. She needs this loan to purchase more merchandise. Luci is a member of the group Siempre Amigas (Friends Forever) that has meetings every two weeks in the Centro Focal German Bosch (German Bosch Focal Center). The other members have a variety of businesses, such as the sale of vegetables, the sale of clothing, the sale of CDs, the sale of tennis shoes, and tailoring. They all need this loan for the purchase of merchandise and raw materials.

Translated from Spanish by Kevin Credo, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of merchandise and raw materials.

loans.name: Madeleine

texts.fr: A. Madeleine est née en 1956 et réside depuis 40 ans à Ahito à Allada, dans le département de l’Atlantique. Madeleine est une veuve qui a six enfants, dont trois sont à sa charge. Certains enfants sont scolarisés. Madeleine vit seule avec ses enfants et supporte les charges de la famille. Madeleine n’a pas été à l’école. Pour subvenir à ses besoins, Madeleine vend des cauris, des perles, des canaris, des fermetures, et divers autres objets à Allada. C’est à Porto-Novo, capitale administrative du Bénin, et à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin, que  Madeleine s’approvisionne. Madeleine mène cette activité depuis 40 ans. C’est une ancienne cliente de ALIDé qui rembourse bien ses crédits. En vue d’agrandir son commerce et d’accroître sa rentabilité pour pouvoir couvrir toutes ses charges,  Madeleine sollicite un troisième crédit auprès de ALIDé.
texts.en:
A. Madeleine was born in 1956 and has been living for forty years in Ahito in Allada, in Atlantique county. She is a widow with six children, of whom three are in her care. Some of them are in school. She lives alone with her children and provides for the family. Madeleine has not gone to school. To provide for herself, she sells cowries, pearls, earthenware, fasteners, and a variety of other items, in Allada. She stocks up in Porto-Novo, the administrative capital of Benin. She has been running this business for forty years. She is a previous ALIDé client who repays her loans. With the aim of expanding her commerce and increasing her profitability, so she can cover all her expenses, Madeleine is requesting a third loan from ALIDé.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy coweries, pearls,and a dozen earthen jars

loans.name: Edzon

texts.es:
Edzon es un joven soltero de 26 años, actualmente vive en una casa alquilada.
Su lugar de origen es una comunidad nativa donde no hay exceso al transporte, por ello en busca de un porvenir diferente, hace aproximadamente 2 años llegó al pueblo en crecimiento donde ahora vive, donde fue acogido brindándole un trabajo. Edzon ya se acostumbró a este lugar y ahora quiere sembrar sus propios cultivos de café y plátanos en chacras alquiladas. Él está muy convencido de que le irá bien, ya que en todo este tiempo de jornalero ha ganado la experiencia y destreza para el buen cuidado y desarrollo de estos cultivos, pues estos trabajos no le parecen nada pesados, manifiesta; culminado con su frase: “es cuestión de maña”. 
Los anhelos de Edzon son de comprarse sus propias chacras en este lugar y por ello trabajará duramente.

Este su primer préstamo con MFP, por lo que está muy contento con la oportunidad de crédito, ya que para él “es una bendición”, pues ahora podrá sembrar. Con el dinero solicitado alquilará un terreno y comprará plantitas de plátanos para iniciarse con ese cultivo.
texts.en:
Edzon is a single young man who is 26 years of age. He currently lives in a rented house. Since his native community had limited access to transportation, he decided to leave in search of a different life. It has been two years since he arrived in the village that provided him a job and he now calls home. Edzon has grown accustomed to the place and now wants to rent a piece of land to begin growing his own coffee and banana crops. He is convinced that he will do well in this endeavor because of the time he spent as a field laborer. Through this job, he acquired experience in developing and caring for these types of crops. Edzon does not find the work difficult and says, “It is a matter of skill.” He hopes to continue working hard and eventually buy his own farm.

This is his first loan with MFP. Edzon is pleased to have this opportunity and says “it is a blessing” because the planting season has started. The money requested will be used to pay the rent on his farmland and buy banana seedlings to start his first crop.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase banana seedlings & pay the rent on a piece of farmland

loans.name: Cyrus

texts.en:
Cyrus is 33 years old and married with two young daughters, ages one and three. He has a welding business and employs one person. He has been in business for four years. He also runs a green grocer and a retail shop. He describes himself as a very hard-working and focused person. 

He has requested this loan of Kes. 20,000 from Faulu to purchase welding pipes. In the future, he hopes to expand his shop to better cater to his family's needs.

loans.use: To purchase welding pipes

loans.name: Luzmila

texts.es:
La socia LUZMILA pertenece al banco comunal “MERCAMUEBLE” y vive en la ciudad Imperial del Cusco. 

La socia tiene 41 años de edad, es casada, tiene tres hijos. 

Ella alterna sus actividades del hogar con la fabricación de muebles como escritorios, roperos, sillas, mesas, camas, etc. Ella ayuda a su esposo con la fabricación de muebles y con la venta de los mismos. La socia tiene un stand de venta de muebles en el mercado “MERCAMUEBLES” ubicado en el primer paradero del distrito de San Sebastián de la provincia del Cusco. Ya son varios años con esta actividad y le ha ido muy bien gracias a todo el empeño que pone en su trabajo.
       
La socia requiere el préstamo para aumentar el capital del negocio de fabricación y venta de muebles, ella quiere comprar más materia prima (madera) y materiales para el acabado del muebles como tiner, laca, lijar, cola de carpintero, etc.
texts.en:
Luzmila is a member of the Mercamueble Communal Bank and lives in the imperial city of Cusco. She is 41 years old, married, and has three children.

Luzmila divides her time between her household activities and manufacturing furniture such as desks, wardrobes, chairs, tables, beds, and other pieces. She helps her husband with making and selling furniture. Luzmila also has a furniture vending post at the Mercamuebles Market, located at the main bus stop in San Sebastián District of the Province of Cusco. She has been in business for a number of years and has done very well due to her hard work and determination.

Luzmila is requesting a loan to increase her business capital for manufacturing and selling furniture. The materials she needs to buy include wood, paint thinner, lacquer, sandpaper, carpenter’s glue, and other items.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase materials & supplies

loans.name: Jhoselin

texts.es:
Jhoselin tiene 33 años, es madre de 3 hijos y vive en su casa propia con su pareja.
Cuando la visitamos la encontramos afligida porque hace dos meses su negocio de venta de golosinas quebró por dar al crédito, y por la falta de capital no pudiendo renovar a tiempo la mercadería. Mientras consiga el dinero para reflotar su negocio, por las tardes, viene dedicándose a la venta de comida (salchipollo: papas, salchicha y pollo frito) en la puerta de su casa. Cada porción la vende desde 1.50 hasta 3 soles, y diariamente gana entre 10 y 15 soles, con ese dinero puede aportar a los gastos de su casa, junto al trabajo de su esposo como jornalero de las chacras de sus vecinos. 
Jhoselin aspira a tener una tienda llena de dulces, pero para ello sabe que tiene que trabajar muchísimo.

Este es su primer crédito con MFP, por lo que se compromete a pagar puntualmente sus cuotas a su banco comunal. Con el dinero que solicita comprará golosinas y gaseosas para vender como complementos de sus porciones de salchipapas.
texts.en:
Jhoselin is 33 years old and the mother of three children. She and her partner live in their own home.

When we visited Jhoselin, we found out that her business selling candy went bankrupt two months ago. She sold her merchandise on credit, so she lacked the capital to keep her business afloat. In order to earn money to revive her business, she sells salchipollo (a dish that consists of potatoes, sausage, and fried chicken) in the evenings on the doorstep of her house. Depending on the size, each portion sells from 1.50 PEN to 3 PEN. Her daily profit ranges between 10-15 PEN. Her husband works for their neighbors as a farm laborer. With both of their incomes, they are able to cover their household expenses. Jhoselin aspires to have a candy shop full of sweets, but she knows more work is required to get to that point.

This is her first loan with MFP, so she commits to promptly repaying her Communal Bank. The money she requested will be used to buy candy and sodas to sell alongside her salchipollo dishes.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase candy & sodas to sell

loans.name: Zoila Isabel

texts.es:
ZOILA ISABEL  G. M.  tiene 54 años de edad inicio con su negocio desde que tenia   20 años con la ayuda de  su mama,  quien le había regalado un cerdo pequeño que ella engordò,  para luego destazarlo y vender la carne.  Con las ganancias de la venta de la carne  compró un cerdo grande y así fue como se inicio en el negocio, actualmente vende  chicharrones, carne de cerdo, chorizos y también se dedica a hacer chuchitos, ya sus clientes saben donde buscarla y llegan a su casa para comprar. Ella solicita este crédito ya que quiere aprovechar estos meses para comprar por lo  màs cerdos, ya que tiene bastante pedido de carne y necesita tener suficiente capital para poder adquirirlos ya que cada uno puede costar de Q.1,200.00 a  Q. 1,500.00.    

La señora Zoila tiene 8 hijos, pero ya solo 2 de sus hijas están solteras y viven con ella, ellas dos también están aprendiendo el negocio mientras que le ayudan a su mamá, ella dice que se siente contenta al enseñarles un oficio que les pueda ayudar a sus hijas y quiere invertir bien su capital para poder aprovechar las ganancias que obtenga de sus ventas ya que a ella siempre le ha gustado ahorrar, quiere ahorrar y que después de un tiempo ya tenga un bonito capital propio.
texts.en:
Zoila Isabel G. M. is 54 years old. She started her business twenty years ago when her mother gave her a small pig that she fattened, butchered, and sold for the meat. With her earnings she bought a larger pig and started her business as a result. Now she sells chicharrones, pork, and chorizo sausage. She also makes chuchitos (cornmeal dumplings with a meat filling, similar to tamales). Her customers know her well and come to her house to buy these products.

She is requesting this loan so that she can take advantages of these months for buying more pigs. She has enough orders for meat products and needs sufficient capital to acquire these animals, which can cost between 1200 to 1500 GTQ each.

Sra. Zoila has eight children, but only two of her daughters are single and still live with her. They are learning the business while helping their mother. Zoila says she is happy to teach them a trade that can help them in the future. She wants to invest her capital well so that she can save some of her earnings and build up some nice equity over time.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy more pigs to butcher

loans.name: Juan

texts.es:
Juan es un joven soltero de 27 años y actualmente vive con su hermana.
Cuando tenía 20 años migró de la sierra a la selva peruana en busca de un porvenir diferente, llegando a esta zona se puso a trabajar como jornalero (en campos de cultivo) desde las 7 de la mañana hasta las 6 de la tarde, durante varios años. Poco a poco fue ahorrando el dinero que finalmente invirtió en la compra de su propio terreno, allí construyó su casa de madera, y esto le dio mayor estabilidad. De entonces Juan trabaja más tranquilo y hace un año alquiló  terrenos fértiles donde sembró sus primeras plantaciones de café y cítricos (naranjas) y ahora trabaja en sus propios cultivos, con el anhelo de realizar buenas cosechas, y con esas ganancias, comprar sus propias chacras y evitar pagar el alquiler de la tierra.

Esta es la primera vez que accede a un crédito con MFP, por lo que está muy agradecido por la confianza brindada, y como respuesta a ello, pagará puntualmente todas sus cuotas a tiempo. El dinero que solicita comprará fertilizantes químicos para abonar sus chacras.
texts.en:
Juan is a single young man who is 27 years of age and currently lives with his sister. When he was 20 years old, he moved from the mountains to the Peruvian jungle in search of a different life. When he arrived in the area, he found a job as a field laborer working from 7am to 6pm. Over time he saved enough money to finally purchase his own land on which he built a house. He now has greater stability.

Juan currently works under much calmer conditions. A year and a half ago, he rented some rich farmland where he planted his first coffee plants and orange trees. Now that he manages his own crops, Juan hopes to experience good harvests. With his earnings, he plans to acquire his own farm so that he can avoid renting land.

This is his first time to access a loan from MFP. Juan is grateful for the confidence placed in him, so in return, he plans to make his payments on time. The money he is requesting will be used to buy chemical fertilizers to apply to his fields.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase fertilizers

loans.name: Luis Alberto

texts.es:
Luis es un padre de familia de 30 años de edad que vive junto a su esposa y su hija de tres años de edad en el distrito de Paiján, provincia de Ascope, en la región La Libertad, ubicada a 3 horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Desde hace 10 años trabaja vendiendo futas y verduras en un puesto del mercado de la zona. Empezó vendiendo limones de manera ambulante y poco a poco con su esfuerzo pudo hacer crecer su negocio. Gracias a este negocio mantiene a su familia por lo que da todo de sí diariamente para ofrecer productos frescos y baratos a sus clientes. El trabaja desde las seis de la mañana hasta las seis de la tarde.

La continua demanda de sus clientes por lo productos que ofrece ha hecho que Luis piense en ampliar su negocio por lo que se encuentra solicitando a Edpyme Alternativa un préstamo de 1000 nuevos soles que piensa invertir en la compra de más mercadería.

Su sueño es seguir trabajando y ampliando su negocio para poder terminar de construir su casa y educar bien a su hija. Luis ya ha trabajado con nuestra Institución anteriormente y ha demostrado responsabilidad y puntualidad en sus cuotas.
texts.en:
Luis is a father of 30 years old and lives with his wife and three-year old daughter in the Ascope District, in the La Libertad region, located three hours from the city of Chicalyo. Since he was 10 years old, he's been selling fruits and vegetables at a produce stand in the market. He began selling limes walking around, and little by little with his efforts he was able to make the business grow. Thanks to this business he maintains his family giving his all to offer fresh produce at inexpensive prices to his clients He works from 6 in the morning until 6 in the evening. His clients' continuous demand for products has made Luis think about expanding his business. He is asking Edpyme Alternative for a loan of 1000 N Soles to invest in purchasing more merchandise. He dream is to continue working and growing his business to be able to stop building his house and educate his daughter well. Luis has worked with our Institution before and has demonstrated responsibility and punctuality in paying back his loans.

Translated from Spanish by Jo Longnecker, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of merchandise to grow his business

loans.name: Benjamin Changotèlou

texts.fr: A. Benjamin Changotèlou est née vers 1947 et réside à Ahito à Allada, dans le département de l’Atlantique au Bénin, depuis environs 50 ans.  Benjamin Changotèlou est une veuve qui est mère de cinq enfants, dont trois sont à sa charge. Tous les enfants sont scolarisés. Benjamin Changotèlou vit seule avec ses enfants et supporte les charges de la famille. Benjamin Changotèlou n’a pas été à l’école. Pour subvenir à ses besoins, Benjamin Changotèlou vend de l’igname frit, des patates frites ainsi que des beignets d’haricot à Allada. C’est à Houègbo au Bénin et à Acassato au Bénin, que Benjamin Changotèlou fait ses achats. Benjamin Changotèlou est une ancienne cliente de ALIDé qui a déjà bénéficié de deux crédits auprès de l’institution, crédits qui ont été bien remboursés. En vue d’augmenter son fonds de roulement et augmenter la quantité de repas produite par jour, Benjamin Changotèlou sollicite un troisième crédit auprès de ALIDé.
texts.en:
Benjamin Changotèlou A. was born around 1947, and has lived in Ahito, in Allada, in the Atlantique Department of Bénin for about 50 years. She is a widow with five children, 3 of whom she is currently supporting. Although Benjamin Changotèlou never attended school herself, all of her children are students. To support her family, Benjamin Changotèlou sells fried yams, potatos and bean fritters in Allada. She purchases her ingredients in Houègbo and Acassato. Benjamin Changotèlou is a long-time client of ALIDé, having already received and repaid two previous loans. She has requested this third loan to increase her working capital in order to purchase more ingredients and prepare more meals every day.

Translated from French by Linda Koza, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase bags of beans, yams, vegetable oil, and firewood

loans.name: Siempre Unidas De La Alborada Group

texts.es:
DALILA A. A. D. C., TIENE 68 AÑOS D. EDAD, ES CASADA Y TIENE 4 HIJOS MAYORES D. EDAD. ELLA INTEGRA EL GRUPO “SIEMPRE UNIDAS D. LA ALBORADA” JUNTO CON 9 SOCIOS MUY EMPRENDEDORES Y ENTUSIASTAS RESIDENTES DEL DISTRITO D. COMAS.
ELLA TIENE UN NEGOCIO D. VENTA D. EDREDONES, QUE OFRECE A SUS FAMILIARES Y AMIGOS Y COMPRA SU MERCADERÍA D. ACUERDO A LOS PEDIDOS QUE RECIBE.

LA SRA. DALILA INICIÓ CON ÉSTE NEGOCIO CON EL DESEO D. APOYAR EN LOS GASTOS D. LA CASA, ES ASÍ QUE CON UN PEQUEÑO AHORRO D. CIEN SOLES, ADQUIRIÓ SÁBANAS Y FRAZADAS, LOS QUE FUE OFRECIENDO, Y POCO A POCO FUE AUMENTANDO SU MERCADERÍA Y TAMBIÉN SUS CLIENTES.
CON SU TRABAJO HA PODIDO APOYAR ECONOMICAMENTE A SUS HIJOS EN EL LOGRO D. SUS CARRERAS PROFESIONALES.
LE AGRADARÍA MUCHO, PODER AMBIENTAR UN ESPACIO EN SU CASA E INICIAR SU TIENDA D. VENTA D. EDREDONES, SABANAS,  FRAZADAS Y MÁS.
EL PRÉSTAMO SOLICITADO LO INVERTIRÁ EN MERCADERÍA PERO TAMBIÉN EN LA COMPRA D. PANETONES PARA APROVECHAR LA CAMPAÑA NAVID.ÑA.
texts.en:
Dalila A. A. is 68 years old, is married and has 4 grown children. She is part of the "Siempre Unidas D. la Alborada" group along with 9 very enterprising and enthusiastic members, who are residents of the Comas District. She has a business that sell quilts, which she offers to family members and friends, and she buys her merchandise in accordance with the orders that she receives. Dalila began this business from a desire to help with household expenses. And so with a small savings of 100 soles, she acquired sheets and blankets, which she then sold. Little by little she increased her merchandise and also her customers. Through her work, she has been able to support her children economically in the success of their professional careers. It would please her a lot to be able to set up a space in her house and start a store for selling her quilts, sheets, blankets and more. She will invest the requested loan in merchandise but also in the purchase of Christmas pastries, in order to make the most of the Christmas season.

Translated from Spanish by Marni Siegal, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase merchandise

loans.name: Las Persistentes Gb Group

texts.es: Venta de comida, frutas, verduras, dulces, CDS, juguetes, material escolar, atención de tienda de barrio, tejido de prendas de vestir y taller de hojalata, son los diversos negocios a los cuales se dedican las integrantes del grupo Las Persistentes GB, que pertenecen al Centro Focal German Busch, se agruparon hace aproximadamente 5 años por la necesidad de contar con un capital de trabajo que les permita incrementar su capital de trabajo. Un ejemplo claro es Ernestina Gutiérrez de 42 años,  casada y con cinco hijos, vende peluches  y juguetes hace 25 años en diferentes ferias con la ayuda de sus hijos, ahora por las fiestas de fin de año necesita mayor capital para comprar juguetes, tambien indica que ele gusta la forma de trabajo en grupo por la garantía solidaria ya que no necesita otros requisitos para acceder al préstamo.
texts.en:
The clients of the Las Persistentes GB group sell food, fruit, vegetables, sweets, CDs, toys, school materials, cloth for clothing and one has a tin workshop. They belong to the German Busch regional branch. They formed a group together 5 years ago for the necessity of a working capital loan that permitted them to increase their working capital.

One example is Ernestina, 42 years old, married with 5 children. She has sold stuffed animals and toys for 25 years in different markets with the help of her children. Now she needs more capital to buy toys for the holidays at the end of the year. She also indicates that she likes the group form of credit for the solidarity guarantee that doesn't need other requirements to apply for a loan.

Translated from Spanish by karl baumgarten, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase working capital

loans.name: A. Marie Christine

texts.fr: K. A. Marie Christine est née en 1966 à Allada dans le département de l’Atlantique au Bénin. Marie Christine vit depuis 23 ans à Dogoudo à Allada. Mariée à TCHATCHABLOUKOU Ferdinand, un directeur d’école à Sékou, non loin de Allada, Marie Christine est mère de cinq enfants tous scolarisés. Marie Christine vit ensemble avec ses enfants et son mari. Le couple supporte ensemble les charges de la famille. Marie Christine a été à l’école jusqu’au cours secondaire. Depuis 23 ans, Marie Christine vend des canaris à Allada, afin de subvenir à ses besoins. C’est à Bohicon dans le Zou au Bénin, que  Marie Christine s’approvisionne. Marie Christine est une ancienne cliente de ALIDé qui rembourse bien ses crédits. Afin d’accroître son activité et de mieux satisfaire sa clientèle, Marie Christine sollicite un troisième crédit auprès de ALIDé.
texts.en:
A. Marie Christine K. was born in 1966 in Allada, the the Atlantic Department of Bénin. She has lived for 23 years in Dogoudo, in Allada. Married to Ferdinand TCHATCHABLOUKOU, the director of a school in Sékou, not far from Allada, Marie Christine is the mother of five children, all of whom attend school. The couple works together to support the family. Marie Christine left school before high school. For the last 23 years, she has been selling large pottery vessels in Allada to help meet financial needs. She purchases the bowls in Bohicon in Zou. A long-time client of ALIDé, Marie Christine has always repaid her loans without problem. She is requesting a third loan from ALIDé to increase her business and meet client demands.

Translated from French by Linda Koza, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of 10 dozen pottery bowls

loans.name: Jose Salomon

texts.es: José Salomón tiene la edad la edad de 40 años, su actividad económica es ofrecer los servicios de sastrería, por lo que tiene más de 25 años que se dedica a este negocio, por lo que es una fuente ingresos necesaria para salir adelante. Este no es el primer préstamo que se le ha otorgado a Fundación León 2000, porque le han sido de buena ayuda para su negocio, el es un hombre muy responsable y disfruta mucho su trabajo. El financiamiento que José está solicitando es para capital de trabajo que será destinado para la compra de tela, tijeras, hilos, y otros insumos. Su deseo es seguir con su negocio y que sus hijos salgan adelante.
texts.en:
José Salomón is 40 years old. His economic activity is to offer tailoring services, because for more than 25 years he has been dedicated to this business because it is an income source necessary to move forward. This isn't the first loan that he has obtained from Fundación Leon 2000 because the loans have been a good help for his business. He is a very responsible man and enjoys his job a lot. The financing that Jose is requesting is for working capital that will be used for buying fabric, scissors, thread and other inputs. His wish is to continue his business and that his children will get ahead.

Translated from Spanish by karl baumgarten, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Bella Maria Group

texts.es:
La señora Segunda es una de las socias del grupo Bella Maria.

Por mucho tiempo la señora Segunda se dedico junto a su esposo ala fabricación de escobas debido a su poca experiencia su fabrica  fracaso a pesar que fue una experiencia muy triste no se desanimaron y nuevamente empezaron pero con otro negocio la venta de productos de limpieza, iniciarse en este negocio no fue nada fácil ya que tuvieron que lidiar con muchos obstáculos  buscar clientes, hacerse conocidos fue una tarea difícil a pesar de todo lograron salir adelante hoy al ver su negocio realizado realmente se sienten orgullosos y muy felices.

La señora Segunda, etiqueta, embolsa y vende  los productos de limpieza. es increíble saber que llevan en ese negocio mas de 30 años, con este trabajo han logrado darle educación para sus hijos ,una de ellas es profesora y otro de sus hijos será chef. eso los llena de felicidad  también ha logrado terminar el primer piso de su casa y para un futuro muy cercano están evaluando la posibilidad de abrir una tienda en su misma casa para ofrecer sus productos directamente al publico, ahora solo lo hacen repartiendo a sus clientes conocidos ambos saben que con una tienda abierta al publico sus ganancias aumentaran  también quieren fabricar sus propios productos  y por que no crear su propia marca , la señora esta muy agradecida a EDAPROSPO por que a través de sus prestamos su negocio a crece poco a poco ahora  usara este préstamo para el mismo fin, comprar mas productos por que tiene pedidos por entregar.

*La señora Segunda aparece sentada al lado izquierdo
texts.en:
Mrs. Segunda is one of the members of the Bella Maria ("Beautiful Maria") Group. For a long time Mrs Segunda worked with her husband making brooms. Because of their lack of experience, the business failed. Although it was very sad, they didn’t lose their enthusiasm and started another business selling cleaning products. It wasn’t easy to start this business because they had to overcome many obstacles including finding customers. It was difficult to become known, but despite these problems they succeeded and today feel very proud and happy to see the success of their business. Mrs. Segunda labels, wraps and sells the cleaning products. It’s amazing to realize that they have been working for 30 years in this business and have been able to educate their children. One of them is a teacher and another will become a chef. This fills them with happiness. They have also been able to finish the first floor of their house. In the near future they are looking at the possibility of opening a store in their house so that they can sell the products directly to the public. Currently they only sell to the customers that they know. Both of them realize that their profits will increase and they would like to make their own products. And why not have their own brand? Mrs. Segunda is very grateful to EDAPROSPO because with their loans, their business has expanded little by little. She will use this loan for the same purpose, to buy more products since she has orders to fulfill. *Mrs. Segunda is seated on the left side.

Translated from Spanish by Miriam Palacio, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy cleaning products

loans.name: Lazaro

texts.es:
Lazaro tiene 47 años, está casado y es padre de 6 hijos; junto a su esposa tienen una casa propia, donde viven con toda su familia.
Desde su juventud se dedica a los trabajos de albañilería, construye casas de material noble y de adobe. En esta labor prefiere trabajar generalmente por contrata y de ser pequeños trabajos cobra a diario la suma de 35 soles por  tarea, incluido almuerzo. Asimismo, tiene sus cultivos de café y plátanos donde trabaja en compañía de su esposa e hijos. 
Pero lo que más le agrada a Lázaro son los trabajos de albañilería, ya que rápidamente acumula el dinero con el que mantiene a su familia, aunque  también sabe que es muy pesado, pues últimamente se ha sentido un poco adolorido de la columna, debido a que el mes pasado había cargado demasiado peso al trabajar en un techado.

Para Lázaro, este es su primer crédito con MFP, por lo que tiene grandes expectativas, además sabe que este dinero le será muy útil, pues comprará fertilizantes para sus cultivos y herramientas para su trabajo de albañil.
texts.en:
Lázaro is a 47-year-old married father of six. He and his wife have their own house where they live with all their family. Since he was young, he has done masonry, building houses out of concrete and adobe. He generally prefers to do contract work. He does small jobs that pay 35 soles per day, including lunch. Additionally, he grows coffee and bananas, working the farm in the company of his wife and children. But what makes Lázaro happiest is masonry. The work allows him to make money to support his family, but he knows it is hard work. Recently, he has felt pain in his back because last month he carried too much weight when working on a roof. This is Lázaro's first loan with Microfinanzas Prismas, and he has a lot of great expectations for it. He knows the money will be very useful, because it will allow to buy fertilizers for his farming and tools for his masonry work.

Translated from Spanish by Lydia Brantley, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying masonry tools and fertilizer

loans.name: Doris Marlendi

texts.es: DORIS MARLENDI T. DE 24 AÑOS DE EDAD, ORIGINARIO DE SANTA APOLONIA, A 3 KILOMETROS DEL MUNICIPIO DE TECPAN GUATEMALA, DESDE QUE ERA NIÑA LE GUSTABA EL NEGOCIO, INSTRUIDO POR SUS PADRES, INICIA CON LA CRIANZA DE CERDOS PARA APOYAR A SU ESPOSO, Y MEJORAR SU SITUACION ECONOMICA, INICIA LA VENTA DE HUEVOS Y MAIZ, EL LOCAL DE SU PAPA, QUIERE TENER OTROS BIENES PARA CUANDO LE SEA IMPOSIBILITADA, TENGA LOS RECURSOS NECESARIOS  QUIERE  TENER UN BUEN NEGOCIO, HASTA EL MOMENTO ESTA SATISFECHA, CON LO QUE A EMPRENDIDO, CON LA EXPERIENCIA Y EL APOYO ECONOMICO, LOGRARA  SU SUEÑO.
texts.en:
Doris Marlendi Tepas is 24 years old. She is originally from Santa Apolonia, three kilometers from the municipality of Tecpan in Guatemala. Since she was a little girl, she has liked business thanks to her parents teaching. She takes care of pigs to help her husband and improve their economic situation. She sells eggs and corn in her father's store. She wants to sell other goods. When it is possible and she has the necessary resources, she wants to have a good business. For now, she is satisfied with what she's undertaken. With experience and economic support, she will achieve her dream.

Translated from Spanish by Lydia Brantley, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying eggs and corn

loans.name: Lucia

texts.es:
Lucia es una tierna y trabajadora mujer D. 66 años, está separada y tiene 9 hijos, pero todos ellos ya viven fuera D. casa.

Ella se dedica a la venta D. ropa y utensilios D. cocina, para ello acondicionó una habitación muy acogedora D. su vivienda. Cada día atienD. con mucho cariño y esmero a cada uno D. sus clientes, pues gracias a ellos viene captando buenas ganancias, con las que pueD. tener una vida tranquila. Por tal motivo quiere empezar a vender bebidas gaseosas y golosinas, pues ha comprendido que entre más productos ofrezca mayores serán sus ganancias. 
A su vez,  también tiene plantas cafetaleras y plátanos en sus chacras, que generalmente son trabajadas por peones, pero cuando es tiempo D. cosecha Lucia se luce en la recolección, como en sus años D. juventud.

Este es su tercer crédito con MFP, ella siempre quiere invertir correctamente su dinero, es por ello que para su primer préstamo compró un estante y en el segundo se inició en la venta D. ropa, este progreso la hace muy feliz. Ahora, con este dinero comprará golosinas y bebidas gaseosas para tener su tienda muy atractiva.
texts.en:
Lucia is a tender and hardworking 66-year-old woman. She is separated and has nine children, but all of them have moved out of her house. She sells clothes and kitchen utensils from her home. She has set up a cozy room to do so. Every day she attends each one of her clients with a lot of affection and care. Thanks to them she has maD. significant profit in her business, which allows her to have a calm and tranquil life. She wants to start selling carbonated beverages and sweets, because she knows that the more goods she offers, the more money she will make. At the same time, she grows coffee and banana plants at her small farm. Generally, the farm is worked by laborers, but during harvest time, Lucia also works as she did in her young age. This is her third loan with Microfinanzas Prisma. She has always correctly invested her money. With her first loan, she bought a shelf. With her second, she began her business selling clothes. This progress has maD. her very happy. With this loan she will buy carbonated beverages and sweets to have an attractive store.

Translated from Spanish by Lydia Brantley, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increasing merchandise

loans.name: Afiavi

texts.fr: K. Afiavi est née le 11 Novembre 1966 à Allada dans le département de l’Atlantique au Bénin. Afiavi est une veuve et mère de cinq enfants tous scolarisés, dont trois sont à sa charge. Afiavi vit à Ahito à Allada depuis 24 ans. Afiavi supporte seule les charges de la famille. Afiavi n’a jamais été à l’école. Pour faire face à ses besoins et à ceux de ses enfants, Afiavi mène comme activité, la vente de nourriture (riz, haricot, accompagné de sauce). A côté de cela, Afiavi vend des produits vivriers (riz, haricot, etc.) à son domicile à Allada. C’est à Bohicon dans le Zou au Bénin que Afiavi s’approvisionne. Afiavi mène cette activité depuis environs 40 ans. C’est une ancienne cliente de ALIDé qui rembourse bien ses crédits. Afiavi compte augmenter davantage la taille de son activité en cette période de préparation des fêtes, afin de mieux satisfaire les besoins de la clientèle. C’est pourquoi, Afiavi sollicite un troisième crédit auprès de ALIDé.
texts.en:
Afiavi K. was born on November 11, 1966, in Allada, in the Atlantic Department of Bénin. Afiavi is a widow with 5 children, all of whom educated. She still supports 3 of them financially. She never attended school. Afiavi has lived in Ahito, in Allada, for 24 years. She is the sole provider for her family. Her business is sale of food, such as rice and beans with sauce, as well as animal feed. She sells from her home. Afiavi purchases her ingredients and grains in Bohicon in the Zou in Bénin. She has been doing this work for nearly 40 years. A long-time client of ALIDé, she has always repaid her loans without problem. She requests this loan to increase the amount of product available to sell during this pre-festival period, to satisfy client demand.

Translated from French by Linda Koza, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase 3 bags of beans, 3 bags of rice, and 2 containers of vegetable oil.

loans.name: Lucia

texts.es:
Lucia tiene 50 años, está casada y es madre de 6 hijos, de los cuales, dos de ellos y una nieta viven con ella.
Desde que se casó, ella y su esposo trabajan juntos y tienen sembrados plátanos, café y frejoles. Los trabajos agrícolas, no le parecen nada pesado a Lucía, ni siquiera en los tiempos de cosecha y de todos el que mejores ganancias le brindan son los frejoles, pues producen durante todo el año y no requiere de mucha inversión. 
En el caso del café, también obtienen buen dinero, pero se tiene que esperar cada año. Por tal motivo, Lucia y su esposo van renovando constantemente sus cultivos de frejol, por ello es que todo el tiempo se mantienen ocupados trabajando en estos cultivos, pues desean que a sus hijos y nietos no les falte nada.

Este es su primer crédito con MFP, por lo que se compromete a ser muy cumplida en sus cuotas, ya que está muy agradecida por permitirle ingresar a un banco comunal. Con el dinero que solicita comprará fertilizantes químicos para abonar su cultivo preferido, el frejol.
texts.en:
Lucia is a 50-year-old married mother of six. Two of her children and one grandchild live with her. Since she's been married, Lucia and her husband have worked together growing bananas, coffee, and beans. Their agricultural work doesn't seem difficult to Lucia, even during harvest times. Out of all the crops, the ones that generate the greatest revenue are the beans, because they are grown all year and do not require much investment. Coffee also makes good money, but it has to wait every year. For this reason, Lucia and her husband are constantly working on their bean cultivation. They spend all their time working on their crops because they don't want their children to want for anything. This is her first loan with Microfinanzas Prisma, and she promises to be timely with her payments. She is already very grateful for being allowed to be part of a community bank. She will use the money she is asking for to buy chemical fertilizer to fertilize her preferred crop: the bean.

Translated from Spanish by Lydia Brantley, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying fertilizer

loans.name: Maribel

texts.es:
Maribel tiene 26 años, es una joven madre de una pequeña de 8 años, está casada y es muy trabajadora.

Hace 8 años, ella y su esposo llegaron a este pueblo de la selva peruana para trabajar como peones en las chacras, sin ningún bien, solo las ganas de trabajar duro y hacer bien las cosas. Al cabo de dos años ya habían adquirido un terreno donde construyeron una bonita casa con proyecciones de negocio, una tienda. Ya han pasado 6 años de arduo trabajo en su bodega con la venta de comestibles de primera necesidad y hace poco fabricaron un horno para pan, al que se dedica su esposo y ella lo apoya desde las 3 de la madrugada.
Esta pareja es muy emprendedora y nada conformista, es por ello que para más adelante quieren comprar un máquina de aserrar madera para que su esposo trabaje en ello el resto del día, al terminar de elaborar los panes.

Este es el primer crédito de Maribel con MFP y espera que el resto de sus compañeros del banco comunal sean tan cumplidos como ella, pues no desea que haya alguna persona irresponsable. El dinero que solicita es para la compra de más mercadería y también de algunos sacos de harina para la elaboración de pan.
texts.en:
Maribel is 26 years old. She is a married young mother of an 8-year-old girl. She is very hardworking. Eight years ago, Maribel and her husband came to this town from the Peruvian jungle to work as farm laborers. They came with no belongings, bringing just the desire to work hard and do good things. After two years they acquired a piece of land where they built a beautiful house with dreams of having a store there. They have put in six years of arduous work in their grocery store selling basic food stuffs. Recently, they built an oven to make bread. Maribel's husband makes the broad, and she helps him every day from three in the mornings. This is a very entrepreneurial and non-conformist couple. Further in the future, they want to buy an electric saw so Maribel's husband can work with it during the day after he's done making bread. This is Maribel's first loan with Microfinanzas Prisma. She hopes that the rest of her partners in the community bank are as thoughtful and punctual as she is. She doesn't want there to be an irresponsible person in the group. The money she is asking for is to buy more merchandise for her store as well as sacks of flour for bread-making.

Translated from Spanish by Lydia Brantley, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying merchandise and sacks of flour

loans.name: Bibiana Frank

texts.es: Bibiana Frank tiene 53 años, es casada y tiene 5 hijos que viven de manera independiente. Ella se dedica al negocio de la compra-venta de plata, la cual distribuye de manera ambulante y también en su casa. Tiene 7 años de tener este negocio. La señora empezó este negocio con muy poca cantidad de prendas ya que en ese tiempo compraba muy poco, ahora ella compra por mayores cantidades, ya que vende mucho más que antes, y  posee mayor cantidad de compradores. El financiamiento será invertido en la compra de productos, de los cuales ya tiene  ciertos encargos. Su deseo siempre ha sido mantener su record ya que le gustaría establecer otro negocio.
texts.en:
Bibiana Frank is 53 years old, married, and has five children who live independently. She is in the business of buying and selling silver which she distributes as a street vendor and also from her home. She has been in this business for 7 years. She started this business with a very small amount of pieces since at that time she would purchase very little. Now she buys larger quantities because she sells much more than before and has a greater number of buyers. This loan will be invested in the purchase of product, some off which she has already ordered. Her desire has always been to uphold her record because she would like to establish another business.

Translated from Spanish by Joseph Tobin, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: working capital

loans.name: Kuña Katupyry Group

texts.es:
This committee Barrio San Pedro was formed through the initiative of one of the members, Mrs Analia Del Valley who came to the foundation in order to learn about the program.
This committee was formed from women who run businesses such as selling clothing and lingerie, cupboards, selling edible goods, rotisserie, phone accessories, etc.
Depending on availability and creativity, each member decides how to use the Fundacion's support structure for their businesses, such as budgeting or training workshops.
Ms Silvana L. is a perfect example of a successful female entrepreneur, who sells clothing across Encarnacion, the city where she lives. She does not own a car, so she has to move around her products to her customers, which takes a lot of time and hard work. Sometimes her husband and children help her, as it is very labor-intensive. 
 Mrs. Juana A., another hard working female entrepreneur, owns a pantry, with which she can help family expenses. Her husband has been working in woodworking for over 10 years and has a large number of customers, however, his profits are insufficient to cover household expenses. Juana's business is essential to the livelihood of their family. 
The loans given to these women by the Fundacion Paraguaya are essential in improving the living conditions of families and helping them grow. The 

The amount received by each woman varies from 300,000 to 2,000,000, which the women use to invest in their independent businesses.

loans.use: Merchandise

loans.name: Gracierra

texts.fr: A. Gracierra est née vers 1970 à Allada dans le département de l’Atlantique au Bénin. Gracierra vit depuis 25 ans à Ahito à Allada. Mariée à AZANDEGBE Koffi un mécanicien, Gracierra est mère de cinq enfants, dont certains sont scolarisés. Seul le conjoint assure les charges de la famille. Gracierra n’a jamais été à l’école. Depuis près de 30 ans, Gracierra vend des condiments (tomate fraîche, piment, poivre, cube, etc.), des divers (sardine, tomate en boîte, pâtes alimentaire, etc.) et de l’huile de palme à son domicile. Gracierra s’approvisionne à Allada et à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin. Gracierra est une ancienne cliente de ALIDé qui a déjà bénéficié de trois crédit dans l’institution et qui les a bien remboursés. Gracierra voudrait agrandir davantage son activité afin de couvrir les besoins de ses clients en période de fêtes. C’est pourquoi Gracierra sollicite un quatrième crédit auprès de ALIDé.
texts.en:
Gracierra A. was born around 1970 in the Atlantic Department of Bénin. For 25 years Gracierra has lived in Ahito in Allada. She is married to Koffi AZANDEGBE, who is a mechanic. Only one spouse supports the family. She has 5 children. Some of them are students. She never attended school. For more than 30 years, she has earned a living selling miscellaneous food from her home, including condiments such as fresh tomato, chili pepper, black pepper, and seasoning cubes, as well as canned sardines and tomatoes, pastas and palm oil. She buys her goods in Bénin’s economic capital, Cotonou. As one of ALIDEé’s long-term clients, she has already received and repaid three previous loans. She wants this 4th loan to stock up for her clients’ needs during the upcoming year-end holidays.

Translated from French by Linda Koza, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase 2 baskets of fresh tomatoes, 1 of peppers, 4 crates of canned conserves.

loans.name: Viviana

texts.es:
La señora Viviana L. está muy agradecido por su cooperación en los anteriores créditos los cuales han sido para su negocio. 
En esté momento ha ella y a su esposo el señor Anival Suárez, es están ofreciendo un terreno a muy buen preció y en un buen lugar para poder poner otro taller de reparación de autos, pero en esté momento no cuanta con el dinero necesario para poder pagar el enganche y así poder obtener el terreno y establecer el negocio, para darles empleo a otras dos personas mas. 
Con las ganancias de los negocios pagaran el crédito, ya que los gastos familiares los cubrirá la señora Viviana con su ingreso de su trabaja como enfermera de un hospital.
La persona que aparece en la foto es el señor Anival Suárez ya que la señora de encontraba en la casa cuidando al niño.
texts.en:
Mrs. Viviana L. is very appreciative for the loans she has received in the past for her business. At this time, she and her husband, Mr. Anival Suárez, have been offered a well priced plot of land, located in a good area in order to construct another auto repair shop. However, right now they do not have the financial resources to pay the down payment to get the plot and establish the business, so they can offer employment to two more people. With the earnings from the businesses, they will pay the loan, as the household expenses are covered by Mrs. Viviana, with her income from working as a hospital nurse. The person who appears in the picture is Mr. Anival Suárez as Viviana is inside the house taking care of the child.

Translated from Spanish by Lauren Jackson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy a space for another business

loans.name: Elise

texts.fr: A. Elise est née en 1957 à Allada, dans le département de l’Atlantique au Bénin. Elise réside depuis près de 50 ans à Ahito à Allada. C’est une veuve et mère de quatre enfants, tous scolarisés. En plus de ses enfants, Elise a un autre enfant à charge. Elise supporte seule les charges de la famille. Elise n’a pas été à l’école. Pour subvenir à ses besoins, Elise vend des condiments de sauce (tomates fraîches, piments, oignons, tomate en boîte, gingembre, etc.), du gombo à son domicile et au marché de Allada. C’est à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin que Elise s’approvisionne. C’est une ancienne cliente de ALIDé qui rembourse bien ses crédits. Elise sollicite un troisième crédit auprès de ALIDé afin d’augmenter son fonds de roulement et son chiffre d’affaire surtout en période de fêtes de fin d’année.
texts.en:
Elise A. was born in Allada, in the Atlantic Department of Bénin in 1957, and has lived nearly all her life in Ahito, in Allada. She is a widow, mother of four, who also supports a fifth child. Elise never attended school, but all of her children are educated. To provide for her household, Elise sells sauces and condiments (fresh tomato, pepper, onion, canned tomatoes, ginger, etc.) and gumbo at her home and also at the market in Allada. She purchases her goods in Cotonou, the economic capital of Bénin. She is a long-time client of ALIDé, who has successfully repaid her loans. She is requesting a third loan to increase her working capital to increase sales during the year-end holidays.

Translated from French by Linda Koza, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase stock of fresh tomatoes, peppers and onions.

loans.name: Mercedes Del Carmen

texts.es: Mercedes del Carmen tiene la edad de 56 años. Es una mujer casada y junto a su esposo tienen 2 hijos que están a su cargo. La actividad económica a la que se dedica es el destace de cerdo. Hace más de 8 años que se dedica a este negocio, por lo que desde muy joven aprendió este oficio. Anteriormente Mercedes no tenía un trabajo y fue por su familia que aprendió este oficio u así decide trabajar en esto, su esposo quien siempre la está apoyando en la compra de los cerdos y ayudar a cuidar a sus hijos. Ella siempre fue una persona luchadora. El financiamiento que está solicitando es para la compra de materia prima para tener más cerdos ya que se acerca la temporada navideña y le gente los vende a precio accesible. Su deseo es proporcionarle mejoras a su humilde vivienda.
texts.en:
Mercedes del Carmen is 56 years old. She is married with two children. She has worked as a butcher for more than eight years. She learned the job when she was very young. Previously, Mercedes did not have a job. She became a butcher to support her family. Her husband has always supported her in buying the pigs and helps take care of their children. She has always been a fighting person. The financing she is asking for is to buy more pigs. Since it is close to Christmas time, people are selling pigs at accessible prices. She wants to provide better for her humble home.

Translated from Spanish by Lydia Brantley, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying pigs

loans.name: Stephen

texts.en:
Stephen is 26 years old and married. He has a three year-old daughter named Sasha. He has a video library that includes a selection of DVDs, films, and tapes. He's been in this business for two years and has one employee. He also runs a boutique and was previously employed by Regal Pharmaceuticals. 

Stephen repaid a loan of Kes. 25,000 from Faulu. He is now requesting a loan of Kes. 50,000 to buy a computer, renovate his shop, and add some accessories to sell. 

He describes himself as a hard-working, responsible, and social businessman, who is determined to make ends meet in life. Since Faulu's training, he says that he has adopted a culture of savings and become empowered economically. In the future, he hopes to establish himself as a businessman and own his own home.

loans.use: To buy a computer and add to his inventory

loans.name: Jackie

texts.fr: A. Jackie est née le 06 Août 1977 à Allada, dans le département de l’Atlantique au Bénin. Jackie vit à Dogoudo à Allada depuis près de 33 ans. Jackie est mariée à ALAVO Mesmin, un enseignant, et est mère de deux enfants qui sont tous scolarisés. Jackie vit ensemble avec ses enfants et son mari. Le couple supporte ensemble les charges de la famille. Jackie n’a pas été à l’école. Il ya 23 ans de cela que Jackie vend des sucettes glacées (faites à base de bissap et sucre, dans un sachet) et des glacières par le système de distribution. C’est à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin, que Jackie s’approvisionne. Jackie est une ancienne cliente de ALIDé qui a déjà bénéficié de deux crédits auprès de l’institution, crédits qui ont été bien remboursés. Jackie voudrait augmenter son fonds de roulement et agrandir son activité, en la diversifiant par l'achat et la vente de charbon de bois. C’est pourquoi, Jackie sollicite un troisième crédit auprès de ALIDé.
texts.en:
A. Jackie was born on August 6, 1977 in Allada, in Atlantique county, in Benin. She has been living in Dogoudo, in Allada, for nearly 33 years. She is married to ALAVO Mesmin, a teacher, and is the mother of two children who are both in school. She lives together with her children and husband. The couple provide for the family jointly. Jackie has not gone to school. For 23 years since then, she has been selling popsicles (made with hibiscus flowers and sugar and offered in a plastic pouch) and insulated containers through the distribution system. She stocks up on supplies in Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin. She is a previous ALIDé client who has already benefited from two loans from this micro-finance institution, and she has repaid the loans. She would like to augment her working capital and to expand her business by diversifying it. To do so, she would like to sell charcoal. This is why she's requesting a third loan from ALIDé.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy supplies for popsicles (hibiscus flowers, pouches), 2 sacks of sugar, 30 sacks of charcoal

loans.name: Olga Luz

texts.es:
Olga tiene 45 años de edad, es casada y vive junto a su esposo y sus cuatro hijos en el distrito de Paiján, provincia de Ascope, en la región La Libertad, ubicada a 3 horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Desde hace cinco años tiene un quiosco cerca a una estación de venta de combustible en donde vende gaseosas, golosinas y dulces a los diversos trasnportistas que frecuentan la zona. Además vende ceviche los días sabado, lunes y jueves. Su esposo trabaja en la ciudad de Tarapoto y el dinero que ella percibe es de gran ayuda para el sostenimiento de su hogar.

Olga trata de dar lo mejor de sí para sacar adelante su negocio. Ella desea comprar más mercadería para ofrecerla a sus clientes por lo que está solicitando a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 500 nuevos soles.

Su más grande anhelo es ver a su hijo mayor estudiando en la escuela de suboficiales de las Policía para mudarse a Trujillo e instalar allí una pequeña tienda. Olga ya ha trabajado con nosotros anteriormente y ha demostrado ser una cliente responsable y puntual con sus pagos.
texts.en:
Olga is 45 years old, married, and lives with her husband and four children in the Paiján district of La Libertad, which is located about 3 hours from the city of Chiclayo. For about five years now, she has had a kiosk near a gas station, where she sells sodas, snacks and candy to the various travelers that frequent the area. In addition, she sells ceviche on Saturdays, Mondays and Thursdays. Her husband works in the city of Tarapoto, and the income she generates goes a long way toward helping to support the family. Olga tries to give her best to help grow the enterprise. She wants to buy more merchandise to offer to customers, which is why she is requesting a loan of 500 Peruvian soles through Edpyme Alternativa. Her greatest wish is to see her oldest son studying in the Police Academy, to move to Trujillo and open a small store. Olga has worked with us before, and has demonstrated herself as a responsible client who is timely with her loan payments.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy more merchandise to grow her business.

loans.name: Kuña Rory Group

texts.en:
This committee is located in the Barrio Santa Maria of the city of Encarnación. 
Each woman has her own independent business, such as: selling clothes, selling drinks, dressmaking, selling food, hairdressing, farming and selling fish, running kiosks and market stalls. 
The activity of each of the members is very important to their livelihoods, for example, Mrs Maria Lopez owns a small hair salon that she operates from her home. She started with very few materials and clients, and sacrificed a lot to improve the family business. The amount received by each woman varies from 300,000 to 2,000,000 Gs, which the women invest in their businesses and entrepreneurial activities to better their livelihoods.

loans.use: Merchandise

loans.name: Pulchérie Mireille

texts.fr: A. Pulchérie Mireille est née le 12 Septembre 1970 à Allada, dans le département de l’Atlantique au Bénin. Pulchérie Mireille vit à Ahito à Allada depuis une dizaine d’année. Mariée à TINHOUN Brice un vendeur de bois de chauffage, Pulchérie Mireille est mère d’un enfant qui est scolarisé. Pulchérie Mireille vit ensemble avec ses enfants et son mari. Le couple supporte ensemble les charges de la famille. Pulchérie Mireille n’a pas fréquenté les classes. Depuis une dizaine d’année, Pulchérie Mireille vend de la bouillie (faite à base de maïs), accompagnée de beignets (faits à base de farine de blé et du sucre) de façon ambulante et aussi à son domicile. C’est à Allada que Pulchérie Mireille s’approvisionne. Pulchérie Mireille est une ancienne cliente de ALIDé ayant déjà bénéficié de trois crédits à ALIDé, crédits qui ont été bien remboursés. Pulchérie Mireille sollicite un quatrième crédit auprès de l’institution afin d’augmenter son fonds de roulement et de renforcer son activité.
texts.en:
A. Pulchérie Mireille was born on September, 12, 1970 in Allada, in Atlantique county in Benin. She has been living in Ahito in Allada for twelve years. Married to TINHOUN Brice, a firewood vendor, she is the mother of one child who is in school. She lives with her child and her husband. The couple provide for the family jointly. Pulchérie Mireille has not gone to school. For twelve years, she has been selling porridge (made with cornmeal) served with beignets (made with wheat flour and sugar). She sells from place to place and also out of her home. She stocks up in Allada. She is a previous ALIDé client having already benefited from three ALIDé loans, which have been repaid. She's requesting a fourth loan from this micro-finance institution to augment her working capital and to bolster her business.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a sack of corn, a sack of wheat flour, a sack of sugar, a container of vegetable oil

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en:
Lucy is married and has four children, two of whom still attend school. She runs a wholesale tailoring business where she makes school uniforms. She has been in this business for seven years and employs two people. 

Lucy is requesting a loan of Kes. 60,000 to buy more material to make uniforms. Lucy describes herself as successful and has repaid several previous loans that have helped her to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy material to make uniforms

loans.name: Rosa Eligia

texts.es: Rosa Eligia tiene 46 años de edad. Vive en su propia casa ella tiene 2 hijos a su cargo que son por lo que trabaja duro. La actividad económica a la que se dedica es la venta y elaboración de especies. Hace más de 7 años que se dedica a esta actividad y ha tenido la oportunidad de trabajar con Fundación León 2000, ya que le han brindado la ayuda suficiente para salir adelante con su negocio. Ella dio inicio a este negocio por cuenta propia para seguir manteniendo los estudios de sus hijos. Con el paso del tiempo fue aumentando sus productos. El financiamiento que solicita es para capital de trabajo para la compra  leña, azúcar, saborizantes entre otras cosas. El sueño de Rosa es mejorar cada día su negocio.
texts.en:
Rosa Eligia is 46 years old. She lives in a house she owns, and has 2 children in her care for whom she works hard. The business she dedicates herself to involves making and selling specialty items. She has dedicated herself to this activity for 7 years, and has had the opportunity to work with the Fundación León 2000, which has provided enough help for her to get ahead in her business. She started the business in order to support her children in continuing their educations. Over time, she augmented the number of products she stocked. The financing that she requests is for working capital, to buy lumber, sugar, and condiments, among other items. Rosa’s dream is to improve her business each and every day.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital.

loans.name: Mujeres Alegres Group

texts.en:
The Mujeres Alegres Group is a committee of women dedicated to investing in their businesses to grow profits and improve productivity. All women in the group use their loans to invest in their businesses, such as selling clothing, dressmaking and tailoring, selling food and delivering groceries, running kiosks and pantries. The amount received by each woman varies from 1,000,000 Gs to 1,400,000 Gs.

Maria D. P. T. Gonzalez-T. sells clothing. 
M. Blanca D. G. sells vegetables. 
Gloria B. C. S. owns a kiosk.
Delia G. A. Lopez is a tailor.
R. G. Pabla Rivers owns a pantry.
Victorine S. sells groceries. 
Martina S. owns a kiosk.
Beatriz C. Lucila F. sells vegetables. 
Aurora Concepcion V. N. has a pantry. 
Felipe G. T. sells clothing.
Ana Noemi S. B. sells food.
Delia V. C. N. owns a pantry.
Fatima B. M. S. sells clothing.
Alexandrina D. G. sells groceries.
Maria T. Lopez Acuna is a tailor.

loans.use: Merchandise

loans.name: Jesucristo Es La Puerta 2 Group

texts.en:
Sonia, 43, lives near La Romana, Dominican Republic. She is the coordinator for her group, Jesucristo es la Puerta (Jesus Christ is the Door), and her story is representative of the other borrowers in the group.

Sonia runs a successful arts and crafts business from her home, where she lives with her children and husband. This is Sonia’s fifth loan with Esperanza International, and she plans to use it to buy paint and other supplies for her crafts. In particular, Sonia will paint paintings to sell to her community and to tourists who often pass through La Romana.

Life in La Romana can be harsh; electricity is scarce, running water is never potable, and the hurricane season can take a toll on the often-flimsy homes typical of the area. Despite the difficulties, Sonia has found blessings in the support her business brings to her family. She has already been able to construct two brand-new rooms and purchase school supplies for her children. She hopes that with continued profits, she will be able to purchase paint for her home to make it look nicer. Sonia knows this goal is easily within reach, as her business continues to grow. Thank you for lending to Sonia and the Jesucristo es la Puerta group!

loans.use: Paints and supplies for making crafts

loans.name: Las Mujeres Emprendedoras Group

texts.es:
Este grupo de personas residen en Colonia Santa Fe, del municipio de San Antonio, Suchitepéquez,						
anteriormente eran personas que vivían en condiciones muy difíciles ya que no contaban con un       						
ingreso suficientemente grande para  cubrir todas esas necesidades que tenían en el hogar, tales     						
como dar un estudio completo a sus hijos, cubrir los gastos medicinales, dar una adecuada alimentacion 						
a sus hijos y por consecuencia no podían ofrecer un buen futuro a su familia.  Por medio de                              						
estas necesidades acudieron a la Asociación para solicitar un préstamo y asi poder iniciar un negocio						
que les ayudaría a cubrir sus gastos; negocios como, venta de tamales, de comidas, de atoles						
y tortillas.  El esfuerzo de estas personas se ha visto atraves de los logros que han tenido, así
