mismo son personas muy responsables que han sabrán invertir bien los créditos a otorgarse por la 						
Asociación ASDIR.
texts.en:
This group of people resides in Colonia Santa Fe, located in the municipality of San Antonio, Suchitepéquez. Previously, they lived under very difficult conditions because they did not have enough income to cover all the household necessities. Typical expenses included educations for their children, medical care costs, and food for their families, therefore they could not offer them a very bright future. As a result of these needs, they turned to the Association to request a loan to be able to start businesses to help them generate additional income; businesses such as sale of tamales, other food, drinks and tortillas. The effort of this group can been seen through their accomplishments and, likewise, they are very responsible and have known how to invest the loans provided by the ASDIR Association well.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To launch businesses.

loans.name: Bricy Lorena

texts.es:
Bricy es una madre de familia de 29 años de edad que vive junto a su esposo y sus dos hijos en el distrito de Paiján, provincia de Ascope, en la región La Libertad, ubicado a 3 horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Desde hace más de un año tiene una tienda que funciona en la casa donde vive actualmente. Ella nos cuenta que la idea del negocio partió de su suegra y de la necesidad de contar con una fuente permanente de ingresos que sirva para solventar los gastos familiares ya que su esposo trabaja como obrero eventual y también manejando mototaxis (vehículos motorizados utilizados en el transporte de carga y pasajeros).

Ella ofrece abarrotes, bebidas y verduras a sus vecinos los cuales acuden a su establecimiento para agenciarse de sus productos rápidamente pues el mercado queda lejos de la zona en donde vive. La asidua clientela que frecuenta su negocio ha hecho que Bricy piense en ampliarlo con la compra de más bebidas. Por este motivo se encuentra solicitando por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles.

Bricy es una madre emprendedora, resposable y muy trabajadora. Su más grande anhelo es poder ampliar su negocio, tener una casa propia y brindarle a su hijos una educación de calidad.
texts.en:
Bricy is 29 years old and the mother of a family. She lives with her husband and two sons in the Paiján District, Province of Ascope, in the La Libertad Region which is situated three hours from the city of Chiclayo. For more than a year she has had a store which she runs in the house where she currently lives. She tells us that the idea for her business came from her mother-in-law and from the need to have a permanent source of income in order to meet the household expenses, since her husband works as a day laborer and also drives mototaxis (motor vehicles which are used to transport goods and passengers). She provides groceries, beverages and produce to her neighbors who patronize her establishment in order to obtain her products since the market is located some distance from the area where they live. The regular customers who frequent her business have got Bricy thinking about expanding it by purchasing more beverages. That's why she is approaching Edpyme Alternativa for the first time for a loan of 1,000 New Sols. Bricy is an enterprising mother who is responsible and very hardworking. Her greatest wish is to be able to expand her business, to have a decent house and to provide her children with a quality education.

Translated from Spanish by Daniel Kvaka, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy more beverages to expand her business.

loans.name: Renovacion Group

texts.es:
ALEJANDRINA H. B., TIENE 35 AÑOS DE EDAD, ES SOLTERA, TIENE UNA HIJA DE 10 AÑOS, QUIEN ES LA RAZON DE SU ESFUERZO Y SACRIFICIO. ALEJANDRINA INTEGRA EL GRUPO “RENOVACIÓN”, FORMADO POR OTRAS 11 SOCIAS DEDICADAS A TRABAJAR PARA APOYAR A SUS FAMILIA.
ALEJANDRINA SE DEDICA HACE 7 AÑOS  A LA VENTA DE GOLOSINAS, PARA LO CUAL SE AYUDA DE UN COCHESITO Y SE UBICA EN LA PUERTA DE UN LOCUTORIO, EN LA AV.PANAMERICANA NORTE.
ANTES DE QUEDAR EMBARAZADA, TRABAJABA EN UNA CASA COMO EMPLEADA, PERO AL ENTERARSE LOS DUEÑOS DE SU ESTADO NO PÙDIERON MANTENERLA EN EL TRABAJO. FUE ASÍ QUE CON MUY POCO DINERO INVIRTIÓ EN LA COMPRA DE GOLOSINAS Y LOS IVA OFRECIENDO MIENTRAS CAMINABA POR DIFERENTES CALLES.
ACTUALMENTE APOYA EN UN RESTAURANTE QUE ESTA UBICADO EN EL MERCADO, LO CUAL LE GENERA OTRO INGRESO.
CON SU TRABAJO HA PODIDO DAR EDUCACIÓN A SU HIJA QUIEN ESTUDIA EN UN COLEGIO PARTICULAR, LE GUSTARÍA MAS ADELANTE ALQUILAR UN PUESTO PARA INICIAR UN RESTAURANTE QUE ES EL TRABAJO QUE LE AGRADA MAS.
EL PRESTAMO SOLICITADO,LO INVERTIRÁ EN LA COMPRA DE GOLOSINAS.
texts.en:
Alejandrina H. B. is 36 years old, is single and has a 10 year old daughter who is the reason for her effort and sacrifice. Alejandrina is part of the “RENOVACIÓN” group, formed by 11 other members dedicated to working in order to support their families. For 7 years Alejandrina has made her living selling sweets, for which she uses a little car located outside a call center on North Panamerican Ave. Before she became pregnant, she worked as a maid in a house. However, when the owners found out about her condition, they couldn't keep her in the job. And so with very little money, she invested in the purchase of sweets and sold them while walking up and down various streets. Currently she helps in a restaurant that is located in the market, which generates another income for her. With her work she has been able to give her daughter an education; she studies in a private school. She would like, in the future, to rent a stand to start a restaurant, which is the work that she likes best. The requested loan will be invested in the purchase of sweets.

Translated from Spanish by Marni Siegal, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Invest in the purchase of sweets

loans.name: La Hermandad Group

texts.es:
L. señora Hilaria D. L. C.  trabajo desD. muy niña , sabia que era L. única forma D. progresar y salir adelante. en su Huancayo querido donD. L.  gente se caracteriza por ser muy trabajadora y elL. lo demuestra por que  a lo largo D. su vida ha hecho D.  todo. vendió quesos, miel, papas. etc. También trabajo en  una fabrica D. caramelos, una heladería y una piñateria en realidad ha hecho D. todo un poco.
Hilaria  se caso  cuando solo tenía 15 años y nunca paro D. trabajar  cuando estaba laborando como empleada del hogar su sobrina le comento sobre EDAPROSPO es así que nuevamente se anima a trabajar por su cuenta con su primer préstamo compra ropa para llevar a vender a Huancayo y como le fue bien sus viajes aumentaron ahora su nuera le ayuda a vender lo que lleva D. lima peluches y ropa ,por otro lado también ayuda a su hermano que tiene una fabrica D. chompas, con sus ingresos y ganancias elL. pueD. cubrir su sustento y el D. su familia sobretodo D. sus 6 nietos a quienes ayuda.
 Su mayor anhelo es comprarse un terreno en lima y poner su propia tienda donD. pueda vender D. todo, eso seria algo seguro por que muchas veces el negocio baja y no tiene ventas, con su reciente préstamo comprara ropa y otros articulos para llevar a Huancayo a vender ya que por fiestas naviD.ñas habrá M. venta y esta segura que le ira muy bien.

*L. señora Hilaria aparece en medio D. su grupo muy sonriente.
texts.en:
Hilaria D. L. C. has worked since she was a little girl. She knew that was the only way to progress and get ahead. She worked in her beloved Huancayo, where the people are characterized as being very hard-working. She has demonstrated this for her entire life, and she has done everything. She sold cheese, honey, and potatoes, etc. She also worked in a candy factory, and ice cream parlor, and a piñata shop. In reality, she has done a little of everything. Hilaria got married when she was only 15, and she never stopped worked. When she was working as a household employee, her niece told her about Edaprospo. That is why she is once again motivated to work to support herself. With her first loan she bought clothes to take to sell in Huancayo. As this went well , her trips increased. Now her daughter-in-law helps her sell the stuffed animals and clothes she brings from Lima, . She also helps her brother, who has a sweater factory. With her income and earnings she is able to cover the cost of supporting her family and, above all, the six grandchildren that she helps. Her biggest desire is to buy a piece of land in Lima and place her own store there where she could sell everything. This would be something secure because many times her business is down and she does not have sales. With her recent loan she will buy clothes and other items to take to Huancayo to sell. With the Christmas festivities there will be a lot of sales, and she is sure that it will go very well. *Hilaria appears smiling in the middle of the group.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy clothes to sell

loans.name: Genesis 1, 2 & 3 Group

texts.en:
Lucrecia is the coordinator of her group, Genesis, and her story is representative of her group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican (many of whom recently emigrated to the Dominican Republic from Haiti) clients generally. Her group is located in Santiago, the Dominican Republic's second largest city, which is known for its production of cattle, tobacco and coffee, and where running water (none of which is potable) and electricity are unreliable. She makes her home here in a simple structure with her long-time partner and their three children.

Lucrecia is excited to be taking her third loan with Esperanza after having successfully repaid her previous loans. She plans to use this loan to invest in her business of vending traditional food made with yucca, beans, rice and chicken. She will use the profits to continue to grow her business and invest in her family. She thanks you all for your support.

loans.use: To purchase rice, beans, chicken and yucca to cook and sell

loans.name: David

texts.en:
David is 44 years old. He is married and has four children between the ages of 7 and 26 years. He has a tailoring business and has been in business for 12 years. He describes himself as focused in life.

He requested this loan of Kes. 20,000 from Faulu to add to his inventory of material. He says that his training from Faulu taught him how to keep business records. In the future, he hopes to expand his business and become a leading supplier.

loans.use: To buy materia for his tailoring business

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is 41 years old and married with five school-aged children. She rents out houses in the Kiambu area of Nairobi and also sells mtumba (second-hand) clothes in the market. She describes herself as ambitious and resilient. 

She is requesting this loan of Kes. 57,000 from Faulu to construct another house to rent. She has successfully repaid five previous loans and says that, through Faulu, she has learned business management and record-keeping and is now able to track her performance.

loans.use: To construct another house to rent

loans.name: Dominga Clementina

texts.es: La señora Dominga Pérez, mujer trabajadora, es costurera, vende ropa zapatos, cosméticos y  alquila un cuarto todo esto con el propósito de prosperar y poder cubrir sus necesidades, personales con su familia ya que todo esta caro. Cuando inicio lo hizo con ayuda de su esposo el cual se dedica a la venta de granos básicos, procreo tres hijos dos mayores casados y uno que estudia la universidad, con sus ingresos paga luz, agua, estudios a si como compra variedades para incrementar las ventas. Tiene 51 años de edad, vive en Villa Reconciliación en donde ha logrado tener buena clientela en la costura, con este préstamo comprara pantalones para mujer como hombre, ropa para niños, zapatos, tela, hilos, adornos entre otros para cumplir con los encargos como mejorar la variedad de ropa. Se siente contenta ya que a través de estos préstamos ha mejorado su casa, compro un   inodoro, ha incrementado las ventas de ropa y siente que apoya a su esposo e hijos. Es por eso espera seguir trabando con la institución ya que se beneficia con el financiamiento a largo plazo.
texts.en:
Señora Dominga Pérez, a hardworking woman, is a seamstress and sells clothing and cosmetics. She rents a room for all of this with the purpose of getting ahead and being able to cover her expenses and those of her family, since everything is very expensive. When she started she did so with the help of her husband, who sells basic grains. She has three children, two of whom are married and one who studies at the university. With her income she pays for the light, water, and educational expenses, as well as a variety of goods to increase her sales. She is 51 years old, and lives in the Villa Reconciliacion where she has managed to have a good clientele for her dressmaking business. With this loan she will buy pants for women and men, clothing for children, shoes, fabric, thread, trimmings and other items to fulfill her orders and increase her variety of clothing. She feels content since through these loans she has improved her house, bought a toilet, has increased her sales of clothing and feels that she is supporting her husband and children. For this reason she hopes to continue working with the institution, since she benefits from the longer-term financing.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy clothing, shoes, thread, fabric, thread and trimmings

loans.name: Justo

texts.es:
El señor Justo C. y la señora Antonia Zarate está muy agradecidos por su cooperación en el anterior crédito el cual pudieron arreglar el camión. Ya están trabajando en el la señora Antonia se pone a vender en un sitió diferente.
Están solicitando otro préstamo para poder comprar una camioneta y acondicionarlo para la venta de tacos y así darles  empleo a dos familiares, ya que en este momento no tiene trabajo y los quieren ayudar.
Planea pagar el crédito con las ganancias de una de las camionetas ya con las ganancias del la otro camioneta será para los gastos familiares y los que vayan necesitando sus dos hijos.
texts.en:
Mr. Justo C. and Mrs. Antonia Zarate are very grateful for their previous loan which allowed them to fix their truck. They are already working so that Antonia will be able to sell at a different site. They are asking for another loan so that can buy a van and equip it to sell tacos. This will give jobs to two relatives, who at this moment are unemployed and Justo and Antonia would like to help them. They plan to repay the loan with the profits from the van and their earnings from their truck will be used for family expenses and the needs of their two children.

Translated from Spanish by Erin Sindewald, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy a van to sell tacos

loans.name: Salome

texts.es: El señor Salome A. Mercado, es un hombre agricultor desde hace cuarenta años, se dedica a los cultivos de piña, café y cítricos, gracias al apoyo de su mamá que le brindo un terreno para que trabaje y apoye a su familia, la mayor dificultad que se le presenta es que los cultivo no se los pagan a un buen precio por la falta de tamaño en el caso de la piña, lo cual afecta su economía y lo poco que logra recoger apenas a justa para cancelar el desembolso , el quiere un financiamiento para la compra de fertilizantes e insumos para realizar la aplicación y lograr tener una buena producción y así mejorar las condiciones de vida ; a la vez poder comprar una camión en un futuro para poder trasladar la producción hacia el mercado. Don Salome tiene 52 años de edad, vive en ticuantepe lugar a la concepción donde se cultiva la piña. Con  cinco hijos todos independiente, su esposa es comerciante y le apoya con los gastos del hogar. Agradece ala institución por la oportunidad del financiamiento.
texts.en:
Mr. Salome A. Mercado has been a farmer for forty years and grows pineapple, coffee, and citrus fruits thanks to his mother's support. She provided him with land so that he could work and support his family.

The most difficult thing he faces is that oftentimes the pineapple that he grows doesn't get a good price because of its size, which affects his livelihood as the bit that he manages to collect is barely enough to meet his expenditures.

He would like a loan to buy fertilizers and materials so he can have good yields and improve his living conditions. At the same time, he would like to be able to buy a van to be able to move his products to the market.

Don Salome is 52-years-old and lives in Ticuantepe where he grows pineapple. He has five grown children and his wife is a trader who helps him with household expenses. He is grateful to AFODENIC (Kiva field partner) for the opportunity of the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Erin Sindewald, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy fertilizer to grow pineapple

loans.name: Benard

texts.en:
Benard is 29 years old and married with a five-year-old daughter named Mercy. He has a kinyozi (barbershop) in Kitengela, a town near Nairobi. He has been in business for eight years and has two employees. He offers shaves and sells some small-scale goods in the shop.

He successfully repaid a previous loan of 20,000 KES from Faulu and requested this loan for 30,000 KES to promote the business and expand his shop.

loans.use: Add stock to retail business

loans.name: Maria Isabel

texts.es:
la sra. Maria Isabel P. C. tiene 55 años de edad, se dedica a la venta de productos de consumo popular, en su pulperia vende varios tipos de productos, pero ahora no la tiene muy surtida, por tal razon es que esta solicitando el credito para poder comprar mas mercaderia al por mayor y asi tener mas surtida su pulperia.
nos comento que se siente muy feliz ya su negocio esta creciendo cada dia que pasa.
Maria esta casada y juntos con su esposo salen adelante los dos, comparten los gastos del hogar.
nos explico que ahora las ventas estan malas, pero con el cambio de gobierno en Honduras todo va a mejorar.
texts.en:
Mrs. Maria Isabel P. C. is 55 years old and she sells popular consumer products. In her small grocery store, she sells various types of products but now the store is poorly stocked. For this reason, she is requesting a loan in order to buy more wholesale merchandise in order to have a better selection in her store. She has told us that she feels very happy that now her business is growing each day. Maria is married and together with her husband they are pulling through, sharing the household expenses. She explained to us that now sales are bad but with the change in the Honduran government, everything is going to get better.

Translated from Spanish by Lauren Jackson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy butter, oil, beans, sugar, rice, coffee, bread,cookies, soft drinks, juices, corn flour, wheat flour, tortillas

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Luke

texts.en:
Luke is 30 years old and married with two children. He is a fish monger in Kitengela, a small town near Nairobi. He has been in this business for three years and was previously a mechanic. He describes himself as God-fearing and determined. 

He requested this loan of 20,000 KES from the Kiva field partner, Faulu Kenya, to buy twenty crates of fish. In the future, he hopes to be the best fish monger in the area. He says that since he joined Faulu he is no longer intimidated and that he can make it no matter what.

loans.use: Buy 20 crates of fish

loans.name: Regina

texts.en:
Regina is 40 years old and married with four children. She has a boutique where she sells clothes and shoes, and she's been in business for three years. She requested this loan of 20,000 KES to buy more stock. 

She describes herself as determined and hardworking and her hope is simply to have a stable family. She says that in Faulu (one of Kiva's field partners) she has learned to keep business records, and in the future she would like to be operating a well-established company.

loans.use: buy more inventory for boutique

loans.name: Doris

texts.es:
la sra. Doris P. tiene 57 años de edad, se dedica a la produccion y venta de rosquillas, quesadillas y tustacas, tiene mucho tiempo de dedicarse a este tipo de actividad, las rosquillas son un producto muy vendido en esta zona de honduras, la mayoria de las personas que visitan choluteca y sus alrededores compran rosquillas. 
este tipo de alimento es muy sabroso y se acompaña con cafe negro bien caliente y es muy exquisito su sabor.
la sra. Doris nos dio a probar una de sus rosquillas con cafe y la verdad son muy sabrosas.
su producto lo vende en mercaditos y ambulante en el centro y el mercado de la ciudad de choluteca.
ahora necesita el credito para comprar mas materia prima para la produccion de sus rosquillas.
esta vendiendo bastante y no le ajustan las que produce.
texts.en:
Mrs. Doris P. is 57 years old and produces and sells rosquillas (a doughnut shaped cracker), quesadillas (a cake made with cheese) y tustacas (a type of corn cake with sugar). Rosquillas are often sold in this part of Honduras, the majority of people who visit Choluteca and the surrounding areas buy them. This type of food is very delicious and it goes well with hot black coffee and its flavor is exquisite. Doris told us to try one of her rosquillas with some coffee and they truly were very delicious. She sells her product in little markets and by travelling to the center and to the market in the city of Choluteca. She now needs a loan to buy more raw materials for the production of her rosquillas. She is selling enough and is not adjusting what she is producing.

Translated from Spanish by Lauren Jackson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy wheat flour, cheese, butter, oil, salt

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Vivian

texts.en:
Vivian is 29 years old and married with two school-age children. She has a business selling second-hand clothes and has been in business for one year. She describes herself as hardworking and honest. 

She requested a loan of 15,000 KES from the Kiva field partner, Faulu, to purchase more clothing to sell. She says that through Faulu's training she has learned to plan, and in the future she hopes to have a stable business.

loans.use: Add stock of clothes

loans.name: Benedicta

texts.es:
Benedicta es una madre soltera de 56 años, tiene dos hijos, pero ellos viven en otra ciudad. 
Años atrás tenía una tienda de comestibles en su vivienda, a la cual se dedicaban sus hijos, pero al crecer éstos migraron, entonces tuvo que cerrar la tienda. Benedicta siempre se dedicó a la crianza de ganado, tiene aproximadamente 50 animales, a los cuales saca de su establo a las 10 de la mañana para que se alimenten, ella los lleva al campo hasta que el sol se oculte. 
Esta actividad, le es muy rentable, pues cada semana vende entre uno a tres carneros, por los que le pagan de 80 a 120 soles, dependiendo del tamaño. 
Asimismo, también siembra papa, arveja y maíz, en sus chacras temporales (regadas por la lluvia), por lo que cosecha cada temporada, es por ello que la venta de ganado es con la que solventa sus gastos diarios.

Este es su doceavo crédito con MFP y en todo este tiempo, (6 años),  ha sido muy puntual en  el pago de todas sus cuotas. El dinero que ahora solicita es para la compra de fertilizantes químicos, también hará desparasitar a sus animales.
texts.en:
Benedicta is a 56 year old single mother of two children, who live in another city. Years ago Benedicta ran a grocery store from her home where her children worked, but when they grew older they moved away and she had to close the store. Benedicta has always worked raising cattle and has approximately 50 animals, which she takes out from their shelter and feeds at 10 in the morning, after which she puts them out to pasture until the sun goes down. This activity is very profitable for her as every week she sells between one and three rams, for which she is paid between 80 and 120 soles, depending on the size. In addition, Benedicta sows potatoes, peas and corn on her small farms (watered by the rain), which she harvests every season, which is why she depends on the sale of her cattle to pay for the daily costs of living. This is Benedicta's twelfth loan with MFP. In all the years that she has been with them (six in total), she has been very punctual with the repayment of all her installments. The loan that she is currently applying for will be used to purchase chemical fertilizers and to delouse her animals.

Translated from Spanish by Suzanne Grasso, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To delouse her animals and purchase fertilizers

loans.name: Delia

texts.es:
Delia tiene 34 años, está separada y vive con sus 6 hijos en su casa propia.	Edad, estado civil, miembros de su familia.
Desde de que el padre de sus hijos se marchó, Delia doblegó esfuerzos para mantener a sus hijos, para ello trabaja como jornalera en las chacras desde las 8 de la mañana hasta 5 de la tarde, diariamente. Pero mayormente, ella prefiere tomar contratos completos de chacras de una cuadra donde trabaja varios días, de ese modo sus hijos pequeños la ayudan y para ella se le facilita el trabajo, ganando 260 por chacra para limpieza o para abrir surcos.
A su vez, acaba de sembrar café, pero ha notado que sus hojas no tienen buen aspecto, de abonarlas ahora para el próximo año estaría realizando sus primeras cosechas.

Este es su tercer crédito con MFP, en sus créditos anteriores ha sabido ahorrar diariamente para pagar, sin problemas, todas sus cuotas y se compromete a seguir haciéndolo así. Con el dinero que ahora solicita comprará fertilizantes químicos para abonar sus plantas de café.
texts.en:
Delia is 34 years old, separated and lives with her six children in her own house. Since the father of her children left, Delia has doubled her efforts to maintain her children, working as a labourer on small farms from 8 in the morning until 5 in the afternoon every day. But on the whole she prefers to take out complete contracts of one paddock farms where she can work over a number of days. By doing this her smaller children can help her and this makes her job easier. She can make 260 soles for every paddock she clears or makes furrows in. At the same time she has just sown coffee plants, but she has noted that the leaves do not look that healthy and she will have to fertilize them now so that they come into their first harvest next year. This is Delia's third loan with MFP. During her previous loans she has been able to save daily to repay all her installments without any problems and she promises to continue doing so. With the loan that she is currently applying for she will purchase chemical fertilizers to nourish her coffee plants.

Translated from Spanish by Suzanne Grasso, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers

loans.name: Edgar

texts.es:
Edgar tiene 43 años, está casado con la madre de sus 2 hijos, con los que vive en su casa propia.
Su sueldo de profesor no es suficiente para pagar las letras de su carro; por ello, después de trabajar en el colegio por la mañana, a las 6 de la tarde inicia su labor de taxista hasta las 12 de la noche. Trabajando de este modo viene pagando las letras de su carro, evitándose así las  preocupaciones.
La labor de taxista le llena de mucha complacencia, pues cuando termine de pagar su carro  podrá ahorrar para brindarles una buena educación a sus hijos, ya que por quienes trabaja arduamente.
A su vez para “sacarle provecho a su carro” como él dice, los fines de semana transporta cargas de plátanos u otro producto desde las chacras hasta el pueblo, así obtiene ganancias adicionales.

Este es su segundo préstamo con MFP y hasta el momento no ha tenido problemas en el pago de todas sus cuotas. El dinero que ahora solicita lo piensa invertir en la compra de una gata y otra llanta de repuesto para estar prevenido cuando realiza viajes lejanos.
texts.en:
Edgar is 43 years old, married to the mother of his two children and lives with them in their own house. Edgar's teacher's salary is not enough to pay for the installments owing on his car, which is why after he finishes working at the college in the morning, he then starts his job as a taxi driver from 6pm until midnight. Working in this way means he is able to make his repayments and avoid worry and hassle. His job as a taxi driver fills him with a lot of satisfaction, as when he finishes paying off his car he will be able to save to provide his children with a good education, for whom he works arduously. At the same time, to truly take advantage of his car, on weekends he transports orders of plantain and other products from the farms to the village, from which he gains an additional income. This is his second loan with MFP and up until now he has not had any problems with the repayment of his installments. The loan that he is currently applying for will be used to invest in a jack and a spare tyre so he will be prepared when he goes on long trips.

Translated from Spanish by Suzanne Grasso, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase a jack and a spare tyre for his car

loans.name: Iram

texts.es:
Iram es un joven soltero de 25 años, vive en la casa de su madre.
En vista de que tiene numerosos hermanos y sus padres no se abastecen con todos, él tuvo la iniciativa de sembrar sus propios cultivos de café, las cuales cosecharía en mayo de este año, pero no fue así, pues por falta de abono se atrasó la maduración. Por ello, Iram se siente muy inquieto, viendo la forma de cómo revertir esta situación, pues pese a que trabaja como jornalero en otras chacras, su sueldo de 15 soles diarios, no abastece para comprar sus ansiados fertilizantes.

Por tal motivo, recurre a este crédito para comprar los nitratos necesarios que puedan reanimar sus plantas y así logre cosechar este año.

Este es su tercer crédito con MFP, por lo que ratifica su compromiso de pagar puntualmente todas sus cuotas, pues desea seguir contando con posteriores préstamos para sus cultivos.
texts.en:
Iram is a single young man, 25 years old, and lives in his mother's house. In view of the fact that he has many brothers and sisters, and his parents are never free of caring for them all, he took it upon himself to plant his own coffee crop, which he will harvest in May of this year. But it didn't turn out that way, due to a lack of fertilizer the crop was late in maturing. For that reason, Iram feels very unsettled, seeing the situation and wanting to turn it around, and even though he is employed as day labourer at other small farms, his salary of 15 soles daily, it's not enough to buy his desired fertilizers. For this reason, he requests this loan to buy nitrates necessary to envigorate his plants and thereby harvest (coffee) this year. This is his third loan with MFP, and he has paid back each loan fully and on time. He wants to continue counting on the past loans for his crops.

Translated from Spanish by Jo Longnecker, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase fertilizer

loans.name: Josphine

texts.en:
Josphine is 37 years old and married with five children between the ages of nine and sixteen. She has a business selling fish in the Kawangware area of Nairobi. She sells Tilapia and has been in business for fifteen years. She describes herself as a very focused and determined woman.

She successfully completed a previous loan from the Kiva field partner, Faulu, for 20,000 KES and says since she joined Faulu she has been able to expand her business and is now also selling clothing. She requested this loan of 40,000 KES from Faulu to buy more fish to sell. In the future, she hopes to have a full clothing shop and become a wholesale fish supplier.

loans.use: Add stock of fish

loans.name: Marcos

texts.es:
Marcos tiene 54 años, está casado y es padre de 4 hijos que aún vive con él, en su casa propia.
Él muy amoroso con sus hijos y a la vez se siente muy orgulloso de su hija mayor que nació con el don de la pintura. Es por ello que trabaja arduamente en sus chacras sembrando papas, ollucos, arvejas, maíz y cebada con la compañía y ayuda de su esposa, pues su anhelo es que su hija estudie arte y pintura en un instituto superior ubicado a 5 horas de su pueblo en carro. 
A Marcos le gustan las labores agrícolas, pero sus dificultades son en los tiempos de “la helada” (clima muy frío que congela sus cultivos) donde muchas veces no puede salvar sus productos, y el otro problemas es la lluvia, si es muy constante los productos se agusanan.
Pese a todas esas dificultades, él no renuncia a su condición de agricultor, ya que lo realiza desde su infancia y sobre todo, vive de ello. 

Este es su doceavo crédito con MFP, él es coordinador de su grupo solidario, al que le tiene aprecio y gratitud. Con el dinero que ahora solicita comprará insecticidas contra los gusanos para sus cultivos de papa.
texts.en:
Marcos is 54 years old, married, and the father of 4 children. He lives in his own home.

Marcos is a loving parent who is very proud that his oldest daughter was born with a gift for painting. For this reason, he works hard in his fields planting potatoes, ulluco, peas, corn, and barley with the help of his wife. His hope is for his daughter to pursue art and painting at an institute located 5 hours from their hometown by car. He enjoys farming, but says he experiences difficulties when the area encounters frost (thereby freezing his crops) because he is not able to save his harvest. On other occasions, if there is too much rain, his crops will rot. Despite these difficulties, Marcos refuses to give up farming since he has done this since childhood and knows no other way of life.

This is his 12th loan with MFP. Marcos is the coordinator for his solidarity group, so he is admired with great appreciation and gratitude. He will use the money to buy pesticides to prevent worms from infecting his potatoes.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy pesticides

loans.name: Claudia Aleska

texts.es: Doña Aleska, tiene 25 años de edad, vive en casa propia y se encuetra casada con don Marco Antonio que pertenece a la institucion policial, con el señor tiene 1 hijo, la actividad principal de doña Aleska es la venta de productos de primera necesidad(arroz, harina, Aceite, fideo, etc.) al crédito. Su forma de trabajar es con clientes conocidos y por referencias; la cobranza que realiza es diaria. El crédito solicitado es para la compra de harina por mayor, el mismo que lo distribuira entre sus clientes por la temporada de fin de año.
texts.en:
Aleska is 25 years old and lives in her own house. She is married to Marco Antonio, who belongs to the police institution. They have one child. Aleska sells basic needs items (rice, flour, oil, and noodles, etc.) on credit. Her work method is to work with customers she knows and by references. She makes daily collections. The loan she is asking for is to buy wholesale flour. She will distribute it among her customers for the end of the year season.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy flour by the "quintal" (100 pounds)

loans.name: Sujayla Del Rosario

texts.es: La señora Sujayla del Rosario  tiene 39 años de edad, posee 3 hijos, uno mayor de edad y los otros dos son menores que están a su cargo. La señora tiene una la elaboración de repostería ubicada en su casa de habitación. Ella dio inicio a este negocio hace 7 años. Porque su mama quería ingresos adicionales que reemplazaran la escasez de trabajo. Al poco tiempo, empezó a vender bocadillos y otros productos así fue como incremento su clientela diario produce encargos que son vendidos. Su crédito será invertido en la compra principalmente de harina, colorantes, mantequilla, aceite, huevo y queso. Su sueño es llegar a instalarse en el mercado para vender sus productos.
texts.en:
Sra. Sujayla del Rosario is 39 years old. Of her three children, one is already independent while the two younger ones are still under her care. Sujayla operates a pastry shop out of her home. She started this business seven years ago so that she could provide her mother with extra income to make up for a shortage of work. Over time, she began selling sandwiches and other products so that she could generate more customer orders on a daily basis. This loan will be used to buy flour, food coloring, butter, oil, eggs, and cheese. Her dream is have a place in the market to sell her products.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase ingredients

loans.name: Martha

texts.es:
Martha tiene 35 años, está casada con el padre de su tres hijos, con quienes vive en su casa propia.
Su trabajo es de comisionista en el puente, la principal vía por donde circulan todos los carros urbanos en su localidad. Ella ingresa inter diariamente a su trabajo a las 7 de la mañana hasta 7 de la noche, con su chaleco de transito y su silbato en mano, siempre está al  pendiente de levantar la palanca para dar el paso de ingreso y salida de los vehículos cobrando el peaje. 
Por otro lado, los días que no trabaja allí, los dedica a sus cultivos de café y plátanos en compañía de su esposo. Dedicarse en sus cultivos le gusta mucho y el sueldo de su trabajo lo invierte en el incremento de sus cultivos.

Este es su primer crédito con MFP, por lo que se compromete ante todos los integrantes de su grupo a pagar de forma puntual, ya que no quiere defraudar la confianza brindada. Con el dinero que solicita invertirá en la compra de plantas de café y abono para sus cultivos.
texts.en:
Martha is 35 years old, married, and the mother of three children. She and her family live in their own home.

Martha works as a toll collector at a bridge on one of the main roads where cars from the city travel through her area. She works every day from 7am to 7pm, traffic vest and whistle in hand. As she is collecting tolls, Martha also controls the lift gate that regulates the entry and exit of vehicles. On the days she is not working, she helps her husband tend to their coffee and banana crops. They both enjoy farming and they invest Martha’s salary so they can increase their output.

This is her first loan with MFP. Martha has committed to the other group members that she will make her payments on time so as not to betray their trust. She will use the money to buy coffee plants and fertilizers.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase coffee plants & fertilizers

loans.name: Olga

texts.es:
Olga tiene 44 años, vive con su pareja y padre de sus 7 hijos, en su casa propia.
Años atrás de dedicaba a la venta de comestibles en su vivienda, pero lo fue bien, pues sus hijos pequeños se comías la mercadería a escondidas.
Ahora, ha puesto todas sus energías en sus cultivos de café y plátanos, donde trabaja  juntamente con su esposo. Poco a poco vienen incrementando su producción y cada cierto tiempo envían una carga a su hija que vive en otra ciudad.
Sin embargo, Olga tiene nostalgia por su bodega, es por ello que planea retomar ese negocio para cuando sus hijos crezcan, pero por el momento seguirá trabajando con mucho esmero y ahínco en sus cultivos, ya que mediante estas ganancias viene educando a sus hijos.

Este es su tercer crédito con MFP, demostrando ser una cliente muy puntual en sus pagos y en las reuniones de su banco comunal, pues estima mucho a su grupo y está agradecida por los créditos adquiridos. Con el dinero que ahora solicita comprará fertilizantes químicos para el abonado de sus cultivos de café y plátanos.
texts.en:
Olga is 44 years old. She and her partner have 7 children and they live in their own home.

Years ago, Olga operated a grocery store out of her home and did very well. Sometimes her small children would eat some of the merchandise without her knowing it. Now she puts all of her energy into helping her husband grow coffee and bananas. Their production has been gradually increasing and they hope to eventually send a shipment to their daughter who lives in another city. Olga gets nostalgic about her grocery store, and she hopes to reopen her business when the rest of her children are grown. For now she continues to work on her crops with great effort and dedication so that she can pay for her children’s education.

This is her third loan with MFP. Olga has demonstrated that she is a reliable client who can make her payments on time. At her Communal Bank meetings, she is well respected by the other members and expresses her gratitude for the loans she has received. The money she requested will be used to buy chemical fertilizers for her coffee and banana crops.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase fertilizers

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es:
Rosa tiene 50 años, está casada con el padre D. sus 8 hijos; D. los cuales, 3 D. ellos viven en su casa.
DesD. su juventud se ha dedicado a los trabajos agrícolas en sus chacras, con la tutela D. su esposo, macheteando y podando las plantas D. café, pues ellos prefieren sembrar este grano, por ser muy rentable, ya que gracias al café a sus hijos no les faltó nada. 
Pero, últimamente ella tiene dolencias en los pies y no pueD. trabajar con la misma facilidad como lo hacía años atrás. 
Debido a ello, hace un mes, implementó una tienda D. comestibles D. primera necesidad, en su misma vivienda, donD. está aprendiendo a sacar las cuentas con la ayuda D. una calculadora para no equivocarse.
Pero a pesar D. estar al pendiente D. su tienda, Rosa no se descuida D. preparar y llevar el almuerzo D. su esposo a la chacra, pues ayudándolo D. ese modo se siente más útil y tranquila.

Anteriormente, el titular D. sus préstamos era su esposo, pero para este crédito hicieron el cambio, entonces ahora es Rosa quien se compromete a pagar puntualmente todas las cuotas. El dinero que solicita es para la compra D. fertilizantes químicos y mercadería para su tienda.
texts.en:
Rosa, 50, is married to the father of her 8 children, three of whom still live at home with them. From her youth she has farmed her farmlands and, with her husband's guidance, has wielded a machete to trim and prune the coffee plants, which is their preferred crop because of it's profitability. It has been thanks to coffee that their children never lacked anything. But, lately, she has suffered from feet ailments that keep her from being able to work with the same ease as in years past. Because of this, about a month ago, she set up a small grocery store in her home where she is learning to add and subtract using a calculator so as not to make mistakes. But, despite watching over her store, Rosa does not neglect preparing her husband's lunch and taking it to him in the fields because she feels more useful and calm when she is able to help him this way. Previously, the loan recipient was her husband, but for this loan, they maD. the change and it is now Rosa who is committing to repay it in a timely fashion. The funds requested will be used to buy chemical fertilizers and merchandise for her store.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fertilizers.

loans.name: Digna Adilia

texts.es:
la joven Digna H. tiene 35 años de edad, se dedica a la venta de abarroteria, su negocio lo tiene ubicado en su casa de habitación.
Digna es una persona cristiana y tiene un par de años de haber iniciado con su negocio, nos comento que inicio su pulpería con un capital muy bajo y ahora su negocio ha crecido en gran manera. En estos momentos no esta muy surtido su negocio por eso es que necesita el credito para poder comprar mas mercaderia y asi tener bien surtida su pulperia.
Es casada y tiene hijos los cuales dependen del matrimonio, su esposo se dedica a la agricultura.
juntos salen adelante y contribuyen con los gastos del hogar.
texts.en:
Digna H. is 35 years old and sells groceries out of her home. She is a Christian woman who started this business two years ago with very little capital. Now it has grown tremendously. At the moment, her business is low on inventory so she is requesting this loan to buy more merchandise and keep her store well-stocked. Digna is married and has dependent children. Her husband is a famer and they work together to move forward and help one another with the household expenses.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase merchandise for her store

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Shelah

texts.es:
Shelah tiene 29 años, está casada y tiene 2 hijos.
Su trabajo diario es de comisionista de la municipalidad en su provincia. Todos los días se levanta muy temprano por la mañana para cumplir con sus labores domesticas, posteriormente recorre cada puesto ambulante de los mercados de su localidad cobrando los impuestos municipales.
Adicionalmente, tiene un motocarro con el que brinda el servicio de transporte de pasajeros, su esposo es quien maneja el vehículo  y ella administra los ingresos y egresos.
De esta manera, con su remuneración y las ganancias de su motocarro logran cubrir los estudios de sus hijos, con el anhelo de que tengan una buena educación. 

Este es su 2do crédito con MFP, siendo una persona muy responsable en sus pagos, aunque no algunas veces no puede asistir a las reuniones de su banco comunal. El dinero que ahora solicita le servirá para la compra de tres llantas para el motocarro que conduce su esposo.
texts.en:
Shelah is 29 years old, married, and has two children. She works as a city tax collector in her province. Every day she wakes up early to complete her household chores and then travels to the local markets to collect city taxes from each of the street vendors.

In addition, she owns a motorcycle taxi that her husband uses to provide passenger services. He drives the vehicle, while she manages the related revenues and expenditures. Shelah and her husband want to provide their children with a good education. Fortunately, the combination of her salary and her husband’s profits from the motorcycle taxi are enough to cover their children’s schooling.

This is her second loan with MFP. Shelah has been very responsible with her payments, although sometimes she has not been able to attend the Communal Bank meetings. The money she requested will be used to purchase three tires for her husband’s motorcycle taxi.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase tires for her husband's motorcycle taxi

loans.name: Valentina

texts.es:
Valentina tiene 53 años, es madre soltera de un hijo y vive en su casa propia.
Ella es una mujer muy trabajadora, ya que no sólo se conforma con sembrar papas y arvejas, sino que también, dos veces por semana, viaja a la ciudad de Lima llevando hortalizas como: lechugas, espinacas y zanahorias para venderlas allá.
Pero lo que más le gusta es dedicarse a sus cultivos y aunque muchas veces, debido al clima helado perdió sus cosechas.
A raíz de eso, aprendió a viajar para vender sus productos, los cuales transporta hasta la carretera con su dócil asno llamado “Panchito”, su fiel compañero por muchos años, y una vez allí lleva su carga en algún carro hacia la ciudad, de esta manera logra cubrir los estudios superiores de su único hijo.

Este es su segundo crédito con MFP, donde se viene comprometiendo a pagar puntualmente todas sus cuotas. Con el dinero que esta vez solicita comprará fungicidas para sus plantas de arveja y también para incrementar su mercadería en verduras.
texts.en:
Valentina is 53 years old and lives in her own home. She is a single mother with one child, a son.

Valentina is a hardworking woman. In addition to planting potatoes and peas, she travels to Lima twice a week carrying with her vegetables to sell such as lettuce, spinach, and carrots. She enjoys devoting herself to farming, although sometimes she has lost her harvest because of freezing weather. Valentina discovered that she could sell vegetables in other places. Her obedient donkey named “Panchito” has been a faithful companion for many years. He pulls the carriage bearing her load of vegetables to sell. Her revenues go toward paying for her only son’s higher education.

This is her second loan with MFP. Valentina is committed to making her payments on time. She will use the money to buy fungicides for her crop of peas and also increase her inventory of vegetables.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase fungicides & vegetables to sell

loans.name: Alicia

texts.es: La  Señora Alicia se dedica a la venta de pescado al por mayor (en latas),ella se provee de sus parientes que viven en Tiquina(poblacion cercana al lago Titicaca) y se dedican a la pesca. La rutina de la señora Alicia comienza los dias lunes que viaja a las 4 de la mañana hasta tiquina para comprar el pescado que pueda, a un precio mas bajo por ser pariente de los proveedores, para volver en la tarde y dejar la mayor parte de la mercaderia en la ciudad de El Alto a sus clientes que se encargan de vender la misma por unidad. durante la semana, de martes a jueves, se levanta a las 5 de la mañana para llegar a la ciudad de el Alto a las 7 30 y cobrar por la mercancia, en las tardes se dedica a cuidar a sus 2 pequeños que aun no van al colegio y tambien ayuda a su esposo que trabaja como albañil, trabaja cerca a su domicilio ya que en la zona en que viven esta comenzando a poblarse y la oferta de trabajo nunca falta
texts.en:
Alicia sells fish wholesale (in cans). Her relatives, fishermen who live in Tiquina (a community near the Titicaca Lake), supply her. Alicia’s routine starts on Monday when she travels to Tiquina at four in the morning to buy the fish that she can at a lower price because her relatives are the providers. She returns in the afternoon and leaves a major part of the merchandise with her customers in the city of El Alto. They sell the fish by the unit. During the week from Tuesday to Thursday, she gets up a five in the morning to arrive in the city of El Alto at 7:30 to collect for her merchandise. In the afternoons she takes care of her two little ones, who still do not go to school. She also helps her husband, who works as a bricklayer. He works close to home. The area where they live is getting more populated, and he is never without work.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy more merchandise

loans.name: Glanda Nuvia

texts.es:
la joven GLENDA NUVIA H. OBREGON tiene una tienda en la cual vende abarroteria, misma que opera bajo el nombre de Púlperia "LOS 4 HERMANOS" negocio que tiene ubicado en su casa de habitación.
Doña Glenda, es una persona de principios Cristianos,  tiene 5 1/2 años de haber iniciado con su negocio, con el tiempo que tiene de administralo le ha ido muy bién, nos comento que inicio su pulpería con un capital de Lps. 500.00 y ahora su negocio ha crecido en gran manera y luce de buen surtido.- la Sra. H. se ha sabido ganar la clientela por la atención que les brinda y por los precios que ofrece.
Doña Glenda, es casada y madre de 4 hijos los cuales dependen del matrimonio, su esposo se dedica a la agricultura, siembra de Maíz y Frijoles.
texts.en:
Glenda Nuvia H. Obregon has a grocery store that she operates out of her home. Her business is named “Los 4 Hermanos” (The 4 Brothers).

Doña Glenda is a woman of Christian principles. She started her business 5½ years ago and has managed to do very well. With starting capital of Lps. 500.00, she says her business has grown tremendously and is well-stocked. She has managed to gain customers by providing them good service and offering the best prices. Doña Glenda is married and has 4 dependent children. Her husband is a farmer who grows corn and beans.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase merchandise for her store

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Remberto Simeon

texts.es: "Don Remberto tiene 37 años y se encuentra casado con doña Columba, con la que tiene 3 hijos, ahora ya, jovenes; viven en casa de sus suegros, su esposa se dedica a la venta de café en la puerta de su domicilio, el trabaja de chofer propietario. El crédito solicitado es para el mantenimiento de su movilidad, pues necesita comprar llantas y hacer pequeños arreglos.
texts.en:
Don Remberto is 37 years old and is married to Doña Columba. They have three children who are now teenagers. They live in the house of his in-laws. His wife sells coffee on the doorstep of their home.

Don Remberto works as an independent driver. He is requesting a loan to maintain his vehicle. Specifically, he will purchase tires and pay for minor repairs.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase tires & pay for minor repairs

loans.name: Gonzalina

texts.es: la sra. Gonzalina R. S. tiene 38 años de edad, se dedica a la venta de productos de consumo popular, actividad a la que se dedica desde hace 2 años, con los ingresos que le genera el negocio cubre con sus gastos personales y tambien con parte de los gastos del hogar contribuyendole a su esposo. ella comento que la necesidad del credito es para surtir mas y asi mejorar las ventas en su negocio. este negocio les esta mejorado las condiciones de vida. con el credito va a surtir mas su negocio y asi mejorar sus ventas lo que le permitira mejores ganancias.
texts.en:
Sra. Gonzalina R. S. is 38 years old. For two years, she has been selling popular consumer products. The revenue she generates is used to cover her personal expenses and part of the household expenses. Her husband’s income is used for the remaining expenses. Gonzalina says she needs a loan for additional inventory so that she can increase her sales. This business provides a way for her to improve her living conditions.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase merchandise for her store

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Francisco Javier

texts.es: El señor Francisco Javier Zúñiga C. tiene la edad de 45 años habita en la comunidad el Edén ubicado en el municipio de Ticuantepe, junto a su esposa la cual le ayuda con las cosas del hogar y en los cultivos, ellos tienen a su cargo tres hijos dos jóvenes que estudian su secundaria y un  pequeñito de cuatros años, los planes hacia su familia es mejorar las condiciones de vida ya que su casa esta construida de madera y quiere que en un futuro se le apoye para construir su vivienda , el desde hace 30 años se dedica a la agricultura la mayor dificultad que se le ha presentado es la falta de financiamiento ya que sus cultivos carecen de fertilizantes e insumos , el inicio con sus propios esfuerzos para poder mantener su a su familia , el quiere financiamiento para la compra de insumos el cual aplicara al cultivo
texts.en:
Mr. Francisco Javier Zúñiga C. is 45 years old and lives in el Edén, located in the municipality of Ticuantepe. Together with his wife who helps with the household and farming duties, they have 3 children. Two of the children are in secondary school and the other child is 4 years old. The family’s plan is to improve their quality of life, their house has been built of wood and in the future, the family would like to build a home. He has worked in agriculture for 30 years. The biggest difficulty has been the lack of financing since his crops lack fertilizer and supplies. He started with his own efforts in order to take care of his family, he wants financing to buy supplies that he will apply to his crops.

Translated from Spanish by Lauren Jackson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and pesticides to improve production

loans.name: Marlen Argelia

texts.es:
la joven Marlen Argelia R. tiene 24 años de edad, a su corta edad ya tiene su negocio propio, este negocio lo tiene en su casa de habitacion, las ventas le han incrementado y esta vendiendo su producto rapido, se esta quedando sin producto a media semana y necesita invertir en mas mercaderia ya que los camiones repartidores de productos solo pasan una vez por semana.
necesita el credito para abastecerse mas de mercaderia.
su pulperia es de mucha satisfaccion para el bienestar de su vida ya que este negocio le esta dejando ganancias y asi ella esta mejorando mucho mas su condición de vida.
nos comento que su sueño es tener una tienda grande en la cual tenga muchos productos y que las personas que la visiten siempre compren algo.
Marlen tiene todo el espiritu de salir adelante
texts.en:
Marlen Argelia R. is a young woman of age 24. At this young age, she already has her own business located at her house. Her sales have increased and she is selling her product quickly. She has been running out of product by midweek and needs to invest in more merchandise since the product delivery trucks only stop by once a week. She needs this loan to stock up on more merchandise. Her store is increasing her well-being since it is leaving her with profit and in this way she is improving her living conditions. She commented that her dream is to have a big store where she has many products and where the people who visit always buy something. Marlen has all the will to succeed.

Translated from Spanish by Sarah Shimmin, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase eggs, beans, tortillas, cheese, soft drinks, ham, mortadella, quesillo, pork rinds, soups, pasta, soap, toilet paper, sweets

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Norma Isabel

texts.es: Norma Isabel de 29 años de edad es madre soltera de 2 niños de 7 y 12 años respectivamente los cuales estudian la primaria, trabaja para el MINED de Santo Tomas en una escuelita ubicada en la zona rural en la Comarca El Guabo, sale los domingos y regresa los viernes por la tarde con sus hijos, cuenta con el apoyo de su mamá quien le cuida a sus hijas mientras trabaja, ademas esta estudiando el 4to año de la universidad los sabados, pues desea superarse profesionalmente para obtener mejores ingresos que le permita ofrecerle a sus hijos mejores condiciones de vida.  Esta solicitando su 2do credito para seguir mejorando su casa construyendo un cuarto anexo para sus hijas, pues estan creciendo rapido y necesita brindarles privacidad y espera seguir siendo beneficiada con Kiva.
texts.en:
Norma Isabel is 29 years old and the single mother of 2 children, ages 7 and 12, who attend primary school. She works for the MINED of Santo Tomas, in a little school located in a rural area in the El Guabo region. She leaves Sunday and returns Friday afternoon. She is raising her children with help from her mother who takes care of them while she is working. She is also in her fourth year in university, taking classes on Saturdays. She wants to improve herself professionally, in order to obtain a better income, so she can offer her children a better quality of life. She is requesting her second loan to continue improving her house by building a room for her children, since they are growing quickly and she needs to offer them privacy. She hopes to continue to benefit from Kiva.

Translated from Spanish by Lauren Jackson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: construction of a room

loans.name: Rafael Humberto

texts.es: Rafael Humberto S. Martínez, tiene 33 años de edad, y cuenta con una familia integrada por Karen, Raquel y Kevin de 10, 11 y 16 años de edad respectivamente, actualmente ellos se encuentran estudiando, mientras su esposa, la señora Arely es empleada y aporta económicamente al sostenimiento de su familia.- Rafael se mantiene muy ocupado entre el cuido de sus hijos en el hogar y la fabricación de pan francés en su misma casa, mismo que comercializa con vecinos de la zona y en un parque muy populoso del lugar, en donde todas las tardes lo esperan para comprarle.- Ahora Rafael está solicitando un nuevo crédito para poder comprar mas materia prima para pan y poder cubrir la demanda navideña que se acerca.-
texts.en:
Rafael Humberto S. Martínez is 33 years old and has a family with three children, Karen, Raquel and Kevin of ages 10, 11 and 16 respectively. The children go to school while his wife, Mrs. Arely, is employed and contributes economically to support their family. Rafael stays very busy taking care of the children at home and baking bread in his own house. He sells the bread to his neighbors and at a busy park in the area, where his customers wait every afternoon to buy his bread. Rafael is soliciting a new loan to buy more raw materials to bake bread and be ready to supply the upcoming demand for Christmas.

Translated from Spanish by Carlos Morales, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital to buy raw material

location.town: Santa Tecla, departamento de La Libertad

loans.name: Aneyda Del Rosario

texts.es: Aneyda es casada, trabaja como  docente en la Escuela Diriangen  desde hace 5 años,  su esposo trabaja como como agricultor y asume los gastos del hogar, está solicitando su primer crédito a AFODENIC para invertirlo en mejora de su vivienda (terminar de construir una habitación),  aunque no tienen hijos ellos son muy responsables con sus padres, pues siempre están pendientes de lo que necesitan, Aneyda se caracteriza por ser honesta y muy trabajadora, actualmente está estudiando segundo año en la universidad URACCAN, ella vive en un barrio el cual se está iniciando a poblar, su sueño terminar de construir una habitación para tener mejor comodidad y así gozar de mejores condiciones,  tener estabilidad laboral para cuando lleguen los hijos.
texts.en:
Aneyda is married and has been working as a teacher at Escuela Diriangen for 5 years; her husband is a farmer and is responsible for the household expenses. She is soliciting her first loan from AFODENIC to invest in home improvements (she wants to finish a bedroom). Even though they don’t have any children, they are both very responsible with their own parents since they’re always attentive to their needs. Aneyda is characterized by her honesty and hard work; she is currently studying her second year at Universidad URACCAN. She lives in a neighborhood that is beginning to be developed; her dream is to finish building a bedroom to have more comfort and enjoy better living conditions, and to have stable work when the children arrive.

Translated from Spanish by Carlos Morales, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To build a bedroom

loans.name: Zoila Esperanza

texts.es: Zoila Esperanza P. D. G., D. 62 años, vive junto a su esposo el señor Miguel Mauricio G., él es empleado y tiene a cargo el sostenimiento del hogar. Zoila es una señora muy dinámica y emprendedora y ha querido ayudar a su esposo instalando una tienda en su lugar D. residencia. Le va muy bien, pero sus clientes están demandando productos que aún no posee, por lo que se encuentra solicitando un crédito para suplir la necesidad D. los clientes, soñando D. esa manera con hacer crecer su pequeño negocio.-
texts.en:
Sixty-two year old Zoila Esperanza P. D. G. lives with her husband Miguel Mauricio G.. He is employed and in charge of supporting the household. Zoila is a very dynamic and enterprising woman and has helped out her husband by installing a store within their place of residence. It is going very well, but, their customers are demanding products that the store still does not carry. She is requesting a loan in order to fulfill her customers’ needs. In this way, she hopes to grow her small business.

Translated from Spanish by Emma Felten, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: working capital to augment the merchandise for sale

location.town: Santa Tecla, departamento de La Libertad

loans.name: Marta Lilian

texts.es: Marta Lilian G. D. González, tiene 53 años D. edad y es una señora que todas las mañanas sale a comprar productos frescos al mercado y así poder ofrecerle a sus clientes en su chalet, deliciosos antojitos como pupusas, yuca, pasteles fritos, entre otra comida típica, esto lo hace en local instalado en su misma casa, vendiendo con vecinos del lugar y personas que transitan. Vive con su esposo D. 56 años D. edad, que trabaja como mecánico y un hijo D. 27 años que se encuentra aprendiendo el oficio con su padre. Marta Lilian está solicitando crédito para poder comprar mas materia prima para pupusas y suplir la demanda D. sus clientes que cada día son mas por lo sabroso D. sus productos.-
texts.en:
Marta Lilian G. D. González is 53 years old. Every morning she buys products fresh from the markets so she can make delicious snacks such as maize dumplings, cassava, fried pastries and other local dishes. She does this from a location right in her home, selling to neighbors and people passing by. She lives with her 56 year old husband who works as a mechanic, and her 27 year old son, who is learning his father’s traD.. Marta Lilian is requesting a loan in order to buy more ingredients for maize dumplings. In this way she can supply the demands of her customers whose numbers are increasing daily due to the tastiness of her products.

Translated from Spanish by Emma Felten, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy ingredients in order to make local dishes

loans.name: Ruth Belina

texts.es: La señora Ruth L. vende comida y fritanga desde hace seis año, negocio que inicio con la necesidad  de apoyar a sus tres hijos ya que como muchas madre soltera. Vive en el barrio Laureles Norte, tiene 46 años de edad, su deseo es poder dar el apoyo a sus hijos para que estudien y puedan trabajar en mejores condiciones. Donde pone su venta no tiene techo y desea compra zinc y perlines para poder dar un mejor servicio como mejor presentación a sus clientes. Ya que en tiempo de invierno sus ventas son bajas por que se moja y su comida no la saca a fuera lo cual es muy preocupante para ella ya que tiene que pagar los gastos básicos de agua, luz, la alimentación. Es  por eso pondrá un techo de zinc para poder vender en todo tiempo y poder sastifacer las necesidades personales como poder cumplir con el pago mensual del financiamiento.
texts.en:
Sra. Ruth has been selling prepared meals and fried snacks for six years. She started this business because she needed to support her three children as a single mother. Ruth is 46 years old and lives in the neighborhood of Laurles Norte. Two of her wishes are to provide for her children’s education and have better working conditions. Currently the area of her home where she sells her products does not have a roof. She wants to buy sheets of zinc and metal crossbeams so that her business is more presentable to her customers, and thereby allows her to provide better service.

Sales are lower during the winter because of the rainy season. Ruth has no other place to conduct business and she is worried because she still has to pay her water, electricity, and food bills. Installing a roof will enable her to continue selling food throughout the year so that she can generate income to cover both her personal necessities and her monthly loan payments.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase materials to install a roof over her business

loans.name: Aristides Antonio

texts.es: Aristides Antonio es casado, tiene 2 hijos, el mayor de  14 años de edad y el niño menor de siete añitos de edad,está solicitando  su 6to  refinanciamiento  para invertirlo en mejora de su vivienda (Construcción de una habitación), trabaja como Guarda de Seguridad en el INTA de Nueva Guinea desde hace 10 años, este cliente se ha destacado por ser responsable, honesto, trabajador, su esposa es comerciante en su pulperia bien surtida la cual la ayuda con los gastos familiares ya que son una familia pobre pero unida, viven en un barrio donde cada día se va aumentando la población, su sueño es ir mejorando la vivienda con cada crédito que estos van adquiriendo con AFODENIC,  tener estabilidad laboral, salud y que su hijos sigan estudiando para que lleguen hacer alguien en la vida.
texts.en:
Aristides Antonio is married with two children. The older child is 14 years old and the younger one is 7 years old. He is requesting his sixth loan to invest in home improvements (specifically the construction of a room). Aristides has worked for INTA (Nicaraguan Institute for Agricultural Technology) in Nueva Guinea as a security guard for the past 10 years. He has demonstrated that he is a responsible, honest, and hardworking client. His wife is a merchant who manages her own grocery store, which is well-stocked and enables her to contribute to the family expenses. Despite being poor, they are a close family. They live in a neighborhood that growing in population each day. His dream is to continue improving his house and each loan that he obtains from AFODENIC enables him to do so. Aristides also hopes to have stable employment, good health, and that his children continue their studies so that they can accomplish something in life.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Build a room

loans.name: Marta Elena

texts.es: Marta Elena P. Hernández, de 46 años. Junto a ella vive su compañero de vida, quien también es comerciante y una hija de 13 años de edad que se encuentra estudiando. Marta Elena, cuenta con un puesto en un mercado municipal cercano a su residencia, en éste distribuye todo estilo de zapato y sandalia para dama, de cuero e imitación de cuero. Ella cuenta con varios años de dedicarse a está actividad y necesita adquirir nuevos estilos ya que se acercan las graduaciones y época navideña en la que es muy demanda por sus clientes y no quiere quedarles mal, es por ello que se encuentra solicitando crédito para comprar mas producto.-
texts.en:
Marta Elena P. Hernández is 46 years old. She lives with her life partner, who is a merchant, and her 13 year old daughter who is a student. She has a vending post at the municipal market near her home where she offers all types of women’s shoes and sandals, both in genuine and artificial leather. Marta has been in business for several years, but she needs to acquire new styles because graduations and the Christmas season are approaching. Demand from her customers is much higher during this time and she does not want to disappoint them. For this reason, she is requesting a loan to buy more merchandise.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Acquire more merchandise for the Christmas season

loans.name: Meyling Raquel

texts.es: La señora Meyling M., madres de tres hijos, vende ropa, cosméticos y zapatos, lleva varios años en las ventas, lo cual le fue difícil por que cuando inicio le costo hacer clientela y mucha gente no le pago, poder estabilizarse fue algo bueno para ella esto lo logro con el financiamiento que Afodenic otorgo. También invirtió en la compra de joyas de plata ya que es la que se vende mucho. Su esposo es técnico aduanero y el también la apoyado para dar a sus hijos lo mejor en educación. Tiene 32 años de edad, vive en Villa Libertad, su plan es comprar ropa para dama, caballero, niños y muchas prendas de plata para poder cumplir con los encargos a si como vender lo cual espera que las ventas sean buenas en esta temporada. Sus planes es a corto plazo es poder tener una boutique y poder surtirla.
texts.en:
Mrs. Meyling M., a mother of three, has been selling clothes, cosmetics, and shoes for several years. At the beginning it was difficult for her to create a clientele and many did not pay her. In order to stabilize she succeeded with a loan from Afodenic. She also invested in buying silver jewelry as it sells well. Her husband is a customs officer and he is very supportive in order to give his children a better education. She is 32 years old, she lives in Villa Libertad. It is her plan to buy clothes for ladies, gentlemen, and children as well as many pieces of silver jewelry to meet her orders. She hopes sales will be good this season. Her short term plans are to have a boutique and stock up.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck Christensen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase a variety of clothes and silver jewelry

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase undergarments & toys for the holiday season

loans.name: Delfina Del Carmen

texts.es: Doña Delfina es soltera, vive en la zona # 2 de Nueva Guinea, tiene cuatro hijos dos mayores de edad y unos gemelos que actualmente estan cursando cuarto año de educación secundaria,  trabaja para el MINED Nueva Guinea como docente de primaria en la colonia el Serrano desde hace 4 años a 28 km de la ciudad,está solicitando su 9no crédito para invertirlo en mejora de su vivienda (construcción de una habitación), todos los dias Delfina tiene que levantarse a las cuatro de la mañana para dejar hecho los quehaceres del hogar y abordar el camión a las 6 de la mañana a impartir el pan de la enseñanza a niños campesinos de esa colonia, el padre de sus hijos a pesar que no vive con ellos es muy responsable el cual ayuda con los gastos familiares a sus hijos, su sueño que sus hijos estudien, trabajo, salud y poco a poco ir mejorando su vivienda para tener mejor comodidad.
texts.en:
Doña Delfina is a single mother of four children who lives in District #2 of New Guinea. Her two older children are twins who are currently in their fourth year of high school.

Delfina works for MINED (the Ministry of Education) as an elementary school teacher in the Serrano neighborhood. She has been teaching for four years and her school is located 28km away from the city. At the moment, she is requesting her ninth loan to invest in home improvements (specifically the construction of a room). Every day, Delfina wakes up at 4am to complete her household chores before catching a passenger truck at 6am to leave for her teaching job. Even though he does not live with them, the father of her children is very responsible and contributes toward their expenses. Delfina hopes that her children continue to study, find work, and remain healthy. She also wants to improve their living conditions so that they will be more comfortable.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Build a room

loans.name: Wendy Yamileth

texts.es: Wendy Yamileth López P., de 21 años de edad, es una joven muy responsable e ingeniosa, con ella viven sus abuelos: Don Rafael y Niña Carmen, de 70 y 68 años respectivamente, además de ellos también se encuentra en la misma casa su hermana Fatima que recién ha dado a luz a la pequeña Fatima. Todos dependen económicamente de la tienda que Wendy ha instalado en su mismo lugar de residencia en ella distribuye productos de consumo diario, Wendy ha encontrado en éste negocio además una buena forma de cuidar a sus abuelitos. Le está yendo muy bien y por ser dedicada en la atención de sus clientes esta ganando que su negocio sea reconocido cada día. Cerca del negocio se encuentra una escuela y ve en ella oportunidad para crecer en sus ventas, pero necesita surtir su negocio para poder atraer esa demanda. Es por esto que Wendy se encuentra solicitando su primer crédito para poder abastecer de nuevos productos que están demandando sus clientes.-
texts.en:
Wendy Yamileth López P. is 21 years old. She is a very responsible and resourceful young woman who lives with her grandparents, Don Rafael and Niña Carmen, who are 70 and 68 respectively. Also living with them is her sister Fatima, who recently gave birth to a daughter also named Fatima. All of them are financially dependent on the store that Wendy established in their home.

She sells daily consumer products. Her business is doing very well and she dedicates herself to providing good service to her customers, since she is becoming more recognized each day. Wendy has discovered that her business is good way for her to look after her grandparents. Her store is located near a school, which gives her an opportunity to increase her sales. However, she needs additional merchandise in order to attract new business. For this reason, Wendy is requesting her first loan so that she can buy new products that customers are demanding.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase new products to attract customers

loans.name: Sandra Tatiana

texts.es:
Doña Sandra Tatiana, tiene 21 años de edad, su estado civil es soltera, tiene un hijo pequeño, vive en casa de su abuela, donde tiene su propio cuarto, la señora se dedica a la venta de cosméticos y biyuteria en su puesto de la feria uyustus, el mismo que se encuentra ubicado en el puente VITA.
El crédito solicitado es para comprar más mercaderia relacionada con los cosméticos y la otra parte es para comprar ropa interior y juguetes en la feria de la ciudad de Oruro por Navidad.
texts.en:
Doña Sandra Tatiana is 21 years old and a single mother of a little boy. She lives at her grandmother’s house and has her own living quarters. Sandra sells cosmetics and costume jewelry from her vending post at the Uyustus fair, which is located near the VITA bridge.

She is requesting a loan to buy more cosmetics. Part of the proceeds will also be used to purchase undergarments and toys at the fair in Oruro to sell for the Christmas season.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase cosmetics, undergarments, and toys to sell for the holidays

loans.name: William Ramiro

texts.es: El señor William Ramiro tiene una pequeña pulpería ubicada en Laureles Norte en donde vive junto con su esposa y tres hijos, que cursan sus estudios, en su negocio se ha descapitalizado debido a las ventas bajas por las crisis del desempleo, el inicio con ahorro propios y luego con financiamiento es por tal razón no ha cerrado por que ha invertido. Sus planes es poder tener su propio taller de saldadura. Ya que  hace trabajos cuando lo buscan por que anteriormente de eso dependía. Con este préstamo comprara, arroz, frijoles, azúcar, leche de pote, lácteos, carnes, cosméticos, productos de limpieza y otros que puedan sastifacer las necesidades del cliente como vender mas para poder ayudar a su familia a que no pase ninguna necesidad. Da las gracias Afodenic por impulsar el crédito ya que gracias a estos se logra la buena inversión.
texts.en:
Mr. William Ramiro owns a small grocery store located in Laureles Norte where he lives with his wife and three school-going children. His business has lost money because of poor sales due to the unemployment crisis. He has not closed down the business as he invested his personal savings as well as loans. His plans are to open his own welding workshop as he used to work as a welder for his income. With this loan he will buy rice, beans, sugar, pot milk, dairy products, meat, cosmetics, cleaning products, etc. to satisfy the needs of the client and sell more to satisfy his family's needs. He is grateful to Afodenic to promote his loan as it will provide a good investment.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck Christensen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase rice, sugar, pot milk, meat, and dairy products to increase sales.

loans.name: Gaviotas Group

texts.es: La venta de madera es una actividad donde Graciela C. encontró la  rentabilidad  necesaria para conseguir objetivos personales. Ella cumplió los  43 años esta casada y tienen cuatro hijos,  es presidente de la asociación “Gaviotas” del centro focal villa Exaltación, su grupo esta formado por nueve integrantes y cada uno de ellos tienen diversas actividades, como ser la venta de fruta, actividad a la que se dedica Clotilde, Luisa teje mantas, Verónica vende celulares, Juan es Orfebre. La asociación Gaviotas precisa necesita comprar diferentes productos para poder iniciar sus negocios.
texts.en:
Selling wood is a profitable activity for Graciela C.. She found it necessary to engage in this business in order to achieve her personal goals.
