Graciela recently turned 43 and is married with four children. She serves as the president of the Gaviotas Association, which meets at the Villa Exaltación Community Center. Her group consists of nine members who are involved in different business activities. Here are a few examples:

• Clotilde sells fruit. • Luisa weaves blankets. • Verónica sells mobile phones. • Juan is a goldsmith.

The members of the Gaviotas Association need to purchase various products that are necessary to continue their businesses.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase merchandise & supplies

loans.name: Angela

texts.es: Doña Ángela E. vende tortilla  y nacatamales desde hace ocho años, desde horas tempranas se levanta para ir a moler el maíz al molino y comenzar a palmear para el desayuno. Ya que manda a vender ambulante como en la casa para los clientes del barrio. Procreo tres hijos dos casados y uno que es enfermo discapacitado que tiene a su cuido. Como planes es pode mejorar la infraestructura de su casa para dar una mejor presentación en donde palmea las tortillas. Con este financiamiento invertirá en la compra de sacos de maíz para que no le falte inventario para hacer las tortillas, comprar mucha leña ya que se escasea en tiempo de verano, a si como comprar más alimentos para preparar muchos nacatamales y aumentar las ventas. Y poder hacer sus pagos como cubrir sus necesidades cotidianas. Da las gracias a la institución por la oportunidad y el apoyo para poder crecer en su negocio.
texts.en:
Doña Ángela E. has been selling tortillas and nacatamales for eight years. She wakes up in the early morning hours to grind the corn and form tortillas by hand for breakfast. Ángela sells her food as a street vendor, as well as from her house, to her customers from the neighborhood. She has three children, two are married and one suffers from a disability and receives care. Her plans include making improvements to her house, especially the area she uses for preparing tortillas.

With this loan, Ángela will buy sacks of corn so that she has enough inventory on hand for making tortillas. She will acquire firewood in large quantities because supply is scarce during the summer. Finally, she will purchase more ingredients for making nacatamales so that she can increase her sales and cover her basic necessities. Ángela thanks the Institution for its support and providing the opportunity to grow her business.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase sacks of corn, firewood, and ingredients for making nacatamales

loans.name: Maritza Del Socorro

texts.en:
Maritza Del A. M. is 44 years old. She lives in Corredores, in the southern region of Costa Rica, with her husband and four children. Maritza is in the textile business: she designs and produces shorts and pants by hand with her sewing machine. She started her business in November of 2006 with an initial investment of 700,000 colons ($1200 US) she sells her products from her home and from door to door in her neighbourhood. Her clothes are very popular, and at the moment she has more orders than she can keep up with. 

Maritza’s main challenge has been securing a reliable and affordable supplier of raw materials. Currently, her supplier is located in San Isidro, which is close to her home, but the materials are expensive and delivery is unreliable. She knows a supplier in San Jose who is much more professional and affordable. Due to the longer distance and associated costs of distribution, the San Jose supplier requires a minimum quantity to be purchased with every order. Currently, she does not have enough capital to place a large enough order to satisfy this restriction. Maritza is applying for a loan of 500,000 colons, which will enable her to purchase larger quantities of materials from the source in San Jose. With your help, she will be able to purchase in bulk and take advantage of a lower price for the materials she needs. By switching suppliers, Maritza will increase her profit margins and use the income to improve her family’s quality of life.

Maritza has a strong work ethic; she devotes the hours from 7am to 6pm to her textile business. On a good day she can produce 10 articles of clothing. Shorts sell for 2500 colons (around $4US) while pants sell for 4000 colons (roughly$7US). The majority of sales are done in cash, and in a good month she earns 500,000 colons. In a bad month, she only earns 60,000 colons.  After accounting for the costs of raw materials, rent and machinery maintenance, Maritza uses her revenues to support her family.

Maritza dreams of opening her own store where she could offer a more diverse range of products.

Your contribution is a direct investment in the improvement of the lives of families living in a poor community of southern Costa Rica.

loans.use: To purchase raw materials for clothing

loans.name: Sonia Mercedes

texts.es: Sonia Mercedes es una mujer trabajadora y optimista, vive en la ciudad de Pucallpa región de Ucayali, tiene 37 años, es madre de cuatro hijos de los cuales uno es mayor de edad. Sonia se dedica a la venta de productos de belleza y también trabaja junto a su esposo brindando servicios de cerrajería. Forma parte D. Banco Comunal “Las Divinas” desde hace dos años,  el primer crédito que recibió fue de 300 soles que fue utilizado en la compra de pinturas para metales. Actualmente necesita un crédito de 1500 soles, que será utilizado para comprar soldaduras, pinturas,  ya que Sonia y su esposo construyen puertas y ventanas. La meta de Sonia es  ampliar su negocio de cerrajería, progresar y tener más clientes .
texts.en:
Sonia Mercedes, 37, is a hard-working, optimistic woman who lives in the city of Pucallpa, Ucayali region. She is the mother of 4 children, one of whom is an adult. She sells beauty products but also works alongside her husband providing locksmithery services. She has been part of the "Las Divinas" (The Divine Ones) communal bank for the last two years. Her initial, 300 sol, loan was used to buy paints for metal. She now needs a 1500 sol loan to buy solder and paints because Sonia and her husband build doors and windows. Sonia's goal is to enlarge her locksmith shop, to make progress, and to have more customers.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy solder and paints.

loans.name: Nancy Amada

texts.es:
La señora  NANCY AMADA FERNÁNDEZ G. D. V. , tiene  43 años, vive en el distrito D. la MOCHE provincia D. Trujillo, departamento La Libertad – Perú. La socia pertenece al Banco Comunal SIEMPRE ADELANTE  II. Ella presenta estudios hasta 5to D. secundaria y tiene 3 hijos quienes dependen económicamente D. ella. La socia se dedica a  la venta D. ropa para damas, caballeros y niños. Con su primer crédito D. 300.00 nuevos soles compro  ropa para damas  como: jeans, polos, chompas, poleras, etc y ahora con su próximo crédito D. 1,000 nuevos soles viajara a la ciudad D. Lima a comprar ropa como: faldas, pantalones, polos, jeans y juguetes para vender en las fiestas D. fin D. año.
Ella sueña con alquilar un stand en un centro comercial en donD. vender con mayor frecuencia y facilidad.
texts.en:
NANCY AMADA FERNÁNDEZ G. D. V., 43, lives in the MOCHE district, Trujillo province, La Libertad department, Perú. She is a member of the SIEMPRE ADELANTE II (Always Forward II) communal bank. She finished 11th graD. and has three children who depend upon her for support. She sells clothing for women, men and children. With her initial, 300 new sol, loan she bought clothing for women like: jeans, polo shirts, sweaters, t-shirts, etc. and now, with her next, 1000 new sol, loan she will travel to Lima to buy clothing like: skirts, pants, polo shirts, jeans, and toys to sell during the end-of-year festivities. She dreams with renting a stand in a shopping center where she can sell more frequently and more easily.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy clothing like skirts, pants, polo shirts, jeans, and toys.

loans.name: Alcidia

texts.es: Alcidia F. es una mujer dinámica que tiene mucho anhelo de superación, vive en el distrito de calleria, región de Ucayali, tiene 43 años, es madre de tres hijos, de los cuales dos son mayores de edad, ella se dedica a la venta de gaseosas, y también tiene una vulcanizadora en donde su esposo trabaja como mecánico. Forma parte del Banco Comunal “Las Divinas” desde hace un año. El primer crédito que recibió fue de 300 soles, que lo invirtió en la compra de gaseosas. Ahora Alcidia necesita un crédito de 800 soles, que será utilizado para invertir en bebidas refrescantes. La meta de Alcidia es implementar su negocio de bebidas refrescantes y apoyar a us esposo en el mantenimiento de su vulcanizadora .
texts.en:
Alcidia F., 43, is a dynamic woman with a great desire to better herself. She lives in the Calleria district, Ucayali region. She has three children, two of whom are adults. She sells soft-drinks and also has a tire shop where her husband works as a mechanic. She has been a member of the "Las Divinas" (The Divine Ones) communal bank for the last year. Her initial, 300 sol, loan was used to buy soft-drinks. Now, Alcidia needs 800 soles to buy refreshing beverages. Alcidia's goal is to stock her beverage sales business and help her husband with the upkeep of his tire shop.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy refreshing beverages.

loans.name: Bonifacia

texts.es:
La señora Bonifacia es socia del Banco Comunal  “Azangarinas Valientes “, del distrito y provincia Azangaro, tiene 33 años de edad, es conviviente  y tiene 02 hijos; ella estudió hasta el sexto grado  de primaria.
 La señora Bonifacia viene trbajando con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace 01 año,  ella  y su conviviente se dedican a la carpintería metálica (construcción de puertas, ventanas  etc.)

Bonifacia con el primer préstamo  que fue de s/500.00 nuevos soles compró material para su taller.

Ella requiere un credito de s/ 1000.00 nuevos soles, con el cual comprará algunas herramientas, manuales y mas materiales, tambien piesa mejorar la infraestructura de su taller.

Su visión para el futuro es de ampliar su taller  y comprar más máquinas con lo que su producción aumentaría considerablemente por lo tanto sus ingresos económicos serian buenos.

Lo que mas le agrada de su Banco Comunal son las charlas sobre los temas educativos.
texts.en:
Bonifacia is a member of the community bank "Azangrarinas Valientes", from the district and province of Azangaro. She is 33 years old, is in a common law marriage and has two children. She has a sixth grade education. Bonifacia has worked with the Movimiento Manuela Ramos for one year. She and her husband are devoted to metalwork (the construction of doors, windows, etc.) Bonifacia's first loan was for S/. 500.00 nuevos soles which she used to buy material for her workshop. She is requesting a loan of S/. 1000.00 nuevos soles, with which she will buy some tools, manuals, and more materials. She will also improve the infrastructure of her workshop. Her vision for the future is to expand her workshop and buy more machines that would considerably increase the production of products, therefore making her business income higher. What she most appreciates about her community bank (lender organization) are the educational lectures it provides.

Translated from Spanish by Colleen Godfrey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Tools, emery, welding machine

loans.name: Lidia

texts.es:
La señora Lidia es socia del Banco Comunal “Las Brisas del Río Blanco” del distrito de Pilcuyo , provincia de El Collao; ella tiene 33 años de edad, es casada,  tiene 04  hijos, 3 de ellos viven con su padre y 01 vive con ella. Estudió hasta quinto de secundaria.
Lidia trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace 03 años; tiene un taller de repuestos con el que brinda servicios a los autos, también compra y vende animales menores.
Nos cuenta que con su primer préstamo que fue de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, compró animales: ovejas.
Con este préstamo de S/. 3000.00 nuevos soles, invertirá en la apertura de su tienda de abarrotes en Puerto Maldonado.
Su visión hacia el futuro es abrir un Internet, un locutorio y seguir con su negocio en su ferretería y la crianza de ganado.
Lo que mas le gusta de su Banco Comunal son los prestamos porque no les piden garantías y es muy rápido.
texts.en:
Mrs. Lidia is a member of the “Las Brisas del Río Blanco” communal bank in the district of Pilcuyo, El Callao province. She is 33 years old, she is married and she has 4 children. Three of them live with the father and one child lives with her. She attended school through the 5th year of secondary school. Lidia has worked with the Manuela Ramos Movement for 3 years. She has a spare parts shop with which she offers services to cars. She also buys and sells small animals. She told us that with her first loan of S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, she bought animals: sheep. With this loan of S/. 3000.00 nuevos soles, she will invest in the opening of her grocery store in Puerto Maldonado. Her vision for the future is to open an internet café and to continue with her hardware store business and rearing animals. What she likes most about her Communal Bank is that the loans do not require guarantees and it’s very quick.

Translated from Spanish by Lauren Jackson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy groceries-sugar, rice, noodles, etc

loans.name: Maria Dominga

texts.es: Doña Maria Dominga es originaria de la comunidad de Xolsacmalja del municipio de Totonicapan ella aprendio el arte con su difunto padre a momento  del fallecimiento ella empieza ha manejar el taller de la capinteria, con variedad de producto de elaboracion, camas, sillas, roperos, amueblados de sala y cosina hoy necesita del apoyo de la institucion para aumentar su capital  en la compra de madera, clavos, cola blanca, pintura y otros para aprovechar la epoca de verado en donde se tiene en incrementar la demanda de su producto, en los departamento de Totonicapan, Chimaltenango, y mazatenango.
texts.en:
Doña Maria Dominga is originally from the Xolsacmalja community in the town of Totonicapan. She learned carpentry from her late father. After his death, she began managing a workshop where she makes a variety of products such as beds, chairs, wardrobes, and furniture pieces for the living room and kitchen.

She needs the assistance of the Institution to increase her capital for buying wood, nails, white glue, paint, and other items. Maria plans to take advantage of the dry season when demand for her products increases in the departments of Totonicapan, Chimaltenango, and Mazatenango.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase materials & supplies

loans.name: Alvaro Manuel

texts.es: Don Alvaro  Manuel es originartio del cantón Cojxac del municipio de Totonicapan  su actividad principal es la elaboracion de sinchos  de diferentes estilos y colores dicha actividad lo aprendio desde cuando tenia ocho años como operario cuando cumplio los veinte años formo su propio negocio y la cual los vende en la plaza de los dias martes y sabado en el mercado municiapl de Totonicapan hoy necesita de un credtio para surtir su mercaderia ya que consiguio un nuevo punto de ventas el Joyabaj Santa cruz del Quiche.
texts.en:
Don Alvaro Manuel is originally from the Cojxac district in the town of Totonicapan. He makes belts in different styles and colors. Alvaro says he learned this trade when he was 8 years old. At the age of 20, he started his own business selling his products in the open area of the Totonicapan municipal market on Tuesdays and Saturdays. He needs a loan in order to produce more merchandise. Recently he acquired a new vending location in Joyabaj Santa Cruz del Quiche.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase materials & supplies for making belts

loans.name: Exal Eviar

texts.es:
El señor Exal Evir R. tiene ya más de tres años dedicándose a la renta de sonido y perifoneo, le está haciendo falta un mejor y moderno equipo de sonido, ya que tiene varios eventos para animaciones en las posados, desea que sus clientes tengan un buena presencia de su trabajo.
Solicita el préstamo para poder comprar el equipo de sonido, y planea pagarlo con las ganancias que obtiene del negocio, ya que su esposa la señora Esthela Isaura Juárez se encargara de los gastos familiares con el ingreso de su trabaja como empleada de una compañía de autos.
texts.en:
Exal Evir R. has dedicated himself to the rental of audio (stereos, speakers) equipment for more than three years. He is in need of better and more modern equipment, as he has several events scheduled and wants his customers to have a good experience with regard to his work. He requests this loan to buy sound equipment, and he plans to make his payments using income generated from his business. He can accomplish this since his wife, Esthela Isaura Juárez, is in charge of covering the family’s household expenses using the income from her job at a car company.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy equipment for his work.

loans.name: Juan José

texts.es:
Al señor Juan José S. tiene poco tiempo que le adquirió su vivienda por medio de un crédito gubernamental, con ahorros que tenia le pudo hacer algunas mejoras pero le está haciendo falta el vitropiso en toda la casa. 
Es por eso que está solicitando un préstamo para poder comprar el vitropiso y pagarle a la persona que se encargara de colocarlo. 
Don Juan José es empleado de una compañía de trasportes en el departamento de descargas de la mercancía de los camiones, con una parte de este ingreso planea pagar el crédito.
Ya que sesea que su pequeño hijo tenga un mejor lugar donde vivir.
texts.en:
Not long ago, Juan José S. was able to buy his home by way of a government loan. He was able to use savings to make some improvements, but is still missing tile flooring throughout the entire house. He is requesting a loan so he can buy the flooring and pay an installer. Juan José is an employee at a transportation company, working in the area in charge of unloading the trucks. He plans to use part of his income from this job to repay the loan. His goal is to provide his young son with a better place to live.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase and install flooring in his house.

loans.name: Guillermo

texts.es:
El señor Guillermo L. ha tenido ya tres créditos con FVP los cuales los a utilizado para construir un cuarto que es para sus hijos, ya casi esta terminado solo le está haciendo falta los acabados del exterior e interior del la recamara. 
Solicita el préstamo para poder comprar el material que necesita, ya que el se encargara de realizar la mejora en horario adicional a su trabaja. 
Don Guillermo desea que sus niños tengan ya su propio espacio en la casa y que tengan un lugar seguro donde vivir. El planea pagar el crédito con su ingreso que obtiene de su trabaja como guarda de seguridad de una compañía, ya que su esposa la señora Esmirna González se encargara de los gastos familiares, con el ingreso de su trabaja como costurera.
texts.en:
Guillermo L. has had three loans with FVP, which he has used to build a room for his children. He has almost completed the work, except the exterior and interior of the bedroom still need finish work. He is requesting a loan to buy the materials he needs. He works on these improvements in his free time, after his regular job. Guillermo wants his children to have their own space in the house, and a safe place to live. He plans to repay the loan from his income working as a security guard. His wife, Esmirna González, will be in charge of covering the household’s living expenses using the income she generates as a seamstress.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To do finish work on the exterior and interior of a new room.

loans.name: Norma Hilda

texts.es:
Solicita un préstamo para poder construir la barda lateral más alta ya que el terreno de alado esta solo y han intentado entrar a robar a su casa. 
La señora Nora Hilda T. es madre soltera y tiene baja su responsabilidad a quienes les quiere dar la seguridad cuando ella no este en casa. 
Ya que es empleada del estado, en el departamento de secretaria este es el ingreso con el que pagar el crédito ya que los gastos de sus hijos los cubrirá con la pensión alimenticia que recibe de su ex esposo.
texts.en:
She is requesting a loan to build a wall, as the neighboring property is vacant and there have been attempts to rob her house. Nora Hilda T. is a single mother, and she is required to provide a secure living environment to those in her care when she is not home. She is a state employee, and would use income from her job to pay for the loan. Her children’s expenses would be covered by the child support she receives from her ex-husband.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To build a wall around her house.

loans.name: Verónica

texts.es:
A la vivienda de la señora Verónica M. le está haciendo falta un cuarto el cual lo quiere para su hijo.
En este momento no cuenta con el dinero necesario para empezar la construcción, es por eso que esta solicitando un préstamo para poder comprar el material y  contratar a la persona que realizar la mejora.
Planea pagar el crédito con una parte del ingreso que obtiene de su trabaja como enfermera en una clínica local de la ciudad.
Doña Verónica y su esposo el señor Raúl desean que su pequeño hijo tenga su propio espacio en la casa.
texts.en:
Verónica M.’ house is lacking a bedroom, which she would like to have for her son. Currently, she does not have enough money to start construction. She is requesting a loan in order to buy materials and hire the contractors necessary for the home improvement. She plans to repay the loan with some of the income she earns as a nurse in the city’s local clinic. Verónica, and her husband Raúl, want their young son to have his own space in their house.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To build a bedroom in their house.

loans.name: Leonardo

texts.es:
El señor Leonardo L. tiene ya más de dos años dedicándose a la venta de elotes preparados.
Al negocio le está haciendo falta mejorar el equipo de trabaja que el actual y no esta en buenas condiciones. 
Pero en este momento no cuenta con el capital necesario para poder arreglar los equipos de trabajo, ya que tiene dos carritos, uno lo trabaja en diferentes partes de la ciudad y el otro su esposa la señora Irma Santiago, en otra partes de la ciudad, estos son los ingresos que obtiene para sus tres hijo a quienes les quieren dar lo mejor.
Es por eso que están solicitando el préstamo, desean dar una buena presentación a sus clientes al consumir sus deliciosos elotes calientitos.
texts.en:
Leonardo L. has dedicated himself to selling cooked corncobs for more than two years. His business needs some better equipment, as what he is currently using is not in good condition. However, he does not have the capital necessary to make repairs to his equipment. He has two little carts, one of which he uses throughout different parts of the city. The other is used by his wife, Irma Santiago, in other sections of the city. This is how he generates income to support his three children, for whom he wants to provide all the best. He is requesting a loan so he can give a better quality of service to his customers, who consume his delicious hot corn.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To improve his work equipment.

loans.name: Oah

texts.en:
Oah M., 37, is married with four children. Three of his children are enrolled at a local high school. He resides in Batambong Province, Cambodia, with his wife and children.

To make a living, he operates his motorbike as a taxi driver at the local markets in the town, earning an income of $2.50 a day. His wife is a cleaner at a local university in the town, earning an income of $1.50 a day. The family is also assisted by one of his children who is currently employed in a local garment factory.

Oah M. and his wife are seeking to improve their standard of living and to generate a better income. Therefore, he is asking for a loan of $1000 to purchase pigs to raise and sell when the price is good enough to make a profit.

loans.use: to buy pigs to raise and sell

loans.name: Seoun

texts.en:
Seoun S., 37, is married with one school-aged child who is enrolled at a local high school. She resides in Batambong Province, Cambodia, with her husband and child.

To make a living, she sells a variety of soft drinks and cakes, earning an income of $5 a day. Her husband operates his motorbike everywhere in the town, earning an income of $5 a day to help cover the family expenses.

Seoun S. and her husband are seeking to improve their standard of living and generate a better income. Therefore, she is asking for a loan of $1000 to purchase a machine to squeeze sugar cane to produce its juice for sale.

loans.name: Aniceto

texts.es:
Aniceto es un hombre de campo que tiene 55 años, vive con su esposa (Donata), de 53 años, y con sus 3 hijos ya mayores; Jaime, Maritza y Juan, en su acogedora casa cerca de su chacra. 

Bajo el cielo azul de la sierra peruana este hombre trabajador siembra papa -tubérculo peruano- de distintas variedades, desde que era muy joven lo aprendió de sus padres. Él trabaja en su chacra con la colaboración de toda su familia, porque el trabajo en esta parte del país es en equipo, así lo aprendió, porque así se traspasan las costumbres de generación en generación, y aún en la actualidad son practicadas, además todos los agricultores saben que así se avanza más rápido. Paralelo a ello, Aniceto también cría ganado ovino que comercializa en los mercados cercanos a su casa.  Él considera a la agricultura como un trabajo rentable porque le ha permitido sacar adelante a su familia, además tiene la oportunidad de construir su casa, es por eso que continúa trabajando diariamente, pues quiere dar lo mejor de sí, y eso lo logrará trabajando hasta alcanzar sus metas. 
En el futuro, espera intensificar la crianza de ganado ovino y para ello desea invertir el préstamo que solicita en vitaminas para estos animales y garantizar su crianza, asimismo desea comprar abono e insecticidas para fumigar sus chacras y obtener una buena cosecha.

Este es el tercer préstamo que tiene con MFP y siempre se la ha considerado como un hombre honesto que cumple con el pago de sus cuotas, además está conforme con el trabajo de su banco comunal porque a todos los integrantes los conoce desde hace mucho tiempo y sabe que son gente responsable.
texts.en:
Aniceto is a 55-year old farmer who lives with his wife (Donata), 53 years old, and their 3 older children, Jaime, Maritza and Juan, in their home near their farm. Under the blue sky of the Peruvian mountainside, this hard-working man plants potatoes – a Peruvian tuber – of different varieties. He learned farming from his parents at a young age. He works on the farm with the help of the entire family, because the work in this part of the country is done as a team. This is how he himself learned, and it is a tradition passed on from generation to generation that is still practiced to this day. Also, all the farmers know that this is the way to advance quicker. Concurrently to planting his crops, Aniceto also raises sheep that he then sells in the nearby markets. He considers agriculture to be a profitable endeavor, because is has allowed him to sustain his family and improve their standard of living. It also gave him the opportunity to build a house, which is why he continues to work on a daily basis. He wants to give the best of himself, and he will accomplish this by continuing to work hard and meeting his goals. In the future, he would like to expand his livestock, which is why he requests a loan to invest in vitamins for these animals so they grow healthy. He would also like to buy fertilizers and insecticides for his farmlands, so he can achieve a successful harvest. This is his third loan with MFP, and he has always been considered an honest man who complies with his installment payments. He is also satisfied with his cooperative bank’s work because he has known all the members for quite some time, and knows that they are responsible people.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fertilizer, insecticides, and vitamins for his animals.

loans.name: Celestino

texts.es:
Celestino tiene 53 años y mantiene aún la vitalidad de un joven, él vive con su esposa (Juliana), de 49 años, y con sus dos hijos; Katia de 19  y Alexander de 8 años, que son el motor que lo impulsa para continuar progresando.

Al amanecer de cada día este hombre se despierta con ansias de trabajar la tierra que lo vio nacer, aquella que sostuvo a sus ancestros, y la que hoy sigue dando buenas cosechas para que los hombres trabajadores como él logren mantener a sus familias. La tierra nutrida y preparada que tiene, le brinda a Celestino una deliciosa papa que luego de la cosecha es vendida y así puede obtener ganancias y con ello logra sacar adelante a su familia. 
A él le gusta la agricultura porque la aprendió de sus padres, no le dieron una profesión pero le dieron las herramientas necesarias para trabajar y le enseñaron como producir la tierra; además también se dedica a la crianza de ganado ovino que comercializa en los mercados de su localidad. 
En el futuro no solo le gustaría sembrar papa, sino también hortalizas, porque sabe que debe aprovechar la tierra al máximo y pensar siempre en el futuro, para darles a sus hijos una buena educación y enseñarles técnicas nuevas que les permitan sobrevivir en este mundo que crece cada día de una manera vertiginosa.

Este es el tercer préstamo que tiene Celestino con MFP y lo invertirá en la compra de abono, insecticidas y fertilizantes para su tierra, porque sabe que además de aprovecharla debe cuidarla para seguir produciendo. Celestino pertenece a un banco comunal establecido que es muy responsable con cada uno de los pagos porque saben que solo así todos tendrán la oportunidad de progresar.
texts.en:
Celestino is 53 years old, and still maintains the vitality of a youngster. He lives with his wife (Juliana) who is 49 years old, and his two children; Katia is 19 years old, and Alexander is 8. They are what give him the motivation to forge ahead. This man wakes each and every day anxious to work the land that witnessed his birth, which sustained his ancestors and today continues to yield prosperous crops so that hard-working men like him can care for their families. The nutrient-rich and prepared land provides Celestino with a delicious potato crop that he harvests and then sells to help support his family. He enjoys farming, a vocation he learned from his parents. They didn’t provide him with a career, but gave him the necessary skills and taught him how to work the land. In addition, he raises sheep to sell in nearby markets. In the future, he would like to plant not only potatoes but also vegetables. He knows he must take advantage of the land to its fullest and always think about the future, to provide his children with good educations and the skills necessary to survive in this world that grows at a dizzying pace. This is Celestino’s third loan with MFP, and he plans to invest the funds into fertilizers and insecticides for his lands. He knows that, in addition to enjoying the fruits of his labor, he must care for the land so it will continue to produce. Celestino belongs to an established cooperative bank that is very responsible for all its repayments, because they know this is the only way that they will have the opportunity to advance.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase insecticides and fertilizers.

loans.name: Clara

texts.es:
Clara tiene 30 años, vive a lado de su esposo (Juan) que tiene 36 años y sus tres pequeños hijos que son su adoración; Ángela de 10, Pilar de 8 y Betzabe de 5 años.

Ella ayuda a su esposo en las labores de cultivo de la papa en la chacra que tienen en la región sierra del Perú, juntos trabajan sin parar, día a día, bajo el cielo azul de la ciudad de Tarma; es así  como han sacado adelante a sus hijos, trabajando al máximo la tierra que buenamente les provee buenas cosechas. Ellos comercializan la papa después de cada cosecha y obtienen ganancias que les permiten tener una vida digna. A Clara le gusta ayudar a su esposo, porque lo hace de vez en cuando y no descuida la crianza de sus pequeños hijos, ya que su chacra está muy cerca de su casa. 
Para el futuro esta pareja de sacrificados agricultores tienen pensado mejorar la siembra comprando abono y medicamentos para las plantas, asimismo desean sembrar maíz y alverjas.

Este es el tercer préstamo que Clara tiene con MFP y promete cumplir como siempre lo hace con cada uno de sus pagos. Ella tiene pensado comprar abono para ayudar a mejorar la siembra de papa de su esposo y así lograr darles una mejor calidad de vida a sus menores hijos.
texts.en:
Clara is 30, and she lives at the side of her 36 year old husband, Juan, and their three children whom she adores. Ángela is 10, Pilar is 8, and Betzabe is 5. She helps her husband in his work of cultivating potatoes on the farm they have in the mountainous region of Perú. Under the blue sky in the city of Tarma they work together day to day without stopping. That is how they have gotten their children ahead. They work the land to the maximum, and it provides them with good harvests. They sell the potatoes after each harvest, and they get earnings that allow them to have a decent life. Clara likes to help her husband because she does it once in a while, and she does not neglect caring for her small children. Her farm is very close to her house. In the future, this pair of sacrificing farmers plans to improve their planting by purchasing fertilizer and medicines for the plants. They wish to plant corn and peas. This is Clara’s third loan with MFP. She promises, as always, to make all of her payments. She plans to buy fertilizer to help improve her husband’s potato planting. That way they will be able to give their minor children a better quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy fertilizer

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en:
Cecilia A. is from the village of Taboo in Jimenez,Misamis Occidental. She is 51 years old. Cecilia is married and has 3 adult children. To make a living, Cecilia harvests and sells ocean-caught fish in the local community. Cecilia has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month from her business.

In 2005, Cecilia joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Cecilia has successfully repaid a previous loan of 30,000 PHP from PMPC. She use her previous loan to buy fish to sell. Cecilia is requesting a new loan of 40000 PHP which will be used as additional working capital. This will be Cecilia's 6th loan from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To use as additional working capital

loans.name: Gloria

texts.es:
Gloria es una mujer muy alegre y amable que a sus 40 años sabe lo que es trabajar sin descanso, ella vive con su esposo (Florentino), de 54 años; y también con sus jóvenes hijos: Wilder de 16, Milena de 13 y Susana de 12 años.

Cada día se levanta muy temprano y con el cántico de las aves empieza su labor de siembra de papa acompañada de toda su familia, en la pequeña chacra que tiene cerca de su casa. Además, también se dedica a la crianza de ganado ovino y porcino y como ella es muy laboriosa ayuda a su esposo en el tejido de multicolores telares. Gloria es una gran comerciante y según sus propias palabras” trato de vender lo que cae en mis manos” y es muy cierto, porque confiesa que comercializa la rica papa que cosecha en su productiva tierra; además de sus bien alimentados animales y los telares que día a día teje con su esposo. 
A su vez, como toda mujer emprendedora, ya tiene planes para el futuro y quisiera comprar más animales de mejor raza y venderlos a mayor precio, así obtener más ganancias económicas y con ello mandar a sus hijos a estudiar a la ciudad, que es su máximo anhelo.

Este es el tercer préstamo que Gloria tiene con MFP y promete ser responsable con sus pagos, porque sabe que como actúa cada persona en la vida se le devuelven las acciones buenas o malas; esta es su convicción es por ello que se dedica con esmero a su trabajo. Ya tiene planeado el destino del préstamo, pues será invertido en la compra de mejor de raza de ganado ovino y porcino.
texts.en:
Gloria is a happy and kind 40 year old woman who knows how to work without resting. She lives with her 54 year old husband, Florentino, and their three children. Wilder is 16, Milena is 13, and Susana is 12. She gets up early every morning. As the birds sing she starts her work of planting potatoes. She is accompanied by the whole family on the small farm, which is close to her house. She also raises sheep and pigs. As she is a hard-worker, she also helps her husband make multicolored weavings. Gloria is a great businesswoman, and in her own words, “I try to sell what falls in my hands”. It is very true, because she says that she sells the delicious potatoes that she harvests from her productive earth. It is also true of her well fed animals and the weavings that she makes day to day with her husband. Like all enterprising women, in the future she would like to buy more animals of a better breed and sell them at a greater price. That way she would get greater earnings. She would use that to send her children to school in the city, which is her greatest desire. This is Gloria’s third loan with MFP. She promises to be responsible with her payments. She knows that a person’s actions in life, good or bad, are returned to them. With this conviction she puts great effort into her work. She will use to loan to buy a better breed of sheep and pigs.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy animals of a better breed

loans.name: Mariza

texts.en:
Mariza C. is from the village of Casinglot, Tagoloan Misamis Oriental. She is 37 years old. Mariza is married and has three school-aged children. To make a living, Mariza owns and operates a business venture making and selling food. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling specialty food products like pancakes, fruit salad and banana cue in the local community. Mariza has been engaged in her business for over eight years and earns approximately 7,200 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Mariza joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Mariza is requesting a loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products to sell. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Mariza from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement her family's income and support the educational expenses of her children. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase raw ingredients needed to make products to sell

loans.name: Severina

texts.en:
Severina H. is from the village of Naasag, Mambajao, Camiguin Province. She is 59 years old. Severina is widowed and has seven adult-aged children. To make a living, Severina owns and operates a business venture in the retail sector running a sari-sari (variety) retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling a variety of different products in the local community. Severina has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 7,500 PHP a month for these activities.

In October 2008, Severina joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Severina has successfully repaid a previous loan of 6,000 PHP from HSPFI. Severina is requesting a new loan of 6,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. Its Severina's discretion to maintain her loan amount. This loan will be the fourth loan taken out by Severina from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement her family's income. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Jaime

texts.es:
Jaime es un carismático agricultor de 31 años, vive feliz en compañía de sus padres y hermanos mayores en la casa que está cercana a sus tierras, lugar en el que toda su familia cultiva para vivir. 

Él se dedica a la agricultura de papa, además también cría ganado ovino de buena raza y como Jaime es un hombre emprendedor que estudió educación, son pocas las veces que ejerce su carrera. En la actualidad está trabajando como agricultor para sacar su título universitario, él comenta que sembrar y cosechar le es rentable, por lo que continua en esta labor. “Cuando alguien quiere algo y lucha por eso no descansa hasta conseguirlo”, y eso es lo que piensa este joven profesor que enseña a jóvenes adolescentes la rama de ciencias sociales.
Para el futuro piensa dedicarse íntegramente a su carrera, por ello tan sólo anhela tener su título universitario.

Este es el tercer préstamo que tiene con MFP, sabe que debe ser puntual, porque es el valor que tanto inculca a sus alumnos y siempre es responsable con sus deudas. Jaime tiene pensado invertir el dinero que solicita en la compra de abono así como comprar una mejor raza de ganado ovino para comercializarlo a un mejor precio.
texts.en:
Jaime is a charismatic 31 year old farmer. He lives happily with his parents and older siblings in the house that is close to their fields. This is where his whole family farms to live. He grows potatoes and also raises a good breed of sheep. Jaime is an enterprising man who studied education. He has exercised his education very few times. He is currently working as a farmer to get his university degree. He says that planting and harvesting are profitable. That’s why he continues this work. “When someone wants something and fights for it, he does not stop until he gets it.” That is what this young teacher, who teaches young adolescents the branch of social sciences, thinks. In the future he plans on devoting himself entirely to his career. Therefore, he only aspires to have his university degree. This is the third loan he has had with MFP. He knows that he needs to be punctual because it is the value that he instills in his students. He is always responsible with his debts. He plans to use the money he is asking for to buy fertilizer and to buy a better breed of sheep to sell at a better price.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy fertilizer and a better breed of animals

loans.name: Celidey Del Socorro

texts.en:
Celidey’s business consists of selling used shoes. She sells the shoes from her house just outside of Managua and also from the central market in Jinotepe, which is roughly 20 minutes away. She is requesting a loan from CEPRODEL to buy more shoes. The shoes all arrive from the United States. People want the shoes that look new, she said, so before putting them in the store she scrubs all the shoes until they look as clean as possible. 

Celidey has been in the shoe business for six years now. This is her first loan with CEPRODEL. She is hoping the loan will help her increase her inventory and thus increase the size of her business. Celidey is 37 years old. She married with two daughters. Both of her daughters, ages 13 and 17, are in school.

loans.use: To buy used shoes to sell

loans.name: Marcelo

texts.es:
Marcelo tiene 31 años, está casado con el amor de su vida, Manuela de 28 años; con quien tiene tres hijos: Nancy de 10, Edwin de 8 y Cynthia de 5 años. Todos ellos viven juntos en una pequeña casa bajo el tranquilo cielo de la ciudad de Tarma.

Desde muy niño él veía a sus padres cultivar la tierra fértil que pisaba de casualidad jugando, así entre sus travesuras aprendió todas las técnicas de la agricultura y luego de varios años, cuando formó su propia familia, pudo empezar a ponerlas en práctica. Hoy cultiva papa de distintas clases y la comercializa a los mayoristas que lo buscan por la calidad de este tubérculo. 
Marcelo vive cómodamente de esta actividad que le permite mantener a su esposa y a sus pequeños hijos, no tiene un horario fijo, trabaja desde que amanece hasta que cae la tarde y siempre piensa en innovar las técnicas de la agricultura, es por eso que busca combinar semillas para luego sembrar un tipo de papa más grande, ese es un proyecto a corto plazo que tiene por cumplir; además piensa seguir dedicándose a esta actividad porque tiene mucha experiencia y también porque le es rentable para poder vivir.

Es el tercer préstamo que tiene con MFP y promete ser puntual como siempre, además ya tiene planeado comprar con el crédito abono y fertilizantes para sus tierras. Asimismo, adquirirá una mejor calidad de semilla de papa que le asegurará una buena producción y un alto rendimiento en el futuro.
texts.en:
Marcelo is 31 years old. He is married to the love of his life, Manuela, who is 28. They have three children: Nancy, 10, Edwin, 8, and Cynthia, 5. They live together in a small house under the peaceful skies of the city of Tarma.

From a young age, Marcelo saw his parents cultivating the fertile soil that he walked on while playing. In this way, he learned the techniques of agriculture that many years later, when he started his own family, he put into practice. Today, he grows many varieties of potatoes and sells them to wholesalers who seek him out for the quality of these tubers.

Marcelo lives comfortably from this work, which allows him to support his wife and children. He doesn’t have a fixed schedule; he works from dawn until nightfall, and is always thinking about innovations in agricultural techniques. For example, he is working on a hybrid potato that will be larger. This is a short-term project that is nearly complete. Marcelo plans to continue with agriculture because he has so much experience and because it is profitable.

This is Marcelo’s third loan with MFP, and he promises to be punctual as always. It will be used to buy manure and fertilizer for his fields and also a better quality of seed, which will assure good production and a high yield in the future.

Translated from Spanish by jeffrey hersk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase manure and fertilizers

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
Gloria J. is from the village of San Vicente in Sinacaban,Misamis Occidental. She is 52 years old. Gloria is married and has 3 adult children. To make a living, Gloria owns and operates a general store where she sells a variety of different products in the local community. Gloria has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 2,500 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2008, Gloria joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Gloria has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8,000 PHP from PMPC. She used her previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to sell. Gloria is requesting a new loan of 9500 PHP to purchase additional inventory and to be used as working capital. This will be Gloria's second loan from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement her family's income. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To buy additional items to sell and to use as working capital

loans.name: Mariza

texts.es:
Mariza tiene 30 años, creció con la convicción de trabajar para salir adelante. Vive con su esposo de 35 años y sus pequeños hijos: Saúl de 7 y Estrella de 2 años.

Desde hace algunos meses atrás se dedica a la preparación de pan, queques y picarones -postres peruanos- que comercializa en la esquina de su casa. Según cuenta, la necesidad misma de ayudar a su familia hizo que se decidiera a vender estos dulces, porque lo aprendió de su madre y solo basto con poner en práctica lo que había visto durante tantos años. 
Gracias a que este negocio le resultó rentable, está logrando comprarse conejos, pues piensa comercializar más adelante este animal, es un negocio que puede desarrollar desde su casa para no descuidar a sus hijos. Su madre la anima a comprar un par de conejos y luego otros 6 más; en la actualidad desea seguir comprando mayor cantidad, hasta tener su propia granja. 
Así pasan los días de esta luchadora mujer que no se detiene ante las dificultades y siempre tiene mente positiva sobretodo para emprender un negocio.

Y aunque este es el tercer préstamo que tiene con MFP, piensa cumplir honradamente como siempre lo ha hecho con cada una de sus responsabilidades, además está muy contenta con el trabajo de su banco comunal porque sabe que todos cumplirán como ella. Además Mariza tiene pensando invertir el dinero del préstamo en abono para la chacra de su padre, para empezar a sembrar entre los dos y obtener ganancias a medias para seguir adelante con todos sus sueños.
texts.en:
Mariza is 30 years old. She lives with her husband, who is 35, and their children: Saúl, 7, and Estrella, 2.

Mariza was raised with the conviction that you must work hard to succeed. For several months, she has worked preparing bread, cakes and picarones (Peruvian desserts) and selling them on the corner near her house. She started this business out of necessity, putting into practice a skill she learned from watching her mother for many years.

Thanks to the profits from this business, Mariza has been able to purchase some rabbits. Her mother encouraged her to buy two rabbits at first, then six more. She would like to continue buying more until she has her own farm. She wants to develop the rabbit business because she can do it at home and not have to leave her children. This is how the days are for this fighting woman who does not stop for difficulties, and has a positive attitude, especially for starting a business.

This is Mariza’s third loan from MFP and she plans to fulfill it honorably, as she has always done with each of her responsibilities. She is very happy with her communal bank because all the members are just as responsible as she is. She will use the loan money to buy fertilizer for her father’s farm, that they will plant together. This will bring earnings to continue pursuing her dreams.

Translated from Spanish by jeffrey hersk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy fertilizer for planting

loans.name: 10 Đông Sơn Group

texts.en:
Hà B. Thị (247) is a 37-year-old female living in the town of Thanh Hoá. Hà is the group leader of an eight-member group loan offered by Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they all are responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is 10 Đông Sơn.

Hà is married and has three school-age children. To making a living, Hà owns and operates a business making and selling food. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling rice products in the local community. Hà has been engaged in this business for over five years and earns approximately 2,000,000 VND a month from these activities.

In 2008, Hà joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Hà has successfully repaid a previous loan of 1,963,500 VND from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. She is now requesting a new loan of 6,000,000 VND, which will be used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. The loan will be the third loan taken out by the borrower from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Hà plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay her children's tuition fees.

About the other borrowers in the group:

1.  N. Thị Thương (246) is a 27-year-old female who is requesting a 6,000,000 VND loan to support her service-based business.

2.

loans.name: Antonia

Antonia O. is from the village of Tru-Cut in Sapang Dalaga, Misamis Occidental. She is 56 years old. Antonia is married and has 3 school-aged children. GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

loans.name: Carmen

texts.en:
Carmen T. is a 50-year-old mother to five children living in Bagong Silang, Caloocan City. Her husband, Ferigryn, is a driver. Carmen sells fruits and vegetables and homemade sausages to neighbors. She earns P4,000.00 a month, which she saves to support the education of her children. Since joining the Center for Community Transformation (CCT) Credit Cooperative in 2006, Carmen has been enjoying its many benefits for its members, who are mostly housewives. She is now on her tenth loan cycle with CCT. She is expecting to receive a new loan from the cooperative in the amount of P12, 000.00, which she will use as additional capital for her business. She dreams of having a more permanent place of business, like a market stall. 

About CCT:

The Center for Community Transformation (CCT) is an organized Christian response against poverty and social injustice. This is carried out through the fusion of social development initiatives and an evangelical mission in a uniquely Filipino context. It serves urban and rural poor communities throughout the Philippines, in pursuit of its desire to see changed lives, strong families, and transformed communities centered in the Lordship of Jesus Christ. CCT is a member of the Five Talents family.

loans.use: Additional capital for her food business

To make a living, Miriam buys and sells dried fish products, and ready-to-eat and homemade foods such as longganisa (spiced sausage), chorizo (sausage) and lumpia (spring rolls). Miriam has been engaged in her business for over 8 years and earns approximately 3,500 PHP a month from these activities.

This will be Miriam's second loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay for her children's education.

loans.name: Resureccion

texts.en:
Resureccion P. is from the village of Macabayao in Jimenez,Misamis Occidental. She is 59 years old. Resureccion is married and has 7 adult children. To make a living, Resureccion owns and operates a general store where she sells food and daily-use products in the local community. Resureccion has been engaged in her business for over 15 years and earns approximately 2,500 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2003, Resureccion joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Resureccion has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from PMPC. She used her previous loan to buy additional products to sell. loans.name: 02.06.1.2 Nam Ngạn Group

texts.en:
Miễn T. Thị (8) is a 50-year-old female living in the town of Thanh Hoá. Miễn is the group leader of a five-member group loan offered by Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they all are responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is 02.06.1.2 Nam Ngạn.

Miễn is married and has three adult children. To making a living, Miễn operates a family business in the services sector. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from providing construction services to local community members. Miễn has been engaged in this business for over 10 years and earns approximately 2,000,000 VND a month from these activities.

In 2007, Miễn joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Miễn has successfully repaid a previous loan of 3,079,800 VND from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. This previous loan was used to purchase materials needed to provide services. She is now requesting a new loan of 6,000,000 VND, which will be used to purchase more materials needed to provide services. The loan will be the fourth loan taken out by the borrower from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Miễn plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

About the other borrowers in the group:

1.  Vũ Thi Bàn (9) is a 54-year-old female who is requesting a 6,000,000 VND loan to support her business making and selling food.

2.  N. Thị Hoa (7) is a 39-year-old female who is requesting a 6,000,000 VND loan to support her service-based business.

3.  N. Thị Hà (11) is a 44-year-old female who is requesting a 6,000,000 VND loan to support her business in the retail sector selling home products.

4.  Lê Thị Hiền (10) is a 37-year-old female who is requesting a 6,000,000 VND loan to support her business making and selling food.

About Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women:

The mission of Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women (FPW) is to provide sustainable financial services to disadvantaged women in rural areas in the Thanh Hoa province.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

Original text:

Miễn  T. Thị (8) là 50 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy sống ở thành phố Thanh Hoá.  Miễn  là trưởng nhóm của nhóm vay gồm có 5 các thành viên.  Mặc dù mỗi thành viên trong nhóm nhận được từng khoản vay cá nhân, nhưng tất cả họ đều chịu trách nhiệm hoàn trả lại khoản vay của các thành viên trong nhóm của mình nếu một người nào đó trễ hạn hay không trả được nợ..  Tên chính thức của nhóm vay này là 06.1.2 Nam Ngạn (02.06.1.2 Nam Ngạn).

Trong khi không phải chỉ có các phương thức tạo nên thu nhập, mà nguồn thu nhập chính của công việc kinh doanh chủ yếu từ cung cấp các dịch vụ xây dựng cho người dân trong cộng đồng địa phương.  Miễn  thực hiện công việc kinh doanh này trong hơn 10 năm.  Từ các hoạt động này, Miễn  kiếm được khoảng 2.000.000 VND.  Vào 2007, Miễn  đã tham gia Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp cải thiện  sinh hoạt và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh doanh của cô ấy/ anh ấy.  Miễn  đã hoàn trả hết khoản vay trước đây là 3.079.800 VND từ Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.  Khoản vay trước đây được sử dụng mua vật tư cần thiết để cung cấp dịch vụ.  Cô ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 6.000.000 VND.

Khoản vay sẽ là 4th khoản vay của người vay từ Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.

Về Những Người vay khác trong Nhóm:

1.  Vũ Thi Bàn (9) là 54 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 6.000.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực thực phẩm.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là sản xuất & buôn bán thức ăn.

2.  N. Thị Hoa (7) là 39 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 6.000.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực dịch vụ.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là vận hành công việc kinh doanh trên cơ sở dịch vụ.

3.  N. Thị Hà (11) là 44 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 6.000.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực bán lẻ.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là buôn bán hàng gia dụng.

4.  Lê Thị Hiền  (10) là 37 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 6.000.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực thực phẩm.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là sản xuất & buôn bán thức ăn.

Về Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women:

Nhiệm vụ của Quỹ vì Phụ Nữ Nghèo Thanh Hóa (FPW) là cung cấp các dịch vụ tài chính bền vững cho những người phụ nữ kém may mắn ở các vùng nông thôn tỉnh Thanh Hóa.

*Lưu ý: Để phát huy tối đa hiệu quả & giảm chi phí, khoản vay này đã được thông báo bằng biểu mẫu để có thể được Kiva tự động biên dịch. .  Do việc biên dịch thủ công các danh mục rất tốn kém, nên Kiva đã tạo biểu mẫu này cho phần Field Partner (Trường Đối Tác) cho phép họ tiếp tục thông báo các khoản vay bằng  Vietnamese trong khi cung cấp thông tin có chất lượng & chính xác cho người cho vay Kiva.  ."
